cQceiZo7RBZJJKn21c_Zqw.text: Wanted to try a new bar. Nice open and always looking for a good Happy Hour. Sat at the bar greeted with smiles and the bar tenders are ready to please. Jeff even went out of his way to check on some info for me about a city I was interested in going to in the future. We had already ate, so had a few drinks....excellent. From what I saw the pizzas look good, have a few more days in Vegas, hope to try one.

UIdURH7B-HjHhRFlewbZcQ.text: They suckered me by just smelling the pizza as I walked by! But what really got me was their wine special...was really wanting a very good glass of wine on this last night of our adventure.   Never did get their pizza, although I seen it pass by a few times...Ordered their lemon Veal, and it was simply amazing. could cut through it with your fork. The waitstaff here was spot on, and the atmosphere and decor of the restaurant was beautiful...felt like you were in a little eatery in Italy. The prices are right...you get a good size portion - didn't order any appetizer...although they did bring out this very fresh, warm bread...which hit the spot! Was so hungry!   the wine was brought out in a little glass canister, and was enough for two glasses.  Really enjoyed my dinning experience here, and I ate alone. Just sat back, relaxed and people watched.

V9WilKBnpa5BBr3GlDZiYA.text: The bread is the only thing delicious here. Service was poor,, Cesar Salad taste rotten!! Fettuccine chicken was bland!

Z6qR-TRwpwHczu_3l8nLoA.text: Food is good but the wait staff is VERY SLOW and the Hostess is RUDE'. Won't go back.

y5qst6wKHABnkh8iRTtO-A.text: We had a terrible experience.  Our server was doing an OK job till he told us he had to go on break and someone would be taking care of us.  In the fifteen minutes that he was gone, not a single person came to check on us or clear our plates.  The bread was good and that's it. UGH!! I ordered the lasgna and honestly it ididn't even look, smell, or taste like real meat.  I sweat it looked like some kinda of mystery meat and it smelled terrible after i scooped it off the layers and set it to the side.  I felt sick after eating and all I had was the layers of noodles and the cheese.  My friend had some kind of pasta and said it was too sweet.  Poor service. Terrible food.  Overpriced.  I will not be going back. Stay away. Try Trevi at Caesars--way better!

PKITcwWX2b85y1MvjsahUA.text: I took my girlfriend here for our anniversary dinner because we were staying at the hotel. We ate dinner here and it was bellow par than any other Italian food restaurant I have ever been to. The portions were very small and over priced. The chicken marcella for almost $30 looked like a kids menu portion. Next time I will goto Olive Garden and have better Italian food and their food isn't very good.

vAhsOnMydgx2NGD3bjvkBA.text: Had dinner here with my wife, cousin and his wife. We are big foodies when it comes to Vegas. I'm happy to say that we did not go wrong when deciding on this restaurant. Everything was fantastic from the stuffed mushrooms (to die for), to their shrimp cocktail. Everything that we ordered that night was full of satisfying flavor. Very happy, can't wait to come again. Don't forget to try the mojitos!

MP1MVY8DhG-bq8EIXfjoWw.text: I've never had a bad meal here. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but it's some of the best Italian food I've had. Love the thin crust pizza. Lasagna is the best I've found.   Extensive wine list. A plus in my book.

2Fudjp6azaRK26rif6vidA.text: We decided to go to Grotto again for dinner prior to another show at the Smith Center. This time it gets five stars. We arrived about 20 minutes late because of parking and traffic. We were sat quickly and told our server we were running behind. She was super nice took out full order and promised to help us make our show. Thirty minutes later we were on our way to the show. We had the lasagne which was very good. We have another show to see in about a month and we will definitely choose Grotto again.

dhPL5V57YrG98C9mjjC4dQ.text: Stayed at the Golden Nugget this past weekend and happened to eat at this place inside.  It was really delicious.  We ordered the pepperoni pizza and caprese.  The ingredients were fresh and I love, love, love the super thin crust on the pizza.  My husband and I split both items and there was nothing left.  Service was excellent, even on a Friday night which was extremely busy.  Yummy, recommend if you like good, fresh Italian food.

MQL-fd0Rx3TU8ZWjmfesWw.text: First of all our server, Kim did a wonderful job. I had the chicken marsala. It was a little light on the sauce for my taste but Kim quickly brought me extra. It was so good I ate every bite on the plate. Everyone in my party thoroughly enjoyed the meal. The bread was delicious and all the food was very fresh.

I5UQ1ZrWe7tG8MeA6OyNEA.text: Myself and my party had an excellent experience eating while served by Angela. We thoroughly recommend coming here. Thank you for going above and beyond while serving us!

L9rjV1HRaGte-zWxd8t1Bw.text: Really good food, reasonably priced!  Service was amazing. Sat at the bar and had Jeff as our bartender.  Even though it was busy, it felt like we had our own personal server.  Try their thin crust pizzas... out of this world.

u6jhINkqQSe6dDvZbbA3Uw.text: Ate here twice while in Vegas in December (we stayed at the Nugget).  Very good food.  Try the pizza. It's amazing.

_ARINaWqRQj2KUiq0HQ92g.text: We had my Aunty's 80th bday party here Saturday night we had a group of about 36. This is located inside the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas. it was a set dinner course I had the breaded chicken with penne (can't remember the name) w/ a Caesar salad and dessert Strawberry cheesecake. Service was excellent here we had 4 people catering to us and all four of them were outstanding my other Aunt and I were the special ones at the table cause on my meal i didn't want mushrooms and artichokes mixed with the sauce on my chicken so the guy put the special order for me and my Aunt didn't want the Strawberry cheesecake or the chocolate cake that we had to choose from so the guy brought her ice cream instead. Another thing was i dropped one of my med pills it was a very small white round pill so as i looking under the table for it with flashlight and all the girl waitress came over got on all floors to look for it way beyond the call of duty we couldn't find it luckily i had extra. She was a trooper going underneth the table and all. I would definitely come back here to eat again. Overall great food and great to see family that came from Ohio, Texas, and Hawaii. Sorry no pics i chowed down my food so fast lol.

O2Mphwv7T1TrvhMw361K8g.text: Although the food had excellent flavor, 2 out my group of 4 had severe food poisoning. I myself had the Lobster Bisque, which had excellent flavor but had a tiny amount of lobster in it. The two that got sick had their pepperoni pizza and the lasagna. Didn't expect to spend the last day in Vegas recovering...  Prices were fair and service was great.

WHNPj6ID5e-jF2F8Z1668Q.text: I guess I missed the fine print when I was looking for a late night snack.  There is a happy hour menu after 10:30pm (or maybe it was 10pm).  I went to the hostess in order to place a to go order to take back to my room, but she told me that I had to order at the bar.  I went to the bar and asked about happy hour and the bartender said I had to wait a few minutes.  So I decided to wait.  He did not however say anything about having to eat in restaurant.  After waiting, I went back and tried to get a pizza to go.  I got the receipt and the pizza was $18 - full price.  I asked about the happy hour menu and was told I had to eat there.  I was not in the mood to argue or sit there so I just took paid and waited for the pizza.  All I got was a plain pepperoni pizza.  It was pretty good.  A little salty and the sauce made the crust a little soggy because it was pretty thin.  Not really worth $18, but I guess that's what I get after gambling all day and forgetting to eat dinner.

u0hVGJZTyWDphYEKqKT62A.text: Here on business. Daniel was my server and did a fantastic job. Very helpful in making decisions and explaining the menu. The view of the pool is amazing. Ordered artichoke dip and the penne garneri al limone. Wow! Def a must go to.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-y0r2Ukn5XnUFe-2lCmaxA.text: I know when you think fremont street there is nothing great to eat but I found grotto. The golden nugget seems to always be busy and we had a gift card for grotto. Service was good, BEST chicken parmesan ever! Outstanding cheesecake and the grotto red blend house wine is super delicious. I never would think a house wine would be good. The pasta was nothing crazy and the salad too. The prices were equivalent to Carraba's.   PROS: Grotto house wine, chicken parmesan, cheesecake, service CONS: Pasta, salad  Get the seats by the aquarium!

BVePihBwHFWd9o5DTnj0ng.text: Sat at the bar for a quick glass of wine and to order some food to go. I ordered A glass of red wine. It was good, i don't know if it was worth 9$ a glass though. The bartender seemed a little mad I wanted half spinach, half romain on my Cesar salad. I'm picky, but I am nice about it. We ordered the spinach pear Gorgonzola pizza. It came out cold, and wasn't that amazing. Probably wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita pizza

PsOdqMYjthzl4opthxe_iw.text: We come to Vegas frequently for Trade Shows and Grotto is always a required stop. Never had a bad meal here, but there is ONE thing that keeps us coming back: their lasagna is spectacular.  Ask for a table across the hall overlooking the pool and the shark tank for a great dining experience.

cjhIMc9RlppF7FgsJjEesA.text: We loved this restaurant. It gives a great view of the pool. Makes me wish I was staying in the Golden Nugget. If I ever decide to stay in old Vegas again, this is THE spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wish I had room to try the dessert
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels to die for!!!!
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful &amp; delicious

uRBVkDyJbdAoJTYY4pjEoA.text: This place is amazing, authentic Italian food, friendly staff. Pizza is amazing. Warm and welcoming.

Mb5jxEFUiL2lsG9GiNzU3g.text: Great food, good service. They have a very good variety of Italian dishes, all prepared well at very reasonable prices. This will certainly become one of our regular stops when we visit downtown Las Vegas.

I0OjyHTTijJowmGbrD8CnQ.text: Amazing food. Great service. Awesome thick rustic bread they brought for the table. Orange creme brulee was to die for

QrG_aHKDlxKwzTUNMR2zgA.text: Literally every restaurant my boyfriend and I tried to go to had a ridiculously long wait, but what do you expect in Las Vegas? We walked around and decided to eat at the Golden Nugget because that is what we were closest to. The Golden Nugget has a 9 different restaurants inside and Grotto happens to be among them.  My boyfriend and I were sat immediately. Our waiter was very punctual. He got our drinks quickly. He gave us enough time to look over the menu. We received fresh bread with an olive oil blend, which I loved.  My boyfriend ordered their 4th of July drink special. It was a margarita that was red, white, and blue. It was $7.99; there was quite a bit of alcohol in it, and the price wasn't bad. For our entrees, my boyfriend ordered the Meatzza and I ordered the cannelloni. The cannelloni looks somewhat like a pasta burrito. They use a homemade pasta shell that's flat like a tortilla but fluffier and airier, then the pasta shell is rolled with chicken and spinach in it with bechamel (white sauce) and marinara (red sauce) on top. The Meatzza is their signature pizza that is topped with pepperoni, homemade meatballs, Italian sausage, and pancetta. It was good, but I thought my cannelloni was better. :)  Our server was probably one of the best servers we have had. He was on top of it and his accent made us feel like we were in Italy. We just wish we could remember his name so everyone on Yelp could ask for him if given the chance to eat here.

fkO19leFteoNJqi9c5oCNw.text: Saw that they had chicken parmesan for $10 and decided to stop in.  It came with a nice portion of spaghetti in tomato sauce and the chicken parm was perfectly seasoned and cooked.  It was a decent portion as well and it definitely filled me up.  They have medium pizzas for $8 during happy hour and other food and drink items to choose from.  Service at the bar was great.  I would come back for it if I'm ever in the area.  3.5 stars

YhgB915RcQ5hFBOwQpHfSQ.text: Oh my gosh! What an awesome place to eat! Robert, the manager was so personable. We felt like we were the only ones here. We had the meatballs to start and they just melted in your mouth. We also had the margheretta pizza (order to crispy) and it was the best pizza I've had in forever. Jason wad our waiter and he was absolutely awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xVoesC919Hb8D451W5MRwQ.text: Delicious food, wonderful staff, warm atmosphere.  We could not have had a better time.  We go to vegas frequently so we will definitely be back.  If you want really great italian food, go here!

VRvf7jYeUHs0MRS9jX6ReA.text: Service was good; however, food was average. The calamari were ok. The pizza was ok but the lobster soup literally sucked....watery and bland. Next time will be better maybe

jFGNHDCHGC33l4yZ0VngJg.text: The food was average (except for the desserts which were excellent)  but the service was very good.

UIt6HdgEZ7KgPojeS24Byw.text: Oh my amazing! How can I express in words what we experienced last night? Our waitress attended to every need-including my dietary issues. The chef prepared an amazing GF & DF pasta for me that I keep dreaming about & want to eat again. This place is a True find for us Vegas locals. We can't wait to go back!!!

abpkR7kFU3Y_LqB7iDw5Ow.text: Incredible service and nice atmosphere.  Average prices but the night we went they had chicken parm served with angel hair pasta for $10. It was delicious! Would definitely eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rQv31lKDc-mshs1W-1a64w.text: Best authentic Italian food in California! We had the Lasagna Il Forno & the Cannelloni, both of which were delicious beyond words! My husband has never been a fan of Italian food, but after eating the lasagna here, he's found his new favorite of all time. The prices are modest when you consider the quality of the food here is on par with any high end Italian restaurant you'd find in major cities like NYC or Chicago or even anywhere in Italy. I highly recommend Grotto to anybody who appreciates truly delicious food.

qlfy9hpluB7OjXTuhj0smg.text: Hubby and I stopped in here last night for a simple dinner. We don't do the fancy steak houses when in Vegas. Grotto seemed "ok" at first. Not at all crowded (the Rams game was playing) most people were in bars elsewhere. We asked the Hostess (dark hair, about 25) what she'd order and she described a few entrees as if she were a chef. How they were prepared, etc. We KNEW we'd found the place for us. Mouths watering we told her, "Yeah, yeah we'd like a table, please." Our water and bread came quickly with a nice garlicky olive oil. I knew what I wanted thanks to the Hostess, but the hubby wanted to know if they could do a simple pasta not on the menu. He asked our server, a woman about 50, short light hair, and she immediately knew the pasta dish (aglio olio), suggested a pasta shape to go with it and the hubby was IMPRESSED! We decided to grab the stuffed mushrooms as well and I'll never eat another stuffed mushroom again without comparing them to these. Seriously, if you're ever in Vegas, do yourself the immense honor of going to Grotto in The Golden Nugget, get the mushrooms. Before they're delivered, get ready. Cleanse your palate. No seriously fruity drinks or breath mints (dear God, no!) and realize that your "stuffed mushroom life" will change forever. We went on January 12, I hope all that worked that night get a special thank you from us. We recognize that to put together a meal like this takes a team. Hats off to all of you!

1djeeywcDARTdT7yuCjqew.text: I stopped in here my first night in Vegas and the waitress forgot my dessert. Service was also off. After mentioning this in my initial review, Upper management reached out to me to make things right. I then went back with a party of 9 people and they were exceptional! Jose our waiter was on point with service and even took photos for us! The food and appetizers were very good, everyone had a great meal and a great time! Thank you guys for making us fans! We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most amazing strawberry short cake that we labeled &#34;Strawberry TALL Cake&#34;
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The infamous dessert cart!
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis came to dine in the Grotto that night so it must be good!

Er1K7WqYruMojp5JlDKEyw.text: We waited so long to get any service, after being seated. 25 minutes for us to get water and our order in. No bread until we got our food, no water refill until we received our check. Inexcusable on the management's part. The waitress was running around as fast as she could, but simply had too many tables. Get more people. Your food is delicious and fine, but your service totally ruined my taste buds. With so many options, I'll definitely avoid this place.

A72aG1Qidb6lI_yF1nRz5A.text: Service was good, fast. Food was adequate for the price.  We we hoping for something more as far as authentic Italian flavors- nothing was bad but nothing was really good either. Cigarette smoke floated in from the casino making the atmosphere less pleasant.

I6dyiYp6SVno9ht-3qoUrg.text: My food was good, but my fiance's dinner was a different story. He ordered a simple dish of spaghetti and meatballs. He found a hair in the spaghetti, removed it and found multiple short, black hairs throughout the dish. It gave a new meaning to angel hair pasta   The waitress and manager were very apologetic and did the most they could to make things right. I do recommend they have a good tiramisu.

0Gb7MLLBDlbHTGc7BPE5pg.text: My husband and I took my parents here when they visited last week. We are special case because my mom is very allergic to onions. Italian is not a cuisine we usually have much luck with since pretty much everything has onion. We asked the waitress, a very lovely woman I cannot remember her name, what didn't have onion to narrow down the sizeable menu. She went to the kitchen to check with the chef whom came to our table to speak with us. Not surprisingly Chef Paul (I believe was his name. Many cocktails were had that night lol) informed us essentially all dishes were made with onion and since it's in the sauces there wasn't an option to make them without. BUT if there was anything she wanted even if it was off menu to let the waitress know and he would oblige. My mom ordered a Shrimp Scampi with Linguini and she could not stop praising the flavor! She was especially grateful for the understanding.  As for the rest of us, we all thoroughly enjoyed our meals and the desserts were phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

36ra4P00X0rozl4k0AWAKw.text: Very expensive for the quality of food you are getting here.  Spaghetti bolognese was not amazing at all.  I've had better in Nebraska.

jAPW5xK7tA35uvj3Y325uQ.text: What a great surprise. Needed to get a quick meal after hours of poker. Really good Italian food. Service was quick and the food was really good. Romano crusted chicken and pasta was outstanding.

qx3TlsMD8bCds_q7RksSFg.text: Had a great dinner.  Relaxing atmosphere and our waitress,Cynthia, gave us recommendations for dinner that were excellent.

dGzY5RTX142YBy3Tj-DWaA.text: Excellent dinner and even better service! The kids loved their spaghetti and meatballs. The dang meatballs were the size of softballs and very tasty! We shared the seafood pasta which was outstanding as was the lobster bisque. Oh, and the bread.....the best I've ever had!  A real surprise for a hotel restaurant!

wQhF3uDYFiVapd8tC6Wbpg.text: Food was phenomenal.  Waiter was knowledgeable and gave great recommendations. Top notch service in all areas.

WIBWOAb7rJU6GM4jbMpbBQ.text: The food's actually pretty good. The service, however, is not.  Water was not refilled for the entire meal. Four water glasses sat empty for literally an hour. Other empty glasses from wine and soft drinks were never picked up. Not even after the bill arrived. The empties just sat there.  Our server was loud and sorta cocky. Which actually can be an asset in some cases. But this guy couldn't pull it off...and, based on our experience with him, he had no justifiable reason to be so self-confident in his style.  Food, though slow to arrive, was pretty good on the whole.  Half of the table enjoyed salads and they were quite flavorful, particularly the mixed greens with beets, pears, and pomegranate dressing. Very nice.  The cannelloni was out of this world good. The portion was only two noodles. I could've eaten a thousand. Fantastic!  The least successful entree at the table was a pizza, which had a droopy, limp crust, sparse toppings and little cheese. If  you go--and that should be a BIG "if" in my estimation--take a pass on the menu's pizza section.  After such good food, I was ready to forgive the lackluster service. But that's when Mr. Cocky Server came back and took our final drink orders: a couple of wines, a coffee, and a refill of Coke. "Got it," he said, "two Merlot, a coffee, and a snort of coke." WHAT? Who says that? I wanted to kick him in the nuts for fucking up a perfectly good meal with friends.  The good food is not worth the awful service in my book. I'd rather go to an Olive Garden. At least the server there wouldn't cap off the evening with narcotics jokes.

3PDQ4mSl23qboM8b9rWltw.text: We Keep Returning, It's Good"  Service, excellent! Food, very good. We all enjoyed our meals... but, I ordered the chicken diavolo and it didn't have any diavolo (spice heat). Otherwise it was still good. Objection... coffee at $3.50 is a little out of whack compared to the rest of the menu pricing.

sFpJkdkg6y3NnSs4AONzvA.text: My husband and I landed here for dinner last night. We were looking for a good place off Fremont that wasn't super expensive. We found it!  Their bottles of wine are cheaper here compared to other Vegas restaurants. Cakebread was $84 instead of the usual $100. I didn't really compare prices on the rest of the bottles.   I got the ravioli alla vodka, which was $16.99. For how much I got it seemed a bit high in price to me. However, my husband got a fettuccine dish that was huge and only cost a dollar more. So, I guess the value varies depending on your dish. Both dishes, however, we're delicious.   Our waitress was very nice and checked on us regulalrly. She was also knowledgeable about the menu (which is quite extensive).

S8PrSJWyrvj6QCxvuQqUaQ.text: Came here with a group of 5 other ladies with reservations. We were a few minutes late but I called and they were very polite about saving out reservations. We were seated right in front of the swimming pool with the shark tank so it was a great view (although if you don't want to see half naked people while you are eating you might want to sit inside).   We had one drunk person in our group who was having a lot of trouble ordering (and comprehending anything). Our server handled it amazingly. He pointed out something he recommended so we ordered it for her. When he brought it, he let us know he would bring something else if she didn't like it. Luckily she LOVED it! The bread and dipping sauce was amazing. I had the spaghetti Bolognese and it was just okay.   The only time the service was noticeably slow was when we were waiting for our checks. The restaurant seemed to also get busier (around 8pm).   There was a walkway splitting the restaurant, so you do get some sketchy people walking by. But we didn't have any problems.

4v_sgO_ALmS7mNgFC-oWng.text: We came to the Golden Nugget to see a show. We got here early so we felt we had time to eat in one of their nicer restaurants. We had not tried the Grotto for a long time. There was no wait and we were able to get a table close to the window overlooking the pool and the shark tank. On the positive side, the service was outstanding. Our waiter came to our table within minutes of sitting down, explaining the daily special and taking our drink orders. The busboy brought the bread almost immediately. It was delicious. It came with olive oil. He also brought a flavored butter that was excellent. I was disappointed that the restaurant only had two beers on tap. However I was able to order their Sin City Amber. It was excellent. We started with their Italian chopped salad. It was just ok. We had it with their bleu cheese dressing. The bleu cheese dressing was just tasteless. For the main course, we had the chicken cacciatore. This was also fairly devoid of flavor. There was a small amount of vegetables that came with it. Again, almost without flavor. Overall, five star service brought down to a three star rating because of the quality of the food. I don't think I will be back. There are too many other good dining  choices in the downtown area, even within the Golden Nugget.

SDGi3YZfA6d_sP6uEY7HRQ.text: Service was slow despite the restaurant being empty. Food was actually good. Everyone in my party enjoyed their meal. The problem is that I had the Italian meat panini and got horrible food poisoning from it. Finally feeling better after 24 hours of hell. Will probably never return after this experience.

A-If3n1W5IDjnlTrpiXBEg.text: Anybody who goes downtown must eat here.  We actually stay at the Golden Nugget in part because of this restaurant.  I was blown away to discover this is part of a chain. I find the food to be almost perfect everytime I come here.  The service and the setting are very good if not perfect. The food though is what steals the show at this restaurant. Every dish that you try explodes with flavor and freshness. I have been eating here for over 10 years and it is consistently 5 stars every time.  The grotto is not a good restaurant for downtown; it is easily one of the very best restaurants in all of Las Vegas.  They blow away most restaurants that are more than double the price. Get your Italian on and eat at this restaurant, you won't be disappointed.

7Jy730ib54YKYgZRvcBNJg.text: We had dinner here and the food was excellent and the service couldn't have been better! Thanks Jose!  We will be back for sure.

mHK02zT_ffc5_gPYKC-Aqw.text: Best Chicken Piccata I've ever had!!!! Actually one of the best meals I've ever had!!! Our server Darwin was awesome, very attentive but not intrusive. Part of the restaurant overlooks the beautiful pool with a huge aquarium in the middle. I will definitely be back the next visit to Vegas and Fremont.  Try the Creme Brulee it's orange instead of the usual vanilla and surprisingly delicious.

jIlHFP9JpSwwKXowsWwvmw.text: Happy hour specials looked good so stopped before checking out to catch an overnight flight.  $8 pizzas, sounded good!  Hard to find staff to assist, direct or seat people even with 3 behind the bar, so i checked with the hostess in back dining area.  She directed me where to sit (Happy hour specials only good at the bar.)  Pizza was large, enough for two as entree, or three if having other foods.  Sadly, my pepperoni pizza was full of olive oil and grease.  Service was lacking, I had to go grab bar drink napkins to soak up the oil/grease mess and had to wait for drink refills.  Note I wasn't drinking their happy hour specials, I had a soda with my meal.  Again waited for my bill to come, my server just seemed to disappear!  Asked for my bill after 12 minute wait (I timed it) and a gentleman who appeared to be the manager asked how I enjoyed my pizza.  I showed him the standing grease/oil on my pizza tray and the 5 or 6 bar napkins that were saturated.  He comped my pizza for which I was very appreciative, as I wasn't going to be there to give it another shot a different day.  Server indicated they do put olive oil on the crust to help brown it, but mine appeared to have more than a 'touch' on it.    Give this place a try.  Nicely priced happy hour specials and flavorful food but don't expect to be wowed with service.

LXm8w1ozT56DKP85YZsYvQ.text: GROTTOS HAS THE BEST PIZZA I have ever eaten!! (in Las Vegas). Being from Chicago this pizza is ... well, different....  I NEVER would have considered eating at the Golden Nugget. c'mon its reputation (to me) was an old dumpy casino in old dumpy downtown Vegas, but a co -worker recommended it so we gave it a try.   We sat at the bar, ordered a nice chardonnay and were happy to find out it was "happy hour".  for 7 bucks we had the most delicious  "Roasted herbed chicken and garlic, mozzarella, basil, caramelized onions, roasted tomatoes and goat cheese" pizza!!!  DELICIOUS.  I DEFINITELY WILL go back to GROTTOS!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. go for happy hour and sit at the bar.
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. best pizza i ever had (in las vegas)

5HXtVKIw3sEnR4OoOX7ykA.text: I was a bit concerned about the quality of a restaurant in the downtown Vegas hotel, but Grotto has given me new confidence.  We were received by a friendly hostess and seated a nice table overlooking the pool area (night-time).  Mark our waiter was very friendly, funny, and helpful.  He answered any questions about the menu and was particularly helpful with the wine list, noting several affordable options available from a recent event, not on the list.  Service was great throughout the meal and the food was very good.  We mostly had pasta dishes, which were all delicious. I'd definitely recommend it and will go back next time I'm staying downtown.

Q8kZ36mx7SK35AqcE_fP1g.text: I rarely hit up the Nugget, but not blind to the fact that it's probably the best hotel casino north of the strip.  My visit with a homie was due to a small wedding reception dinner at a nearby chapel.  Can you say elope?  Congrats to the love birds Moses and Bree!  Unfortunately, we missed the wedding reception by more than an hour, but made it for the dinner...you could say that we was behaving like we was really related to the bride and groom, lol.  So I played the role of that uncle that just comes through something on everything, and when everything is all "ate" and done, it's deuces! J/k...   At first glance, I thought this was just your average casino diner filed with transient d-bags, bit not at all the case.  A look at the menu, and a brief Yelp review, quickly changed my mind.  The use of space is efficient and doors a good job with separating the restaurant from the casino floor.  A view of the pool and shark tank was a pleasant surprise as well.    My buddy and I opted to split the chicken herb pizza since it was a small informal dinner with the bride and grooms closest associates.  There is also a full bar and local brewery beer selection.  That alone can make this man happy.  The pizza was astounding, anything with goat cheese is a major plus for me, bit the overall pizza was scrumptious nonetheless.  Although, our late arrival prevented me from peeping out everyone else's offers.  I love marveling over others' orders to plan my next attack, lol.  I did see some oversized meatballs and pasta specialties, enough to know there are some good stuff on the menu.  A return trip is in order the next time I'm downtown.  I would have to give this experience an overall 3.5, making it a 4-star review.  The pizza was superb and the drinks were flowing with attentive service.  Exceeding my expectations definitely played a part in the rating.  Mazal Tov!

bjQaM7kbmZcn9YL-n-R7NQ.text: Great food, drinks, and service! Definitely recommend this place to locals and visitors.

Jc7FKGOYn-OhqDohow04Qw.text: The restaurant is very clean and well presented upon entry.  My wife had the fried cheese ravioli, which was listed as an appetizer, for her meal.  I had the chicken alfredo.  The chicken was moist and cooked beautifully, just not blackened enough for my liking.  Overall the service was prompt and responsive.  For an appetizer, an entree, and 2 waters of this caliber I would expect to pay between $15 and $18.  Our bill was $28.    Again, I say you are paying for the service and location, not the quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fettucini Alfredo

hJvYWgO0kvZKoRD7qzOQFg.text: The Grotto is a fabulous restaurant in the heart of the Golden Nugget on Freemont Ave.  My sister and I have celiac disease and we found the staff to be very knowledgeable and courteous about our questions.  I had shrimp risotto which was incredibly delicious, but the gem of meal was the spinach that came with the chicken my sister ordered was the best thing we had on the trip.

6-pyBiWgqBAD8TsOj898Tw.text: Over all good experience and the food was good. I had the pizza and it was more then enough. They have a big stone oven, so the pizza came out hot and fresh. Good atmosphere.

5r01kb7r0TjZkG7WwXtINA.text: I got married in Vegas in April and I planned my entire wedding online via email and phone call - I worked with Jennifer - the Sales Manager there. She answered all my questions - and was very clear about how much things would cost. We reserved an area of the restaurant that is near the pool that is their Atrium. Although we had to "buy out" the space - it was worth the money.   On the day of the dinner, the service was amazing! We had a pretty large party consisting of 40 people - the waiters were on top of refills and getting the food to everyone at the same time. My guests also really loved the food (I did too)!  We paid extra to have a wedding cake and did it through the Golden Nugget's bakery. It was so delicious! We ordered the carrot cake and honestly it is one of the best carrot cakes I have ever tried.   The Sales Manager Jennifer was amazing! She even offered to meet me in person the day before so that if I had any more questions I could ask her in person and so that my husband and I can see what the Atrium looked like the day before.   As a side note - they also allowed us to bring out own centerpieces so it could feel more like a real wedding reception!   I really appreciated how accommodating the Grotto was to my needs for my special day! I highly recommend this place for a wedding dinner or large party because of the amazing service and delicious food.

dhJnmDX3vexX04xrIfW-SA.text: Food was great. Service was excellent. I give this restaurant a 2 thumps up. I ordered Lasagne Al Forno. Perfect portion.

7iuDGtOz9gtiPJFnBKm8UQ.text: This place is awesome  We live right down the street & wanted to try it as they have a $15 two course lunch which was phenomenal My fiance is from lobstah country & thought the Lobster Bisque was outstanding & the chicken scallopine was sooooo good . Service was great, overlooks the pool area, just a great environment for lunch . Very impressed & definitely will be back . They also have pizza for $10 at happy hour. As a local , I love having this amazing restaurant so close to home .

qXzsVZGrs2lFV8rSYRZotw.text: Happy Hour Mon-Fri 2-6p, Sun-Thur 10:30p-12a  Happy hour specials are $4-6 drinks and $8 pizzas.  $4 Grotto's Famous Peach Bellini was perfect.  Best bellini I've had.  The cocktails were just as good.  They have lots of fruity martinis which is my thing.  They put a bar munchies menu out at HH that seems to be regular pricing.  Portions are huge.  We were expecting smaller plates but they were full size (goes with pricing).  From the bar munchies menu we ordered Bruschetta, Bacon Mac & Cheese Bites, Spicy Chicken Sliders and Gorgonzola Fries.  Food was good but a little overpriced.  I would prefer smaller portions for HH.  It wasn't too busy on a weekday afternoon.  Our bartender was friendly and kept the drinks coming.  Works for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grapes of Wrath
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH Spicy Chicken Sliders
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH Bacon Mac &amp; Cheese Bites

IjsTMdfwpd9goQdwDfFz5Q.text: Excellent service Great food, being a vegetarian, loved the place. Great orange cream brulee!

VtUtOi3_kTSmy8ex_PBB3Q.text: This is fabulous place for happy hour.   Just visited again last week. This is a must for happy hour. Take your time and enjoy the people watching as you eat and drink while you too are being watched.  Manga

LYGuReh55vHUM0CseGulXA.text: First time at the Grotto. Got here early for our reservation and got right away.  Robert was very attentive. The atmosphere was lovely as was the decor.  Tried the meatball appetizer.  It was really good.  We tried the rigatoni, the chicken parmesan,  and the carbonara. All of the dishes were amazing.  Great flavor and good potion size.  We also tried dessert.  The chocolate cake,  the cheese cake and the strawberry Cassatta. They were huge and worth the price at $9.00 each.  They did not disappoint!

mulbB79m4QM2cUMZdLKXpQ.text: Last night I went to eat there with my friends and we had a  pleasant time.  Except for the fact that my glass of wine was not a complete pour, when compared to my friends pour.  But, wine is wine. That is not why I gave them one star. As we were leaving we ran into our other friends at the bar and that is when they told us that there was a cockroach on their pizza!  I kid you not!  There was a cockroach!  The manager came out and explained that they were sorry but the restaurant was old, and prone to things like this. That was the excuse!  To make matters worse my friends were not comped for their ruined pizza!  They got a new pizza but how could they eat it now?  They should have been comped the pizza and been given a better apology.  We are staying here for another week and will not be going back.

1z1gUJjaRYAK7cFPttIsPg.text: We ate here on 12-19-18.  The food was good.  The service wasn't.  The waiter was slow and inattentive.  He never checked on us to see if everything was okay, he never offered a second round of drinks.

M0T38M8DJzO37h4L2nFc0Q.text: Nice aesthetic but simply not for what they charge for food. Food was good, good, not GREAT. We came for a two for one coupon. Probably wouldn't come back without a coupon. Staff was great, Moscow mule was good and dessert was average.

Gin29-GXnXJiOQvi03gzxg.text: The elevated terrace at the Grotto bar is an excellent spot for Italian food, beer, a glass of wine or to nurse your favorite cocktail. I perch myself at one of the pub tables and watch the people traverse through the hotel/casino/pool area. The GN pool is right across the way for more people watching..such a prime scene!   ..And now for the good.. It's delicious.. I call up the Margherita pizza. Fresh basil, mozzarella, and delicious roma tomatoes. It's the best Margherita pizza in the business.. enough for two hungry people ready to conquer the Vegas scene. For appetizers, you can never go wrong with the crispy calamari..so darn good.   The bartenders and servers are always helpful and friendly, even when the place is packed!   Good Italian dishes and a prime viewing spot. Give Grotto a shot.. I'm never disappointed here. I will return on my next stay at the Nugget.

RMuE7hIIT9BZvyn__gzo8A.text: Our bad experience started long before the food came into play. Our server approached the table with a literal attitude of disgust.  We were a party of 9, we were all shocked with the servers attitude toward the table, we were NOT intoxicated,  we are a middle aged group , have no clue what his problem was. The bread was delicious, but that's where it ends. The chicken piccata was dry, tasteless, petrified pieces of chicken. The caprese salad had green tomatoes and no balsamic vinegar. Another couple had meatballs, dried out over cooked. I have eaten here on several occasions and loved the food, total disappointment. I don't see me eating here again while staying at the Golden Nugget

VUDxb5xIHRto3kWUiCIHCg.text: We arrived hungry at 4:30pm on Saturday.  It looked like there were plenty of tables, but we learned they were all reserved, but we were invited to sit in the bar. The four of us " bellied up to the bar" with Jose as our server/bar tender and had a lovely evening.    We ordered:  orecchiette Gorgonzola, bruschetta Spaghetti, meatzza pizza, and spaghetti Bologna's and an antipasti appetizer.  Every dish was very good.    We'll definitely return.  Jose was so friendly and personable.

Alenw9jrtI1GnwW_aQG_Ow.text: One thing I can tell you for sure - this ain't no Olive Garden.  This is REAL Italian food.  The sauces are thick and rich, the noodles thick and soft, the parmesan grated from a block of cheese - I think you get the picture.  This is also one of the places where you receive your order and say "That's it?" as the portions look small, but trust me - they fill you up because of the above.  Good food has nothing to do with quantity.    We sat next to the pool. but inside where the air conditioning felt wonderful. The service was spot on.  All in all - a perfect experience.

lLSFoRVkNEDX_ELy9wo1Mg.text: Staying here for a week, we thankfully found the Grotto for Happy Hour. This is an amazing place from start to finish. Watching them make 100's of great tasting pizzas from scratch was cool but the service was what truly made the afternoon an absolute joy. If you're lucky, ask if Leo is working. Never had better service...EVER! Without a doubt, we will return both on this trip and future ones. Thank again Leo, the Grotto and the Golden Nugget! You all are AWESOME! tripadvisor.com/ShowUser...

ww4-CxJ8KIf37KYv7snMxg.text: Really nice service. We were seated very fast. I recommend getting a seat near the water tank. The rotisserie chicken was delicious.

tzYZZMnhUoOrX34mCW4A0A.text: Went here with the wife and a friend Thursday night. We waited 10 minutes before our waiter came by and said he would be right with us. Five minutes later he was back and took our order of two medium pizzas and salad. Ten minutes later we got the salad. Ten minutes after that pizza arrived. Thirty five minutes to get two pizzas that they cook right near the bar. Food was excellent but the wait was ridiculous. Several empty tables around us too. Might try again for lunch.

_YC4spOVoN3mvD3M0Ij46w.text: Love this place. This is my second time In Vegas and my first time visiting Fremont street. My boyfriend found the Grotto online and we saw it had great reviews, so why not give it a try?  We had reservations at 5. We got there and the hostess told us that she could seat us but if we wanted to sit at a table in the bar area, drinks pizza and other apps were on happy hour so we gave it a try.  Turns out, we took the gamble and it paid off. Mike was our waiter and second to none. He was the only server In our area and took exceptional care of us. I think a lot of people forget that servers are people too and they aren't your servants (like other tables we're treating him), so we grabbed his attention, got to know him and I could not have asked for a better server.   Mike was personable, kept the drinks flowing until happy hour was over and provided amazing service. The food was delicious (one of the best pizzas in Vegas) and drinks were on point.   When I come back, I will most definitely visit the Grotto again. Great food, great drinks, and great people. It's in the middle of the golden nugget, so it's convenient and has a great ambience. Stop by and check it out - and remember, don't be rude to your server. They are people too and deal with a bunch of rude people, so don't be one. Ask for mike!

O9pAGUeG3wmQPmEB1-RunA.text: Went for lunch during the week. Simple menu. I did really like their Italian salad, the red wine vinegarette was fabulous. Otherwise simple Italian food. Nothing special.

SUlH2jJx_d7sgQCN_RbqBw.text: Great Italian restaurant inside the Golden Nugget. Drove to Vegas with my wife and daughter. I let my daughter Google and yelp top restaurants in Vegas. She came up with Grotto. We made her feel good and tried it out. My daughter and yelp were dead on. Great food, great service and a spectacular view of the pool & shark tank aquarium. We highly recommend Grotto. I would have given it 5 stars but it's  in downtown Vegas inside the Golden Nugget off Freemont St.

vp00IF3oKe0WqO8_O-dMnw.text: Worst dining experience of my life. Went here for dinner after my sister's wedding at golden nugget. Service was absolutely terrible and food was very basic and bland. Charged a separate fee on top of 18 % mandatory gratuity. Very disappointed on what should have been a special meal with my family. Save yourself the agony and go somewhere else!

DT7N0Uh0TXs44S5PpP2EOg.text: Had a wedding reception for a party of 20. The food tasted great, the service was wonderful and all of the food arrived to our table at the same time and all warm, which is difficult to do with a party that large. The manager was great and even comped us a huge piece of wedding cake. All of our guests enjoyed themselves and had a wonderful time.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dnPaFrL2uJXlsD0QA3twYA.text: Let me start this review off by bragging on the bread. Holy shizballs, the fresh baked bread with the basil and garlic infused olive oil was the bomb. I could have eaten that all day. I wish the other food was on this same level.  So, my first experience with the Grotto was ordering Chicken and Goat Cheese Pizza. The crust was just okay, but I loved the sauce and the goat cheese. The chicken unfortunately tasted boiled versus grilled so it gave a weird one note texture experience and almost blandness. I think I would have enjoyed the pizza as a vegetarian option better. Also, the price I paid for it made me shake my head. Vegas is overly expensive for no reason.   On day two, I was really wanting brunch and their brunch options caught my eye. I HAD to have the Ossobuco Hash. It sounded way amazing. So I ordered and I think it confused the waiter that I wasn't drinking. Look, the prices I've ran into have turned me almost tea totaller. Plus, watching drunk douchebags over the past 24 hours have turned me off.   So I order my food and I'm just people watching while trying to figure out if I can eat my food without choking on the fumes of cigarette smoke- because obviously it's 1995 vs 2015, and my food comes out, I look down and I'm immediately disappointed. I don't see any of the rich colors associated with Ossobuco. It just looks like shredded, boiled beef. Also, I was failing to see the hash part. But the biggest sin were the two petrified volley balls sitting on that plate masquerading as poached eggs. No cook with pride would serve that. No line runner worth their salt would approve that. No waiter paying close attention would let that mess make it to me. They were boiled eggs. For the amount of time I waited (and I'm an easy, easy going person to wait on) and knowing how many hands had to touch that plate, I was kinda livid. Well, more insulted. Not all of us are so drunk that everything looks awesome. I had to track down my waiter and tell him what was wrong and it's like he knew! I'm like WTF, if you knew the eggs weren't poached correctly, WHY would you serve them to me?! With no other moisture in the dish, it hinged on the runny yoke.   So he takes the plate and I wait some more. Finally a woman brings it out and she's cordial enough but something about her gave an air of agitation. Well excuse me doll face for having a sense of culinary pride. I thanked her for my order and was happy to see things looked right. I broke the eggs and was very pleased as the yoke ran beautiful on my plate. I tucked into the meal and it was okay. There were missteps pertaining to layered flavoring and again, the key ingredients of Ossobuco. It definitely wasn't bad, but it wasn't really good or great either. It was just okay.  Do I think I'll eat her again? Nah. I never want to return to Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Obviously the cook and I have different ideas what poached means. Also shredded beef is not what Ossobuco makes. Disappointed.

Fs1X2N2Lp5udZdVqIGliXg.text: Meatballs meatballs meatballs!! Some of the best I've had in long time!! So light and delicious! The tiramisu is a must!!   Watch out for the peppers that are served with the house salad. I tried cutting into one and ended up wearing some of the juice on my shirt...right before a show no less.  Service could have been a little faster that night, but they did have a banquet of over 20 people that night so it wasn't a big deal.

UU8kEN0t40p_OpfRqrpqFQ.text: Jeff Kucera, our bartender was amazing! Friendly, helpful, charismatic, funny, and on point! This is where we started our trip and we are pumped for a great weekend thanks to Jeff and the friendly staff at Grotto.

3mqLXI5NYJlWwyeflTpw0A.text: Love this place !!! Pizza is awesome !!! Jeff K. Is by far the best server I have encountered in a long time .. I have been back numerous times because of him , and will continue to visit whenever possible !!! Oh yeah and the peach Bellini's yumm !!!!

1aO5L7C5tBL068jOf04dRw.text: The meatballs and chicken dishes are great but the service is a boo boo.  The waiter forgot one of our meals plus we had to search for him.  If they improve their service, we will certainly come back.

S1qzl-l9aVNAg1qywqXR5Q.text: Portion size was too small for an adult. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Spaghetti is very inexpensive. I do not understand why they don't fill the bowl not give you a child's portion.The waitstaff was very good, very efficient. You might want to ask for an adult portion when ordering. When you order a $20 bowl of pasta it should fill you. I had to eat half of my wives ziti and meat sauce to feel satisfied.

_F06l9TjdByvUQtGBJtWkA.text: Large portions. Nice Italian food. Quick service. Pleasant experience overall. I'd definitely go back

Qm32YgjvTPiGVbxxzLmJXw.text: Excellent! came here last week with the bf because we were staying in the hotel and didn't want to drive to restaurants. it was christmas day so no reservations were needed. we got seated right next to the window so you can see the aquarium/pool. lovely view.   i see some comments here about good the bread was, but that was probably the least stand out thing about this place. i had the rigatoni salsiccia which was BOMB!! the server said it was going to be spicy but i was like, please woman i'm asian i can handle any spicy food. and sure enough, it wasn't :( but still delicious. so many restaurants have bland pasta but this is not one of them. the bf had the roasted herb chicken pizza which is fair in size and sooo goood. the goat cheese was divine. oh yea and the lobster bisque!! might be the best one i've ever had!

ZdgucY58YLQBwp-p2-i0_w.text: Nestled inside the bustling Golden Nugget Casino and Hotel, this Italian eatery boasts the staples, like pizza, chicken parm, caprese salad...you get the gist. Though, I usually appreciated open quality of all the restaurant casinos in Vegas, this spot was a little too open to the guests moving in out of the Golden Nugget. It's no shocker when people are havin a good time in Vegas. Even being drunk at 2pm is a normal circumstance. I guess it's just not always appreciated while you're trying to enjoy a nice midday salad. Especially when you are there at the restaurant to escape the craziness that comes in out of the casino.  Don't get me wrong, I realize I need to stop by belly aching. It's Vegas after all: I just need to get used to it or get out; however the interruptions were incessant. If the restaurant was just a tad more closed off, it would be a quaint restaurant with actually very delicious food. In fact, the pizza sizes are generous and the Italian Chopped salad is topped with a lot of grilled chicken. The server was incredibly nice and patient with my parents who can be a tad overwhelming with requests.

wudbWjh9Hn742UPcTPCDYg.text: The food was amazing, the servers are great, she refilled my soft drink a few times before I even got my entree. She accidentally made a mistake with my order; the restaurant was loud and she might've misheard. But then had it corrected right away and even went as far as to take it off the bill because it was her honest mistake. I appreciated that so much. I would come back here for the service. It's a little slow, but it's understandable because it was busy and the food was very fresh.

ruq1Z2JwLXYsKEJj5-r0jA.text: Food is wonderful, but poor service completely negates the experience. Following a 45 minute wait for the ticket, the manager casually strolled over to say "in good faith, I'll give us a free appetizer". His names is James. Beware!

9SDsdPxuGQNLPgB6uNkNbQ.text: This is my family, especially my fathers, favorite place to eat .. Not just in the Golden Nugget, but in all of the downtown area .. Great pizza, pasta, salads & soup .. Gotta sit in the bar area .. Hopefully Jeff Kucesa takes care of you .. He's the best!!

rHb3EjmaQUZo-rDK1Amjig.text: Pleasantly surprised!  Large portions. Chicken Milanese was delicious. Kids loved the bolengnese. Salted caramel cheese cake was to die for!

cPt0rbtCUyWOpFVSSiFDJw.text: We stayed at the Golden Nugget our first night in Vegas and decided to eat here for our first night. We wanted to watch the 49er's v Bears game and this spot was the only area that was not so packed (we sat at the bar). No we are not Bears or 9er fans, we're Seahawks fans and wanted to watch the 9er's lose (to which we did!) since the Hawks last this tragic day :(   ANYWAY, we had a great time here! The food was really good, a little pricey though. Our bartender was new, meaning one of his first days or something. He was very friendly and made us great drinks. We'll probably end up eating here again when we come back to Vegas, but not in the bar area this time since the rest of the restaurant  looked very cute, intimate, and romantic. Totally recommend this spot.

bBLCMjCO-LW3vC7EkBOrEw.text: Please tell housekeeping to dust your Bar such as the pictures I have submitted located behind the bar as your eyes travel up. That's a game changer for people with allergies and it makes patrons thing seriously about when you had the bat cleaned last time. I am sorry I don't want to hear the Grottos bartender tell me well I keep telling my bosses and they don't do anything about it and I have asked for a long time. You know GN that pathetic...I don't want to look at dusty bottles while eating my food. I do way too much business here with my patrons I recommend to stay here. What's wrong with you, your management is lazy... Shame on you
