xUzfa0DK2NvymqZPWtaLBg.text: This was the best dinner (and cheapest) we had while in Vegas. The server was friendly and checked on us frequently. My husband and I split a Margherita pizza and the Rigatoni Salsiccia. Both were delicious. The pizza was the best I've had in a  long time. Also split the chocolate cake which was so good.

KjXH9_Wcg8-3jY33zY994A.text: Grotto has a great happy hour special. I was really wanting some chicken Parmesan so I skipped the big list of happy hour food on special and went straight for the chicken parm. It was the best I've ever had. I paired it with the happy hour Pinot noir. I told myself I wasn't allowed to eat all of it but i totally didn't. If you're in the Fremont area and want Italian (or great food in general), go to Grotto!

1A-xZ9UDMJtdP68O3fgzYA.text: We were unable to dine here in the evening because there was an hour and a half wait for a table so let that be your guide  We did have pizza during our stay by the hotel pool from Grotto  The pizza was thin like we like it and very good

QGzmASGDlPxyUre1O4nKzw.text: I was staying down at The Plaza for a week long event and was dying to get out of there.  So my friend and I took a stroll down Freemont Street and happened upon the Golden Nugget.  We cruised in and found the Grotto.  Italian food...PERFECT.  It was a Tuesday night but it was very crowded.  We were seated within a few minutes and the gluttony began.  We started with Stuffed Mushrooms...always a perfect start.  We ordered a bottle of Reisling Wine...can't remember which brand but it was good.  We both left with a little buzz and that was even after we ate so much.  Next we moved onto the Tomato Caprese Salad...delicious.    For my main course I ordered the Penne Diavolo and my friend got the Seared Sea Bass.  Both dishes were superb.  And what meal wouldn't be complete without a little Creme Brulee to top it off.  Our service was excellent and the food was wonderful...by far the best meal I had my entire stay in Vegas.  We had to walk around Freemont Street to keep from going into a food coma but it as well worth it.  I'll be back here again the next time I'm in the area!

kOM8tip7ETRUmax5vFr5gQ.text: Came in for lunch today because honestly we were too hungover to venture out of the hotel. The food portions were quite large. But the service was TERRIBLE. And it wasn't a busy time either. We saw our server three times total. To order our food, bringing us our food, and then the checks. Which even after asking for the check we waited ten minutes to get that. The food was mediocre. At least the spaghetti and meatballs were. My friends panini was delicious though. Our waters were always empty. Only got one refill (when he brought our food). If the service wasn't so bad the whole situation may have been different. Wouldn't go back again.

DVvx9-EVRqNcMRkLtt0iQg.text: I was tooling around Fremont and got a hankering for some red sauce italian. Grotto at the Golden Nugget was just what i needed.  I had the rigatoni bolognese and meatballs.  It looked delicious. It didnt blow me away but it was enjoyable. The taste is roughly on par with an Olive Garden but with better presentation in a better atmosphere.  The bolognese sauce was on the sweet side and the meatballs were pretty bland.  I suppose if you have an aversion to heavy amounts of garlic or cheese then this is ideal.  Prepare to augment with grated parmesan or even salt and pepper.   Despite the negatives I brought up, i would hit Grotto again next time Im in the area.

IDD5sW41cPjTqVA7FNH-xw.text: Everything was OK. I wasn't impressed with my options, but the others I was dining with seemed impressed and really enjoyed their food. The menu had a good selection. There is breakfast pizza that looked a lot better then my corn beef hash.   My only real issue with the place was the service. It started out really well, but then went down hill. Once we got our food we were no longer important enough.   It was a pretty place and a nice location in the Nugget between the casino floor and the pool.

z9Xg0Et3Yd2bA29J8Dbq4g.text: There is nowhere else like The Grotto!!! The food is simply awesome!  Try the meatballs as an appetizer, they are so light and fluffy they are hard to explain.  You can't have a bad meal here

XeeKAH6S8U3u1GDVo0YrnA.text: Great view of the pool and good food. I've dined here twice and cannot find any fault in the food. I would strongly refer this to family, and friends.

yAyl0lfGYbggTTPhkRFIvA.text: Reasonably diverse selection on the menu with classic dishes and stuff for culinary adventurers. My friend was raving about the peach Bellini and my chicken marsala was amazing. My husband had the veal parm and specifically sent his thanks to the chef because it was perfect. The server was cheerful and attentive without being overbearing. They were one of a handful of restaurants that weren't diners or fast food that still open after the concert we went to was done. My only complaint was that it was louder than I would have liked but I would absolutley go back.

pKJtq83C4pxfgUJkc4NqFg.text: Great happy hour! The mussels were delicious and loved the thin crust pizza!!  Definitely recommend!!!

nu3LDYDfvU70luRBA-xtJQ.text: Enjoyed two fabulous lunches at this beautiful restaurant inside the Golden Nugget with great decor inside or views overlooking the busy pool area with huge shark tanks..  The chicken Marsala wAs one of the best I've ever had, rich and delicious atop of tender risotto.  The side veggies the chef made for us included various squash, which was super fresh and perfectly all dente.  The pizza was good though a little soggy.  The service and the wine list was superb.  Best of all, it doesn't not break your piggy bank.  I look forward to returning.

OCdjO5Um9JAJja7pr1lr0g.text: Excellent food. So it pains me to give so few stars. But the service is terrible. Staff is very nice but incredibly slow. Waited 15 minutes when we got here before anyone came by. Then waited another 15 to have one (bottled) beer brought to the table. Since finishing our meal, we have now waited a grand total of 39 minutes to pay our bill. It looks like they just don't have enough people on staff because these two girls are hustling, but it appears that they are the only two servers on the floor. Hire on some extra help guys! I don't mind waiting for food (it actually came out fairly quick once we ordered) but to have to wait this long for service is kind of ridiculous, especially during happy hour.  Again, super sad to say this because the food was great, but I definitely would not come back :(

EfUz4Boq4CAOrW28zL2mxg.text: Found a gem tonight. Since we were staying at the Golden Nugget, my wife suggested going here for dinner, and, after reviewing Yelp food photos, we decided on Grotto as much to avoid going outside in the heat as to appease the appetite the pictures generated.  First if all, consistently throughout our dining experience, Jeninne, our service specialist, took very good care of our table of four. She kept our glasses filled without being intrusive. Our order was correct and delivered correctly to each party member. We had the Calamari appetizer which was tender, lightly breaded and lightly crispy. Not only delicious but plenty for our table. Lobster bisque and Tomato bisque very, very good. Ceasar salads were both completely consumed. Our table made a custom entree request for Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo, not on the menu. This was received by the staff as "Of course! No problem!" and the dish was reported to be very tasty. Also ordered was the Mahi, Piscatore and Spaghetti and Meatballs. We were offered a second basket of bread without asking. The only small criticisms were some dishes needed salt added and there was no Cannoli on the dessert menu. We took dessert back to our room for later as the meal was so tasty. The total tab ran about $50 per person but you could easily spend less here and be well satisfied for dinner.

EU4W3L3gglaxul7os6IoIw.text: We came here mostly because we were tired, staying at the Golden Nugget, and didn't feel like going too far out of the way. We sat in a part of the restaurant that is separated from the rest by one of the resort's pathways. In some ways, that was nice, because it felt a little more private, and at the same time you could people watch. On the other hand, service may have been slowed just a tad, due to location. The food was good, and the cocktails were nice. The tiramisu was OK. I did enjoy the dessert cart coming over to show us what we could choose from. Nothing very outstanding, but nothing bad either.

L-r30k1R0VX9DQwtkMa8vg.text: Came here with my mother when she was staying at the Golden Nugget for a business trip and I have to admit I had heard bad things and read some bad reviews but I was pleasantly surprised!  The only bad part of our visit was at the very beginning for me and I have read this to be True in some othe reviews on here as well. We had to wait a really long time at the Host desk to be greeted and seated and there were only 3 or 4 tables eating in the entire place there was really no excuse for the hostess to be MIA.  From there we got seated with a great view of the pool and we were introduced to our server. Great experience from there on out!  They brought out some ridiculously good bread with some oil and basalmic. We ordered a Margharita Pizza and a Casaer Salad to split and everything was incredibly good!  Great service and beautiful food at a decent price,  I will definitely be back!

1msGcGkD3aRZfK6qBcjNcA.text: I've dined here a couple of times for lunch. It's alright. Nothing ever stands out. And I never leave feeling like I just had a great meal. But it's good enough to actually eat it. So yeah...it's a-ok. The ambiance is more of a lower end casino cafe. The service is generally nice, but not exactly pleasant or attentive. Eh, it's all just fine.

PM48MwZJi7ERhbkxC6khcA.text: I had an absolute blast with Denise! she's my favorite waitress ever and she was the highlight of my trip! the bread and peach Bellini's are amazing!! I ate so much that I couldn't even make a dent in my pizza which was also incredible. 10/10 would recommend.

1pGJgX8l6JBecf8EUU7zwg.text: A Delicious Meal ! From start to finish, we loved our experience at the Grotto.  Our server, Steven, couldn't have been more pleasant and helpful.  After reading reviews we tried the meatballs and weren't disappointed.  My husband thought they tasted like mine, which he loves !  Our entrees were two pizzas as we love east coast thin pizza and it is hard to find.  This pizza was great....the crust was really thin, almost cracker like on the edges and so delicious.  I loved the flavor of the cheese.  Save room for dessert because the cheesecake is like we had in NY and they have a yummy angel cake with strawberries.  We were happy to take home half of our pizzas and half of our desserts.  Seating was comfortable, warm bread served when you are seated...a really first class experience !!

0ozYmxIsdNEYkVZPUbY8rw.text: Strumming through my Yelp bookmarks, I was unsure of where I'd like to go eat. You'd think with 75+ bookmarks, I could come up with something on the fly. Nope.   We were driving without a destination, with only the mutual purpose to find a restaurant somewhat near Cashman Field before Beau S. and went to the game. Remembering the wonderful smell wafting out of the Italian restaurant at the Golden Nugget two weeks prior, we ended up at Grotto.  At close to 5 PM yesterday (4/18/11) the place was empty. I don't know why but almost every time I go out to eat, the restaurants seem to be completely void of life. Our waitress took a bit to come take our order. Beau ordered an appetizer of fried ravioli after I noticed how small the $13 antipasti platter was that another table ordered. They were decent, but came with 8 pieces. I'm unsure of the exact price, but I know they were overpriced.  Beau ordered the chopped salad ($15) and I ordered the lobster bisque ($9) My soup was good but a bit small of a portion. Beau salad was more of a pulverized salad. The lettuce was chopped up into lady bug sized portions and he ended up eating the cheese out of it and leaving a bunch of salad still on the plate when we left.   The waitress was neither good nor bad. I think she forgot to bring us the bread basket and more refills would have been nice. Honestly, for $38ish, I think we could have gotten better food somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque. 4/18/11
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped salad. 4/18/11
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Ravioli. 4/18/11

OYcRvfYmPcnL51rwOWL1zQ.text: We wanted a special place to share an anniversary and birthday celebration so opted for this since it was convenient to our hotel. Ambiance was a bit too noisy for good conversation so if you want a quiet place to chat, this is not it.  Food was fine, a few notches above typical Italian and well done. One of us had an order that got mucked up but the waitress handled it beautifully and got the right one to us within about 10 minutes. The major disappointment was that management didn't come out to apologize, and nothing was offered as compensation for making 1 of us wait to eat while everyone else had their food.

hwotiPBFJVxTPzHZWIGAKA.text: The food was awesome. Jason was so friendly and accommodating, which made the food that much better.

esVFSt6VqFZ-sYxC9kj4cw.text: Excellent food! Really nice staff! The bread in the breadbasket was beyond delicious!!! Go for lunch and ask for the $15 lunch menu - you get the choice of 2 items- I had a salad and a chicken dish and it was delicious!!! It's a beautiful restaurant located inside the golden nugget on Fremont street - check it out- you won't be disappointed!!

9y70T74obGQWc-c65JJ93A.text: The food and service is great. Ask for Arturo. He is friendly and a fantastic person.

yw19puYXlXPtxhujnTJkVg.text: This was the best meal we have had thus far on this trip! The location was prime for old Las Vegas. What wowed us the most was the waiter. His attentiveness to us and he had perfect timing with his check ins. Our meals were phenomenal the gnocchi and chicken parm. On top of it, the drinks were really good! Would highly recommend this restaurant!  The price we paid was amazing for the food, quality, and service which was delivered!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dNyqWvE4JLea2Jy-WLWf0A.text: If the service wasn't TERRIBLE, Grotto would have gotten 4 stars because the food was delicious, but I am holding a grudge because of the service.  Located in the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street in DTLV, it is an upper-scale Italian restaurant.  I got the chicken parm, which was disproportionate with the pasta to chicken ratio...you'll be able to see in the attached picture.  There is legit one scoop of pasta and a chicken the size of my head.  It was still v good despite this.  Also got the calamari and lobster bisque for appetizers, also tasty.   But now for the airing of grievances:   I had to probably wait 20 minutes after the rest of my party's food came with no apology from the wait staff for my meal. The service all around sucked, if I'm being frank. Our water glasses were always empty.  The waitress forgot to bring out the lobster bisque soup, so we got it after dinner was served - isn't soup the appetizer (???!!!)  Took forever for our cocktails and not once did they check up on us.  It was a Friday night, so I would give them the benefit of the doubt if it was busy, but it wasn't...we were a party of 6 and ordered over $300 worth of food and beverages and got the worst service ever.  We will not be back here and I would advise you to chose a different place if you are in the area visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm entree. Too much chicken, not enough pasta.

nNVJuQ1NQx4eKmcvGWVXHQ.text: First, the positives:  We were a large group of 20 people visiting Las Vegas for work, and we were able to get a reservation on short notice.  The restaurant itself is quite spacious and overlooks the hotel pool, which is a nice change from the usual dark and windowless spaces of most restaurants in Las Vegas casinos.  Second, the highlight:  Our waitress, Janine, was absolutely fantastic!  She handled our large order with courtesy and efficiency.  While the person who took our reservation on the telephone said "that there was no way they could do separate bills," Janine did it without any fuss.  If the restaurant knows what's good for them -- i.e. excellent customer service -- they will give workers like Janine a well-deserved raise, promotion or bonus.  Now, the negatives:  The food at Grotto Ristorante is all right.  In fact, it was a bit bland.  I know Italian food very well, its flavor comes from fresh high-quality ingredients and just the right mix of oils and herbs.  That was not the case at the Grotto.  Finally, the major negative for us was the awful attitude of the restaurant manager.  A couple of us went to talk to him to put in a good word for Janine, and all he gave us in return was "attitude." He did not even face us while talking to us [i.e. he needs to learn some basic manners], and when we highly recommended our waitress's excellent work, all he could say is "I hope you come back!" as if he had not even heard what we said.  Very unprofessional attitude!

i1wjVZLnUd8GTpRE9kzm9w.text: What a pleasant surprise to find this restaurant for a late lunch while my wife and I were strolling Fremont Street. Lasagna and Chicken Parmesan were outstanding along with the service and prices. One of the best meals we had while in Vegas!

4wF-P-VvpTeraeODCyjK4g.text: The Grotto is in the Golden Nugget and a great place to grab a quick bite. We had the $10 happy hour pizza and it was delish. The red Sangria was excellent as well.  Our waiter was terrific as well as the service we received.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fbz_O4U1QxI8_MIxJ6tH0g.text: Great food, beautiful atmosphere and the bellinis always hit the spot. Killer pizza and calamari! They also offer delicious and decadent desserts too if you have a sweet tooth. They are delicious. I've never had a bad experience here.

6w-gnZ_9wn4P6k6dgJjIzw.text: I'm a local. I work downtown and I've had lunch here often.  Happily.  However, Dinner tonight was one of the worst meals I've had in a long time.  I hate leaving bad reviews so I'll go with the positives first. Service excellent. Appetizers were very good. Entrees terrible.  Seriously awful.  We had the shrimp scampi "special."  It was special alright.  Tasteless, the shrimp tasted like a rubber ball. We sent 2 of 3 back and the 3rd was an 80 year old who didn't want to offend the waitress because he's a nice guy.  I was so excited to recommend this restaurant for our uncle's 80th birthday and so disappointed.  We went to Claim Jumper's for dessert and wish we had dinner there to.

2reV3myQ06PMq0tAxdVA1w.text: Best chicken albondigas I ever had, our server Ricardo was very professional and courteous. Thank you

O_Z7D1mU3_BrZZQPFtAEhQ.text: Our group of four has been dining at the Grotto for several years and I believe it started going downhill after Landrys Corp took over. Things just are not the same.We still go there because it's convenient , edible, and fair pricing ,but I have yet to find a go to item on the menu.I used to love Grotto.The thing is, once you are downtown, the restaurants available are either $$$$ or $$ or $.I can recommend Triple George for $$$.They have three different areas for dining and a nice menu.May want to check it out.

SGR81q9b472T4DXfDTsErA.text: If you love Italian food, then you must stop in at the Grotto.  We make sure to have a meal here whenever we are in Vegas, and we always stay downtown so it certainly makes it a no brainer.  We haven't had anything that we didn't like.  I am especially fond of the chicken raviolis, the roasted red pepper cream & herbed veloute sauce is just to die for.   Definitely make sure not to fill up on too much bread before your food comes; it is very easy to do.  From appetizers, to the main course, and then on to dessert you just can not go wrong here.  The service is fantastic and the pricing is very reasonable.  Do not deny their goodness, and SAVE ROOM for dessert the Italian Wedding Cake is a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatzza
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Pescatore
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marsals

21tf9W6nS0hpDPa25zmBAA.text: My mom and I stopped in during the last 15 minutes of happy hour Tony was our server and he was phenomenal highly recommend this place for a quick bite and a good glass of wine

BrpBkG-R9wMZbd21ZWsREA.text: We retired to Vegas 4 years ago and have been hearing good things about Grotto from different friends the entire time. Made it there for lunch today. Everything we've heard was spot on. We were welcomed right off and seated at a table with a view of the pool area. It may not sound like a view you would enjoy, but let me tell you it is better than any Vegas show. What a hoot watching people. Really a nice original 50's pool area. Our knowledgeable server, Robert, was fantastic. He has mastered unobtrusive pampering. Explained the food offerings and drinks and most importantly made us feel welcome and appreciated. We wanted a light lunch and a good white wine and he recommended the pear and cargonzola pizza with the house Pinot. Both were excellent. The manager paid us a visit when we were done and sincerely expressed his appreciation for our visit and for being Landry Select Club members. What a great fun experience we had. Definitely will keep going back.

FtT_AIhzhbWnLbrO5CZRwQ.text: If I could give it zero stars I would.  Staying at the Golden nuggett for a staycation and wanted pizza so we decided to try this place.  Walked in for happy hour and was met by a very rude bartender who said our "waiter" will get with us.  A couple of minutes later this "waiter" showed up with zero personality.  He took our pizza order like he was doing us a favor and didn't even ask if we wanted drinks.  Then came back to check our order like her hadn't heard us the first time.  Just bad vibes all the way around.  We walked out without waiting for our food.  In my opinion if you are going to make a living in customer service, give the customers good service

-rQ6f6vMbZM0r7G3yW6zBA.text: Awesome little lunch spot we found on a whim walking through Fremont St.  Very good lunch specials both in price and portions.  Waiters were great and the food was good.  I would come here again for a good lunch whenever we're in town.  We liked sitting by the glass with the view of the shark tank in the pool area.

jzUuSkQehVQiZfc6UxLCrQ.text: Wish the owners or golden nugget would seal off the restaurant so we don't get all the cross sounds when we are trying to enjoy a nice meal. Food was great. Service was good the view of the shark tank was a plus would recommend to my friends and family but next time will try to sit on the other side of the restaurant due to the noise of the casino itself.

MwN_xj-sxGp9Taza1NNS8g.text: Looking for something a little more upscale while staying or visiting the Fremont Experience/Street? Well this is the place for you. The Grotto is located inside of the Golden Nugget and is a little hidden. You have to actually go through the whole casino and walk towards the pool with the sharks in the large tank.  Service is wonderful, the food was alright and prices are a little higher then you would get a say Olive Garden and such. I was with a largish group, but that was no problem for them as they were able to get some tables together quickly. Joan, our waiter, was very attentive and could answer any question you could have about the menu including her awesome suggestion of the waffle fries for the kids in our group.  I ordered the homemade roasted chicken ravioli which came with soft polenta, mascarpone, roasted red pepper cream & herbed veloute. What half of that means? I have no clue, but it was not too shabby. Before my meal was brought out we were served some warm bread with oil. It was bread, it was good, no complaints there. As far as the raviolis... I was expecting multiple small ravioli's, but it is really just one big ravioli. The flavors went well together and created a nice warm meal on a cold Vegas day.  Overall it was not too bad, would I go back? Maybe if I was in the mood for non-fast food and or I wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Fremont Experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken ravioli

nmZE01024qSYc3u7L_dBvQ.text: Armando the chef as always cooking well. My husband and I coming from California and we have to eat in this Place. May God bless your hands, Armando. That servers are great. Excellent customer service.

zBTk6GfjSFT6jOiqAwkT0A.text: First time here and I love their service.   The food is incredible!!   My husband and I asked for recommendations of food and she hit it right on the head.  Yummy and they serve big portions.  The atmosphere is so welcoming and the guests are enjoying themselves.  Love it here!!  Will be back.

oLBvT2QLGsHPivIrCFN5Uw.text: Excellent restaurant, I came here with family for my Birthday, we had great service, our waitress was great, I can't remember her name. The food was amazing, somewhere I will come again when I come back to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. EggPlant Parmigiana dish, VERY TASTEY!!

7T7KviBJp_2e5HnKZ46QyQ.text: My husband and I go to the Grotto in the Golden Nugget for dinner whenever we are going to be Downtown for the evening. Our favorite waitress is Denise Martin who always remembers us by name. Although my favorite meal is the spaghetti bolognese they do have Specials that can tempt me to try something different. Last night my husband said the shrimp and spaghetti Special was the best meal he has ever had. We have never been disappointed by the dinner or the service whenever we go to the Grotto.

76xbDVjrfJFvYJHA2uhosA.text: Review for happy hour only. It's decent, though the drinks are not as cheap as I'd like to see at a downtown happy hour. Wells, wine and beer for $5-7. Our pizza was cold when it arrived, but it was only $7 so I'm not too upset.   Service was alright, except for the pizza incident. Drink glasses stayed full and we hung out for about an hour and a half and spent $40. Not bad for a weekday afternoon, I suppose.

gm4Ao2GqE5NZdCHMDLG18Q.text: We had a wonderful experience sharing in food and cocktails with family an friends who attended our Vegas wedding. The Grotto staff accommodated out party very well, stored our cake on site for us and the wait staff was great. The management continually checked to ensure all was well. Not to mention the food was great. If looking for a place in downtown Vegas, check it out for comparatively reasonable Italian fare. If with a small group or couple, grab a seat by the pool viewing window.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake not provided by Grotto, but they thoughtfully stored and presented it.

-7w73JoZRpyQfhC2li_sJw.text: Dined here on Wednesday night. We stayed on the Strip, but we are SO happy we found this restaurant. Fresh bread and olive oil for the table. Great calamari. I had the Gorgonzola pasta and my husband had the lasagna. Both were fantastic!!!! Highly, highly recommend this establishment. Price point is great. Absolutely delicious!

glgI-xN9_AvPHIab7ItyZA.text: Good atmosphere. Great pizza- thin crust, fresh ingredients. The meatballs- Mama Mia!!-great flavor. Our waitress was fun and efficient.

wvkuwEE_-w3uBdXVqDqNCA.text: The food was good, the service was horrendous. Our waitress Carroll  literally kept forgetting about us. Took forever to even come to our table to take our drink order. By time she arrived we knew what we wanted to eat. We asked for a drink  menu, yet another long wait. Ordered our drinks. Another long weight. Asked us if we wanted dessert twice. I'm literally writing this as I wait for our check, it's that bad.

5g48F9hwvo86qxMkisjK1w.text: During one of my last work trips in Las Vegas, I found myself stationed here at the Golden Nugget and feening for some food after an incredibly intense happy hour.  I learned of the Grotto by accident really - I was busy sipping glasses of wine and attempting to order bar food, only to learn that bar food was a delicious array of Italian fare.  Perhaps it was the alcohol doing the talking for me, because everything I had was inhaled in minutes.  The Montel Wrap, a parmesan crusted Chilean sea bass married with roma tomatoes and lettuce was better drunk food than the burger and fries I was initially fantasizing about.  Another winner was the lasagna and the margherita pizza was deceivingly tasty.  I managed to go back to my hotel room in a pseudo drunken food coma, a condition best experienced in Vegas.  I decided to come back during another night for dinner, this time sober and just as hungry.  Having witnessed the dining room for the first time, I realized it was easy to miss this place.  The Grotto doesn't stand out and the tacky decor wasn't going to win any awards either.  When examining a menu for a second time, it was clear Grotto's was a Italiana Americana restaurant, more than it was anything more authentic.  Service was good, almost too good for a downtown casino establishment.  They were courteous, professional, and prompt with everything.  I had a stellar recommendation in the very tasty ($9) lobster bisque, not too fishy and just a tad of creme.  Another solid dish was the linguine pescatore, but felt overpriced at $27 for a medium portion.  I also was able to try their herb crusted pork loin ($25), juicy and hearty, with a nice seared crust, had a nice flavor with it.  The yukon mashed potatoes were a nice touch but tasted like they were whipped with butter and sour cream.  Finally our table of hungry hippos decided it would be a good idea to order the sausage and peppers pizza.  The crust was a little charred, too much to a point where it was dry and mediocre.  I would give this another shot, especially since I've heard more former colleagues rave about this pizza than any other entree on their menu.  The Golden Nugget has a mini gem here with Grotto.  For downtown standards, this is a decent and semi-reasonably priced Italian option in an area where good food is hard to find.

E9S110EPoTJpB9XwQy21yw.text: Really good wood fired pizza oven creates the best pizza! Grab a pizza and drink between 4-6PM great happy hour deal. Beautiful bar and restaurant and friendly staff.

IZNNsiLEkYlGaNlHMdTQVA.text: Staying at the Nugget and looking for a nice dinner close by. Went to the Grotto around 6 on Monday. No reservation needed, although the place started filling up an hour later.   Service was a little spotty at first, but got better as the meal progressed. The fresh bread and seasoned olive oil was excellent. I had the Pollo Francese, which was just slightly overdone, but still good. My wife had  the Shrimp Griglia, which she liked. Just enough garlic to require a stick of gum after, but not enough to taste the next morning!  The best deal of the night was a Rigatoni Bolognese special for $10. Two of our friends ordered that dish, and they both felt they got their money's worth.   One disappointment is the inability to order a side salad with dinner. One of our party asked, and she was directed to the main salad menu, starting at $10. Missed opportunity, folks. You likely would have sold several salads at $5, but instead we kept asking for the free bread.   If you're looking for an easy, somewhat upscale alternative to standard downtown fare, the Grotto is a nice go-to in a pinch.

gMehDVsfa91Z0y0I0yDbng.text: Last night around 7:30, eight o'clock. Me and my family decided to grab a bite to eat for dinner at The Grotto since Giada and Guy's resturant reviews were horrible.   The night starts with us arriving and the hostess giving us a wait time of an hour and forty-five minutes for a table of 5. Their was plenty of tables available to sit us and the other families that they were turning around with children. They tell us the wait was long due to a large party they had coming in of 18 and 20. Long story short the manager Neill seats us and our waiter Santos were the highlight of our service. Santos was johnny on the spot along with numerous other waiter that was walking around the resturant. The food was excellent, it was the best authentic Italian food that I had since I left Italy. The wedding party of 20 that was making everyone go elsewhere to eat was late and we ate, paid our check and leaving before they sat down. Will I return it depends on if the dirty blonde curly haired hostess is still their. The Manager Neill OUTSTANDING job for taking care of customers.

yuTWkAqXAK-0KTNI3hLV9Q.text: After a great weekend in Vegas my boyfriend and I decided to head downtown to have lunch and gamble a bit before heading back home. I have been to the Golden Nugget, where this restaurant is located many times, but never ate here. Oh man, I was pleasantly surprised. I went in expecting typical Italian fare, a la Olive Garden, but I got much more. The calamari appetizer was amazing, tasted fresh and not too over fried. I ordered the chicken parmigiana, while my boyfriend ordered the Chicken Marsala. His came with an Italian salad, which was also pretty good for a salad. When our meals came we were amazed by the portion sizes. If I wasn't starving I probably could have saved half for another meal, the chicken piece was about the size of my face. Not even kidding. The boyfriends Chicken Marsala was about the same amount of chicken, just cut up and laid over a bed of mushroom risotto. Everything that I tasted here was amazing and the service was on point. I will for sure be back next time I come to town.

XPpYghILR7iA2t44bMP1tQ.text: I've eaten here 3 times. Tomato soup is delicious, I love the bread and oil. Fried mushrooms and lasagna are good as well. Went for happy hour and had peach bellinis that were very tasty and their herb chicken pizza. Pizza was crispy and flavorful. Also we tried their spinach and artichoke dip, it was decent. I prefer the soft bread to the harder croutons. Tiramisu was very delicious too.

tCcEjrpXNKcJlJBaTBJM-Q.text: Very nice upscale Italian restaurant. Great service and a fantastic menu to choose food from. There is so much to choose from. Every meal comes with fresh bread and olive oil.  I highly recommend reserving a table in advanced due to high volume of tourist wanting to come for dinner.

7fz7q9PLXEyWVkym7a9tlA.text: Up until today this has been my favorite place to eat.   The food was cold.   It took so long to get out to our table of two,  I was very upset I didn't bother to send it back.   This place has gone down hill.

BPwpDoOustITOjV6MaP6kw.text: Fabulous food and great service by Denise!!  A very nice place for a girls night out dinner!

9fZZ_3pNDT2zQOHlK_l9RQ.text: Seriously our favorite restaurants in Vegas are in the Golden Nugget!!!  This time we tried Grotto. Everything we ate was Delicious!!!  From the warm bread they brought out in the beginning, to the meatball appetizers, then on to all of the 4 mains courses we had at the table...  DELISH!!!  One person had the lasagna, another had a rigatoni dish, another had a spicy seafood dish, and I had the Veal and Fettuccini dish. My stomach hurts and my mouth is still watering thinking about it. It was ALL so good!!!  Can't wait to come back for dessert :-D

jo_Xt3ILBN9Fdx_XuZBmyA.text: Went there on a Saturday night.  Pizza was good but we had a large party and it came delivered cold.  I also had the salmon which was tasty with a diced vegie bed.  Overall the service was good and they did their best to accommodate our demanding group ringleader :-)   Food:  Not bad.  Good taste and flavoring Service:  Busy place but they try their best Price: Mid price.

9nWtd749zwopz4gJMAzL8A.text: We loved the glass room that overlooked the pool.  The meatballs were fantastic 5/5.  The Fettuccine Alfredo lacked flavor and was very bland 1/5.  The Penne Arrabiatta 4/5.  Service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne Arabiatta

eSoGguGAX1E22ojD7Pvm7w.text: The food was quite excellent. We go to a number of great Italian restaurants and this one would rank near the top. I did not give them a 5 star only because the service from our waitress was just so so. She never asked us if we liked our food and was just basically absent during our dinner. At a nice restaurant like this one would expect more.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Yl22W8Iz9tYHwRXNlfKyhA.text: What an excellent place! I hadn't been to the Golden Nugget in years. I met some out of town visitors there on Saturday and we had the most excellent Italian dinner! Between us all, we had Mussels, Bruschetta, Chicken Scallopini, Gnocchi, Cavatelli, and the Chicken Caesar Salad. Plus desserts of Tiramisu and Orange Creme Brulee! Everything was excellent and the price was more than reasonable. Service was friendly and top-notch. I can't wait to go back!

wYUQsgI3kIVFiiE9nIezOQ.text: Had a wonderful time during my stay at the Golden Nugget with my wife. I especially enjoyed the delicious food from the Grotto Italian Restaurant, it was absolutely by far the best restaurant in the casino! (And believe me we tried them all) Our server Cynthia greeted us with a bright big smile and her service was spectacular. She knew what I wanted before I even knew. She was funny and always checking on us. I give this place 10 stars if I could, Can't wait to come back!

adFHBpuAeKP6Or9QX78YXw.text: The food here is amazing for the price. I had gnocchi and tomato basil soup. Blew me away. We were seated very quickly and hostess was awesome. Only issue I had with the visit was we almost had to file a missing persons report due to the fact we had no idea where the FUCK our waiter was the whole time!

TRq3T1_VBsAebXyaXcdhTA.text: Food was great but service was even better! Jason took great care of us, helped us with our selection and was tentative. We got an alfredo dish not on the menu and it was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Alfredo
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VIBtQ8U50HkVoOuOJGhWeA.text: The food was excellent. The Margherita pizza is my favorite. The prosciutto stuff chicken breast on spinach fettuccine was perfect. The orange creme brulee was delicious. Our server, Jay, was very attentive and pleasant as well.

_racn3X26Bxg3OxIJprH0w.text: Excellent Italian! Stopped in for dinner on a Las Vegas weeknight & got a seat immediately in the bar area. My husband says his veal marsala may be the best hes had. Sauce was sweet & cooked perfectly. I had the chicken parm which was thin & still juicy, covered in the right amount of cheese. Nothing was overly or under portioned & food came out quickly.  Service was fast & friendly and several people stopped to make sure we were satisfied & our glasses were filled.   Side Note: my husband left his credit card with the bill when we left. Our server turned it in to security & we were able to retrieve it. We are so thankful for the honesty of our server as that situation could have turned out much differently

zEog9r72dHKv_xjWu1ZL3w.text: Our family loved this place. Ricardo was our waiter and he was superb.  When starting to pay for our bill, he asked if we were a Landry member. We saved a significant amount off our bill. Thanks Ricardo!!

DEyqonJnOTfRMKr30vw9DA.text: Best meal I had in Vegas (well expect maybe Wicken Spoon but its hard to compete with bottomless mimosas with unlimited food...). We went to a highly rated, celebrity chef owned/supported Italian restaurant just before visiting Grotto and man did Grotto restore my faith in the quality of Vegas food.  The pastas were perfectly cooked with delicious sauces. My pizza was soft, well appointed with toppings, and had awesome cheese. Our server almost seemed insulted when each of us said "stop" for our fresh grated Parmesan (I promise I had plenty on my pizza).  All the servers were wonderfully friendly and helpful. I do wish that they had done a bit better job cleaning the table (some splattered sauce specs were still visible), but it was not terrible considering we were at bar seating. The prices were reasonable for the amount of food and even though there was a wait we were accommodated in the bar area fairly quickly!  Definitely would return here if I needed to know I was getting a good meal in Vegas. Sadly there are just too many options to just pick one.

81lv-YNetV85tz0RrsAE5g.text: Very good experience. They were very accommodating with my dietary needs-gluten free vegetarian. They had GF pasta and prepared a sauce of my choice. The others in my group were just as happy with their meals. All of our food arrived hot, fresh, and delicious. Service was excellent!

6urH-Y6bY1cz1Qhg43Ab1w.text: The food is absolutely delicious...I had the Chicken Marsala with Fettuccine Alfredo. The cream so thick and rich. The portion was on the small size. I would have given 5 stars but the service was so slow tonight and it was not that busy. It seemed that the name of the game was wait, and I was just a party of one.

hnHMLx_hQILwKJDBImhoSA.text: This was a bright spot in a week of generally mediocre food and service.  The service in particular was excellent.  An attentive but not overbearing waiter.  The food was very good and the price was a fair value.  Our best dining experience in Las Vegas.

beTu8bRBn9_WxKFHtpNF6g.text: Robert and Cynthia gave great service, attentive but not intrusive. Funny, charming and professional.

b7u40koSzDnCcZZFnelZig.text: Great late night deal right here!   A client told me about the Grotto and swears by the rigatoni, but after finding the late night happy hour i couldn't resist. 10:30-12:00 Sunday-Thursday you can get any of the pizzas on their menu for $8. Great sized pizzas as you can see in a number of photos, and tasty as well. The first time out i had the Meatzza which was fantastic. I then went again and tried the Spinach, pear, and gorgonzola and i honestly didn't care for it much (my fault for trying something different). I can't speak for anything else other than the happy hour which was enjoyable and finds me likely to return. Service was straight forward and the location was relaxed for being inside of a casino downtown so thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reverse happy hour days/time
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach, pear &amp; gorgonzola

nLgenHWvqeEmjOEJjzbKnA.text: Great food, service sucked. MICHAEL was a terrible waiter and not attentive whatsoever. After we got our food we didn't see him anymore. I had to pretty much shout out for his attention and I told him we had been waiting for acknowledgement for the last 15 mins and he didn't say a word or apologize. It wasn't even that busy. Very very rude waiter who if I were a manager of this restaurant, I wouldn't want him as a representative. Because of him and his unacceptable service I do not think we will come back

Ev4fksA1Dx8atYa-WEfI-g.text: An absolutely amazing place!! Very cool old world ambience with excellent food. We got there at 11:30 for lunch. It was empty but filled up very quickly. The bartender, Rich was extremely helpful in selecting food and sharing local stories.   We started with stuffed mushrooms topped with five cheeses in a light tomato basil sauce. I followed this up with the tomato basil soup which was very nice with a cream base.   We shared a rigatoni Bolognese. It was served  with large tasty meatballs and a tasty chopped salad. The Italian bread - crusty on the outside - came with a very nice olive oil garlic mix.   Everything was absolutely delicious!! We had way too much food, and took some back to our room for the ride home.   I almost forgot to mention their famous peach Bellini's. They are made with a mixture of vodka, Pinot Grigio, peaches, peach schnapps, A peachy syrup and of course champagne. It's sweet for my taste but everyone else would just love it. It is made fresh daily.  We will have to try to re-create this without the sweet stuff.   This place was just like going back to eat in Waterbury, Connecticut where they have great Italian food. Made me feel at home. I miss the good southern Italian cooking from Connecticut.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Cesar&#39;s Palace
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great ambience
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QsKjzYJQqzMbDTWIjr7SAQ.text: Beautiful ambience... Extremely courteous staff.. Divine food... What more can anyone ask for.... I had the rigatoni salsiccia- it was delicious... very good portions. I also had the tiramisu.... it was so well balanced and was divine  I will definitely be back...

WBBz8v3uVNqTqirP1WT8XA.text: 5 girls here for a birthday, Jay was our server. He was robotic and standoffish and upon learning of my cousins 50th birthday he said he talked to his manager "multiple times" and there was "nothing he could do." We called bullshit on that one. Food was decent but we all agreed it was the worst service we've ever had. I guess when you're in Vegas some people figure quality doesn't matter, regardless of how much you're spending.

ZVcVelUFMZw_O8NebxG0RA.text: Service and food was top notch. Had the margherita pizza and it was great, ingredients were fresh. Definitely will be coming back. Very nice drink selection also.

_B9q-1L4LsLQAVmVBScVjA.text: A group of us went for happy hour the other day and enjoyed a few drinks and appies in the bar area. It wasn't busy, as we went on a Tuesday around 2:30pm - but the service was quite slow despite the near empty bar area.   I had Peroni ($5) and a shrimp cocktail ($13.95) which was extremely overpriced for the happy hour portion, which was 4 smallish prawns. Not very high quality, and they were a bit over-cooked. Our table also had the stuffed mushrooms and an order of bruschetta, which was quite tasty. I would go back for the drink specials, but I'd rather eat somewhere else for better food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed mushrooms
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail at Happy Hour ($13.95)

HUw3EId7-CP3MEY6bCwN1A.text: Been here a couple of times for decent italian fare. Stopped in for a pizza and beer on on a Friday afternoon. The pizza is a thin crust cooked in a wood fire oven, and is delicious, and the beer selection is decent. The service, however, is where we have a problem.  I found our server to be inattentive, scatterbrained, and borderline rude, all in one service. I've beed served by her before, and noticed some of these attributes previously, but this time, I'd had it. My wife and I ordered a beer and a glass of wine respectively. These took what felt like an eternity to bring to us. Once we got our food at the table, she flat out ignored us, failing to check up on us once. I'm sure the manager would be unhappy to know she lost 2 more beverage sales as a result. I know we weren't a high ticket table, but that doesn't mean you can give bad service. What was more annoying is we got to overhear how personable she could be while serving the two ladies at the adjacent table. When check time came, she dropped it and vanished like a vaudevillian magician in a puff of smoke before I could hand her my Landry's Select card. When I gave it to her, she acted as if it was a huge pain, and I should have told her sooner.  How could I? She was damn near avoiding interacting with us!  Now, I know there are two sides to every story. Usually when I read complaints about servers, I am open to the possibility that there is a reason the reviewer got bad service. Perhaps they were rude to the server, smelled bad, who knows. Let me tell you, I was raised to respect what a shitty job waiting tables is. I say please, thank you, and appreciate the grind. My wife is the same way. So I can honestly say that the attitude was totally unwarranted and from left field. As a result, I left an appropriate 15% tip and bailed. I will be sure to not be seated in her section again.

crz-lg9u4gUKwNRz6CWGsg.text: Sat at bar for a sandwich.  Bartender was very nice.  He recommended a good draft beer.  Ordered a sandwich then looked up and saw the B health rating.  Hope I won't be hugging the toilet tonight.  (I subtracted one star for health rating)  **note....3 days later and no sickness!  WOOT!

LiurwweS-nhBTKKPC0QZKA.text: The meatballs are exceptional,  and the pizza with pear and gorgonzola was so delicious.  Was with a large party and the service was great.  Spaghetti sauce is slightly sweet,  so if that's not your bag,  consider requesting an arrabiata sauce.  Dessert is worth it, the chocolate cake is fantastic,  as is the wedding cake and tiramisu. It's pricey so come prepared.

Kzw9UVR2NCEK2B44v0p5gg.text: This place is a diamond in the rough (and I use rough jokingly) the Golden Nugget is beautiful and up-to-date. With that said this authentic Italian restaurant was so good I had to create a Yelp just so I could share.   What we had: Lobster Bisque = 5 Stars rich, creamy with chunks of fresh lobster  Meatball Appetizers = 4 Stars original Italian meatball, very good, I would of liked more herbs and spices but still a delicious meatball Cheese Tortillini = 5 Stars beautifully plated, delicious pesto sauce, pasta cooked perfectly   I agree with another yelper about how it's openness in the hotel allows for whoever to walk in and out so you get people who may already be intoxicated walking up to have a cocktail (we had a somewhat loud table near us) but hey it's Vegas and we chose to sit in the bar section....I'm not complaining personally just stating. Didnt take away from the decor and food though.  Excellent service (Tony) who was knowledgable about food and drinks, friendly, and attentive. Even brought out the desert tray at the end but we were full. If your in the area definitly check this place out, worth the $

-0U0zzkzel4NyS_M9t2XSw.text: The Grotto is inside the Golden Nugget, which by the way is nicer than I expected.  I hadn't been to Fremont St. in over 5 years so it was a nice surprise.  We had a group of 5 and decided on The Grotto from the help of yelp! Couldn't have been more thankful.  We were starving and this fit the bill.  Food was great.  I had a pizza (sausage & peppers), my buddies had the bruschetta appetizer, penne & meatballs and ravioli.  Pizza's are wood fired and baked with thin crust.

4hmVRoi6AOMOeCR1v6fxfg.text: Went here with my friend for dinner Saturday night. Carla was our sever , she was a 10 out of a 10. Her menu knowledge was awesome and she was honest with her recommendations. The veal my friend got was amazing he said and I had the chicken. Parm which is my fav all time and it was one of the best.. We sat on the patio which was awesome.  Nice wine list. But the lasting impression was Carla, I loved her and will go back just for her to serve us again. Thanks for a great night!

f9WFjQTBSMWu0VjoaCkfJg.text: I had dinner at the grotto and had a drink at the bar. I was served by a gentleman by the name Jeff. I have to say I had an outstanding experience there. I would recommend anyone visiting down town Las Vegas to go to the grotto and stop at this bar/ restaurant.

SLnucoMvFkiJJym9-5amMg.text: Food was great. Only 3 stars because you stare at gross people at the pool (you might lose you appetite) or people shuffling through the middle of the restaurant. It's loud and hard to enjoy your meal. 4 stars for the service we received.

zVIiRhwIBhEea3z1EZF6Pw.text: Jeff is great!  Although I stay on the strip, always make an effort to come here for the pizza!   One of my fav pizza spots for sure!

oeEbI2l492CMFr_S5pEbDw.text: Wood Fire Pizza!  This place had super good Wood Fire Pizza. We only got the Pepperoni Pizza and it was delicious. The service was great, the atmosphere was quiet, and the decor was cute Italian.

13bGGa7pU0IyAeXsnVzT_A.text: Tomato Basil soup was delicious but a little pricy. Waited over half an hour for it (server must have forgot). Meatzza pizza was tasty, didn't care for the meatballs on it though.  Overall food was good; service was painfully slow.

imHa7atThBJN157sHj-Zvw.text: Was staying at the Golden nugget and this restatement looked very appealing. The happy hour is what stood out. Was one of the only places in the casino with a good HH. We had the calamari for an appetizer and that was delish! We also tried their homemade pizzas and a pasta dish. Both were so yummy and we really liked that they make the pizza in front of you at the bar area. For our Drinks we had beers and bellini's....which I luv well made bellini's. They were tasty! Overall we were satisfied with decor, staff, and food! Highly recommend if staying at the GN!

mdV_yMXgppNNiD8_USpNPg.text: Phenomenal authentic Italian food, fabulous service (thank you Jordon), great atmosphere and reasonable prices. My favorite restaurant on Freemont St, I have eaten here every time I visit Las Vegas and it is ALWAYS great! Located in the fabulous Golden Nugget.

mDSwLNgtRVFPNQFtsb-Z5w.text: Very nice setting and good service from our server Denise. The food though is not what everyone is hooting and hollering about. I ended up getting an appetizer for an entree that was nicely done, and fantastic flavor. The husband got a pizza that wasn't cooked long enough and really wasn't anything spectacular. He ended wishing he got what I ordered.

22k-LQiENX5sc_1Cb7NoFw.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas. Try the fried mozzarella. It's not like anything you have had before. Great wait staff and great view of the pool. It's also another reason to go down to Fremont Street!

xV4gmz2HbInzBppnnPmDrg.text: One of my favorite Italian Restaurants of all! The Wedding Soup is to die for and the Chicken Cannelloni is superb! However everything on the menu is delicious!

GT8BMOjDltEdrrdFm-xuIA.text: Food was great. My husband and I ordered a salad and a shrimp asparagus Fettuccini entree. It was just enough for the two of us . the waitress was very friendly and helpful. Even though it was early for dinner and the restaurant was empty, it took a while to be served.  The bread was delicious!  The best ever! We sat next to the window that overlooked the fish tank. It was a very pleasant dinner.

fIFTiPwAJ5XrVnQExH3b4g.text: We had an excellent experience. It was my Uncle's 82nd birthday and we happened upon The Grotto on a Sunday evening. The server was great, the food arrived quickly and was very good. We had 2 Italians that were discussing their family recipes so I thought it would be a tough sell. They were both impressed with the meatballs and praised their entrees as well. Reasonably priced, great atmosphere for being in a casino setting and friendly servers.

RE3dnvlFVOT3OFoJOyIG-w.text: Kim was enthusiastic and has a great sense of humor; she is definitely an asset to this restaurant. She did great with our order.

nWKoOhmmoo3lNqtBb5xAyA.text: Absolutely terrible-- our entire party was joking at how bad it was. I had the veal and couldn't finish it even though I was still hungry. No one like anything.

U-bbj97Kbc0WOJi6dUqf8A.text: WOW.....Best Italian we have ever had!!  I had the Crusted Sea Bass.  No words to describe the flavor...soooo good!  I only wish I had ordered Two orders so that I could have had some to take home!!

0EGsEJkLZvmxRbxk9OB3Og.text: Not good... Bad service, the food is not gpod, my pasta was so sweet... Anyways I vote that this restaurant gets into kitchen nightmare series by Gordon Ramsey!!!! Enough said, skip this place

2TDwOAFTAh0WgaBiJ03WoA.text: Great dinner! Great service!  Excellent salad!  Awesome flat pizzas!!!  Will definitely be back.  Almost ate there twice while in Vegas!

1lMFWsHXKgVMyUEyhLfg_g.text: Staying at the Nugget, so this was a choice of convenience.  Ordered Sea Bass as a recommendation by the waiter.  It was smothered in a dark mushroomy sauce, that seemed to be more suited for a steak....not a white fish.  Didn't like it.  Husband ordered eggplant parmaesan and it was good.  My friend ordered a saffron risotto, and I made her send it back as it tasted like an old dish rag.  They made a big fuss about our complaint and two different people came over to the table to discuss why we didn't like the risotto.  They insulted us by insinuating that we didn't know that saffron has a different taste, whatever......it was still bad. When we received the bill it was taken off, all $4.99 of it. You would have thought it was a big ticket item the way the restaurant was reacting to our complaint.          We did enjoy the beer that was micro brewed there, I believe it was called Sin City.          After gazing around the room, I think the hot item in the restaurant was pizza, ah hindsight.

tUtyAzrESLSWrDo1ZMN9eQ.text: Kinda odd place to dine since I'm a local here with no habit of gambling, and I have no business coming to LV down town... but wow, I have to say, this is the place you can come to get the great lunch/dinner for affordable price! I had a bowl of tomato soup and I splitted goat cheese chicken pizza. Bill was no more than $25 I believe... and I felt like I was at spago! Soup was simple and perfect, not too acidic and basil played nice side kick to it. Pizza had so much flavor, I rubbed my tongue many times just to taste everything in my mouth. Very satisfying. My friend ordered a plate of lasagne and it was also out of this world too. Great ambience, not too crowded, and it stays open at weird time (like 3pm where everywhere else closes down). Highly recommended!!

GB6WQxhmFzXTpgqDz4mY6w.text: First of all, props to the staff. Even though it was a busy weekend evening, we still got fast, attentive, and friendly service. Secondly, the food tasted sooo good. Their lobster bisque is by far the best I've ever had. The mussels were super tasty as well. Other dishes we tried were the spaghetti bolognese, chicken marsala and ravioli, all scrumptious. The decor made for good conversation as well,  and by decor I mean the murals featuring European characters performing public sex acts while enjoying their meals. haha. Good times at the Grotto.

MPwcIWPsD-hKQRUq9kPT7A.text: This place is in the Golden Nugget where I stayed so it was convenient.  But I ate there twice because the Italian Wedding Soup is so good.   Very delicate and tasty.  It's made with chicken instead of beef. The pizza is also good as well as the pear salad.

DS5YrV9Px6hd8oWOAvVBng.text: i swear they have a lil old gramma in the basement ball and chained to the wall making the meatballs. they were awesome.  we say by the pool at night and watched the fish go round and round. it was nice.  the food A ++  the service. well it sucked. hardcore. some of the worse i have ever had. we really wanted a sweet treat after dinner to celebrate our winnings...after waiting 45 mins for the waitress to come back..wine glasses empty..etc.. we said screw it. paid and left.  but man the meatballs.  yumm.

lapR8lz1lUONMm0Bi4Wkcg.text: Epic fail!   I dined at this restaurant inside the Golden Nugget after attending a convention with three of my out of town co workers.  I ordered the Seabass, and was thoroughly enjoying it, until I found a cockroach on my plate.  A COCKROACH ON MY PLATE!  The insect was incorporated in the sauce.  The waiter and manager on duty both offered sincere apologies, and comped the table.  I expected the chef to offer an apology, but he seemed too busy since it was a Monday...? The real fail here is the response I got from the GM after I emailed him about my experience.  He explained that his restaurant has policies and procedures to guard against things like this from happening.  I believe him.   He also told me nothing like this has ever happened at his restaurant in the past.  I am not so sure. As I was telling another co worker my experience (I too am in food service, so this experience served as a good training tool), she informed me of a well known roach infestation at the Golden Nugget.  I did a quick Google search, and found several news articles about the roach problem at that property.  Employees of the property have been complaining for YEARS.  As recently as Dec 2012, restaurants were closed as a result of the infestation.  Yet this was the first time there has been an issue at Grotto?  Possibly... While comping a table of four is gracious (and expected under the circumstances), it certainly isn't enough, knowing what I know now, for me to give ANY restaurant at the Golden Nugget another try.

NzVKNZkJyKXk4nC77qe42w.text: been coming to the grotto for a few years and raving about there amazing pepperoni pizza, but alas times they are a changing, must have new chef a once brilliant standout pizza is now just and average pizza, the peeperoni they once used seems to be no longer and replaced with a dominoes style pepperoni and the bread and pasta dishes have suffered a setback as well looks like one place I can cross off the list when we visiit vegas, sometimes change is not good

gdGN-N7_ln9ei87fxz33Aw.text: Along with the new pool, the new gaming floor, the updated rooms at the Golden Nugget, there has also been a major revamp of the eateries here.  The Grotto is a decent, physically darker version of Olive Garden-type resto partially open to the casino floor.  The waitstaff was friendly and swift, but they did seem rushed as there always seemed to be a wait to get a table.   The bread served before the meal is soft and doughy; comes with a chili-garlic olive oil for dipping. The bruschetta was awesome - long buttery, crusty oblongs of bread lightly drizzled with balsamic, topped with a fresh garlicky tomato tapenade. The bf and I gobbled that shit up quick. I ordered the rigatoni with meat sauce, very good with that comforting feel, and the bf had the chicken canneloni which he apparently loved (none left) and I thought was ok (one bite). Prices weren't dirt cheap but so much less than eating at a comparable hotel eatery on the strip. One day, Mario's, but on this day, Grotto fit the bill just fine.

Ofxt8AtyDn3ZMt2G7KC-7Q.text: We were pleasantly surprised in our meals.  They make a really good lasagna.  It was insanely busy, and it seemed like the kitchen was struggling to keep up.  Our waiter was very friendly, too.  Definitely a good value.

uDuOCDELaxX2lmvTk9tC1A.text: I was simply stunned at how delicious and seemingly authentic the food was here. I hope the next time I dine here the food stays consistent, the chef who was working the nights I've went is GOOD! I grew up eating my way through North Beach w/my Grandmum, so we are a bit snobbish and jaded when it comes to our Italian food. I was surpirsed to find something this good in Downtown Las Vegas. I love sitting in the extended dining room area so I can check out the pool!   ;)

Dn4vtBgDKGY0HXplvH-4fA.text: LOVED the Grotto!  Had a beautiful view of the tank.  Food was perfect.  I had the rigatoni with peppers and sausage.  A little bit of a kick but I loved it.  My husband and FIL had the lasagne which they both loved.  We had calamari and fried mozz for apps both fabu.  Passed on dessert as we were stuffed.  Drinks were very strong. Service was good.  Make sure you make reservations and request a table near the tank.

qd-dUEjte1yWIKnWSXlneg.text: First, the service was poor.  We ordered salads which were brought to us 40 min after we ordered and before we even started the salads, soup was brought to us.  It took another 45 min to get our main courses.  The salad was fair, the soup was dishwater, the main courses of encrusted Mahimahi was testless, the pasta was overcooked, the other main course, chicken, was covered in a sludge sauce.  Skip this restaurant.  There are other good Italian restuarants in Las Vegas

aOg6Sk9x7RTg1eRrUFK4Pw.text: I was quite surprised at how good this place is.    I had the lobster bisque which was one of the best I have ever had.   Our friends had the wedding soup, which they raved about and went back the next day to have again.   I tried their pizza, which was not the best brick oven I have had but very good nonetheless.    Our friends had the Pasta Diavolo and some other fettucine and were both very happy.

1ygV0POWi4k3Q1G1Wym16A.text: Who knew gin and tonics and mussels are so good together! We highly recommend getting that when you go here.   We didn't have much else so I can't comment too much on the place.   We had set our stuff down at a table and never saw a waiter so we assumed we had to order at the bar. I left my purse on a chair and went two steps away to the bar and magically a waitress appeared straightening chairs. Well..she joked that my purse was at one of her tables, but I got the distinct vibe I should move my bag. So...we sat at the bar and had a great time. The bartender was super friendly, I think his name was Michael.  Poop on you angry waitress lady!   Poop on you.

TybIYuNX97utrrtGG-gXbQ.text: My boyfriend and I ate here late in the evening (9:30-ish) so the restaurant was fairly empty.  We were seated by the pool area and even though the pool was closed, we could still see the fish swimming around in the tank.  We ordered a pizza (chicken with goat cheese and other things...can't remember the exact name) and entree sized salad to split among the two of us and I had a glass of wine.  The food was excellent and even though we were stuffed, we had to finish the pizza!  The only negative was that it took our waiter forever to come to our table.  We waited probably 10 minutes for him to even come take our drink orders...when he came, we quickly put in our whole order.  It also took a while for him to come at the end of the meal.

m7fiVNPj2NNr_OecXGQQtA.text: we happened to stroll by and decided to stop in for dessert.  we loved the view of the pool area and the desserts were amazing.  it was a very busy friday night but even though we were only having dessert the wait staff was very attentive and efficient.  we'll definitely be going back.

8I44m95Q2GRFb7AIt8zlmQ.text: Surprisingly good. I had my doubts since it seemed overpriced from a glance at the menu, but it was quite good. I had their chicken francese, which is nothing like the typical francese sauce one might expect (creamy, with artichoke hearts and mushrooms). My boyfriend had the lasagna and enjoyed that as well. The atmosphere is very nice and the service is fairly good. They are especially attentive with the water for some reason! We could see parts of the fish tank outside from where we sat in the back...a nice view. Overall, a great experience. Expect to pay $15-$25 for your entree, however.

vpPUR2mNR5fG5uBGTKWJ1g.text: This is my second visit here. This little Italian restaurant inside the Golden Nugget is delicious. I had the pear salad to start, not only was the presentation perfect the taste was excellent. We also ordered the pear Gorgonzola pizza.... to die for!!!! You certainly won't leave hungry as your started with complimentary bread and a olive oil garlic dipper. If there wasn't so many other places to eat in Vegas I'd eat here again tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pear salad! Beautiful

qos_4mVAF0b3HrST0e4dZA.text: By far my favorite restaurant downtown. Everything from their appetizers to their pizzas to every entree is just delicious. Service is good, atmosphere is great, good pricing too. We've been to this restaurant 14 times in the past 6 months, so that tells you how much we love this place.  If you're in downtown Vegas for the first time, hands down go to Grotto, no doubt about it

69_9F9NALXl_Ks0abE8Fmg.text: Came here for the happy hour special, grabbed a pizza and some drinks. Great food and service at a great price.

BEoGLl4twaiGyIbcwHsDuA.text: Had a nice lunch at Grotto the last time we were in town. We were meeting my junior high school classmates for lunch. Our flight got in a little before lunchtime so we made our way to Downtown soon after retrieving our rental car. Grotto is located inside the Golden Nugget Casino & Hotel. I'm very familiar with the Nugget having stayed there in the past but had never dined at Grotto. One of our classmates is a Vegas local and suggested dining there. It was definitely a good call.   We ordered calamari for our table and I went with the grilled chicken panini minus the mozzarella. It also came with roma tomatoes and mayo. The sandwich was very good. The grilled chicken was tasty and not dry. The chicken was also cut into pieces and I was real happy with it. The waffle fries the panini came with were very good. I really liked them. Nicely seasoned and went well with the panini. Good sandwich. I would get again in the future. The plate came with a small bowl of ketchup for dipping the waffle fries. I liked that.   Other entrees ordered at our table were the portabello panini, pizza and pasta bolognese. Everyone was very happy with their individual orders. The calamari was great. It came with marinara dipping sauce and lemon to squeeze accordingly. Great appetizer.   Service was good. Water for everyone. A moscow mule. sodas... All brought to our table with a smile. Manager on duty was very personable and we enjoyed our meal at Grotto for sure. Definitely a place to check out when at or around the Nugget.

6MK8Z2fjVR022H1Nf9AmTw.text: We had the bruschetta.  Generous portions.  The lasagna was OMG.  It Melts in your mouth.  Pleasantly surprised at  the quality of their food .   Service is great too. Unpretentious restaurant.

66jEE8-TLoMLwnaqy8VsOg.text: As usual, our food at the Grotto was amazing. Sorry, no pics. We both had the lunch specials. Soup or salad and entree fir $15. Can't beat that. Best tomato basil soup EVER!!  He had lasagna I had chicken with mushrooms scallopine!!  Yum!!  Sat at the bar with Leo taking most excellent care of us!!  Highly recommend if you're in town!!

pVQ_R8yVP8B1__5ib5vMhQ.text: I can not believe so many people wrote positive reviews about this place! Three of us ordered 3 different entries and they were all really bad. Desserts are way too sweet!

ln-4fg-UB2HzGlHyrPv7_g.text: Our waiter Darwin was prompt. He kept our waters topped off and our bread basket full. We had the antipasti, pepperoni pizza (we requested it with extra meat) and rigatoni and meatballs. It was all good.  It was disappointing to look back at the windowed kitchen and see cans of tomato sauce though.   Our meals were largely portioned and I boxed up half my rigatoni and 1 meatball. Thanks, Darwin!
