Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni pizza
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tYOuJTc9jWW3vUQ3lUjAvw.text: Staying in downtown Las Vegas on Fremont Street tends to offer a wide variety of food as well as entertainment. Searching on Yelp for something not visibly available from the street level view, my husband found this wonderful place.   We came in with a preset menu (pizza, of course) and ordered. My husband ordered a local beer and I just had some tea. The tea was good, however it only comes in unsweetened so that you may add your own sugar. I guess that's ok, but I am used to getting sweet tea (as I am from the South).   First thing to arrive was the bread and garlic infused oil dip. It was hot, fresh with a crispy crust and a hot, light, airy center! I could have made a meal just from the bread! In order to enjoy our main course, I elected --reluctantly--to have only one piece.  Pizza arrives and it is hot and fresh, the waiter-Jose- grated fresh Parmesan over half of the pizza since my husband prefers to have red pepper flakes on his half. The crust was very light and so thin that you could read the newspaper through it. The sauce was perfect with just a hint of sweet to it. The pepperoni was tasty and not overwhelming on the sauce base. I will definitely return.  A shout out to our waiter Jose and the pizza maker himself-Joe: Jose, thank you for being so helpful and friendly, it was a pleasure to make your acquaintance. Joe, this is one of the best pies I have ever had in Las Vegas! Please be assured that we will be back! Thanks for a great meal, gentlemen!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another view of the crust!
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni pizza with half of the pizza gone!
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. See how thin the crust is!

AmM-4ml5ZGm2FwjkRUI0SA.text: I have dined here several times during happy hour. $10 for any pizza is an awesome deal. I've only had one entree, the Veal Kickerillo. It is BOMB! The service is always prompt.

SNvVxbFoJqFEEs6We3wYpA.text: Food is amazing. Service isn't. I would give this place a solid 3.5 stars. The food is actually very tasty. I ate here for both lunch and dinner. Their margarita pizza is great, salads and I had the salmon! There service isn't what you'd expect if you think of going for a date night. They're lazier and slower than most "fine dining's" I'd recommend a quick lunch or informal dinner here!

qIJ9ccPmkAQyI_vbX8ebxw.text: Very good menu, service was outstanding, from the hostess and throughout the meal, Jose F, great waiter. Prices more reasonable that some of the local places we regularly frequent. As locals we will return. Excellent meal.

osxgbkpUyuhlStv1zGd5Iw.text: Not a good place to eat!!!!Salmon was too burnt and very Dry!!... first time here and very unhappy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon was burnt and too dry.. would not come here again

mJHChs5MFZS3KHp1u9F9iw.text: WARNING TO ALL VEGETARIANS - This restaurant adds MEAT to dishes without any warning!  We went last night - I ordered Vongole - listed on the menu as containing 'Linguine, clams, lemon, garlic, pinot grigio broth, garlic parsley crunch".  I started eating the dish and then realized that there was prosciutto in it!!!! I told the server - he said he would get a 'manager'. After quite a wait, a female manager came over. She seemed entirely unbothered by the situation and did not really seem to understand how big a deal it was, adding pork to a dish and NOT saying this on the menu!  Her reply was simply 'we have noted your concerns and will pass this onto upper management', like she was reading a standard 'how to respond to customers who complain' script! When I asked if maybe the chef had simply made a mistake and added prosciutto when they were not meant to - she said that actually no that was not the case - the recipe for this dish was changed recently.... When I asked her how long ago 'recently' was, she said last JUNE!!!!! So let me get this straight..Last June (8 months ago) you decided that you needed to add prosciutto to your Vongole, but nobody thought it would be a good idea to say this on the ingredient list on the menu? I mean you list that the dish has 'garlic parsley crunch' , but you dont think its important to mention that this seafood dish has pork in it!!!  The worse thing about the situation was that the manager was entirely unapologetic. She didnt seem to care about the fact that I had just eaten pork for the first time in my entire life, and didn't really see it as a problem at all. She acted like it was no big deal at all. She honestly just seemed bothered that we had even brought this up - like she was thinking 'oh big deal - you ate a little bit of pork - get over it!' All 4 of us at the table are non pork eaters, so by now we were all grossed out by the entire meal. I mean who knows how many other dishes have pork added to them, seeing as the restaurant seems to be in the habit of adding pork to dishes and then not telling you on the menu. TLDR Do not eat here unless you are okay with having prosciutto randomly added to your dish!

9Eym-V62wQbirzKaYaIWhQ.text: First let me say that I am a real critic of Italian food.   I was very impressed with the food the waitress and the atmosphere. Our meal was absolutely excellent!  They served fresh baked bread with amazing olive oil.   The tomato bisque soup was the best I ever had.   We also had a salad and pizza - Magnifico   Definitely will come back

3hZAdTF4vc4HAygb5Csr1w.text: The food was delicious, the ambiance was ambient and the service was fabulous. We were on a short time limit because we were heading the do the zip line, and our waitress was super accommodating about being short on time. The Golden Nugget is a cool place, and we had some difficult finding the restaurant with GPS because nothing really says its in the nugget. So we went around the block a few times, but we were really just working up an appetite.

QHRGJ4oUSfH2Z_qWwC21KA.text: Anywhere else in the world this would be an easy four star establishment, but with soooooo many options within the Hotel let alone Las Vegas 3 is as good as it gets.  Pro's: Decent value with reasonably  (I'm using the "new" Vegas standard here) priced drinks and meals. Service was also exceptional.   Con's: The drink prices are still high ($15 for a shot of Knob Creek). The food, while far from bad is not memory making either.

9YMwwTcVkA3MHUg4uis0PA.text: I visited on a hot Saturday afternoon for 1:45 PM late lunch.  My friend was fiending for Fettuccine Alfredo and we were in the Downtown area for the day.  Service: 2/5 Our waitress tried her best, but didn't keep the drinks and water filled on a very hot day.  For lunch they sat us across in a dining area across the walkway of the main dining room which was very warm because of the glass walls right by the pool.  The food came out timely but we had to find her on numerous occasions for drinks and to eventually close out the bill.  Food: 3/5 The calamari portion was large and very good,  Tasty and cooked perfectly.  My rigatoni was very good.  The sauce and the pasta were great and complimented each other well.  My friend ordered the chicken fettuccine alfredo and she added shrimp to the dish.  The shrimp and the chicken were fine but the sauce and the pasta were average at best.  The sauce didn't have enough cheese and the pasta seemed liked something you could buy at the grocery store and unfortunately didn't meet our expectations.  The Cheesecake topped with strawberry sauce was excellent.  Big slice and was the perfect amount of creaminess for a cheesecake.  Value: 3/5 The lunch chicken fettuccine alfredo was $16 and adding shrimp was an additional $9.95.  If the sauce and pasta were better, I might be ok with this as they gave good portions of shrimp and chicken.  The Rigatoni at $18 was fine but I've had better for similar pricing.  With so many great Italian food options in Las Vegas, they're falling a little short in terms of what you pay for vs what you receive.  Tito's and Tonics were $10.50 a drink here.  Ambiance: 3/5 The Main dining room looked nice, but they sat all but two parties in the area across the way by the pool.  I'm sure it's a different ambiance in the dining room at night but I'm rating on sitting in the hotter area by the glass walls overlooking the pool.  Summary: I feel like this is one of those restaurants where their best performance comes out in the evening.  If I'm in the area for an evening and I'm feeling Italian food, I'm willing to see how the dinner experience is as compared to their average mid-afternoon lunch.  Italian food downtown as in life, timing is crucial sometimes.  Enjoy... =)

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $8 for the cheesecake. highly recommended! =)
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fettucine Alfredo $16 + Shrimp $9.95 = $25.95. Shrimp and chicken were good, sauce was just  ok.
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Rigatoni $18. Tasty, pasta was great

mKp3Dt1WERcQzuW-oo1xfQ.text: First time here. Thought we would try it because it had great reviews but we were sorely disappointed. The service was so slow and the food wasn't even warm! My pasta was delivered cold. So we asked for the manager and she came over and credited our two dishes that were not to proper temperature and made things right. I will give them another try if I'm ever back in Vegas.

joG38TSJgLQs9pgHK0hKAQ.text: The casual atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for. The service was great and timely. The entrees were as expected and delicious. Our only complaint is the Creme Brulee we ordered was not done correctly. It was served cold and the top candied layer was not flambeed so it was soft and not as one would expect of an experienced Italian restaurant.

Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YOsmL8inL5n055YzECrcVw.text: Came here looking for something sit down and a bit "nicer" as we were staying at the Downtown Grand. Both the ambiance and the food was just okay to me. Service was great, we had a nice view of the pool and tank, but I found the food at Maggiano's better and probably cheaper too!   We had the prosciutto wrapped sea bass over veggies/potato - the veggies were really good. I think my husband had the mistake of of asking for his fish more well done than seared coz then the prosciutto was over done (and kinda tasted burned/fuel) and did no justice to the fish. I just had crispy risotto and meatballs. Both were good but nothing to write home about or something I couldn't make myself.   The service really makes this place stand out. With so many places to try in Vegas, I don't think I'd come back here anytime soon but it is a safe choice if you're pressed for time and are in the hotel.

ld9iGEXXUllyvbWrsKSdaQ.text: Great Happy Hour experience!! Special thanks to Elizabeth our server and Miguel the pizza master of the house! Cheers!!

VSQmzTo3F6frIK-gFTpxIA.text: Came here 3/1/2016 Tuesday night. Had great service. 5 minutes left of happy hour. Got us 2 drinks a piece and a pizza. Love Love Love the Meatzza Pizza. 8 bucks during happy hour. Came again tonight awesome service. So fast got us more drinks and more pizza. Love it! Not good for kids but Great for date night. Rite by the pool, a great location. It's a must try if you are in the Golden Nugget! I will be back!

DpecaxdFX8llmhtNnbMktw.text: Very good food, we really enjoyed ourselves, the drinks were excellent, the wait staff were very nice and the restaurant has quaint ambience.

Ba8bJvJ-HT6tdR3SZe-QKQ.text: This dining experience was absolutely atrocious due to the service and ambiance.  Definitely not a destination dining spot.  If your next stop after Grotto is within walking distance, fine, but it's certainly not worth getting in a cab and driving downtown from the LV strip.   It literally took 35 minutes to receive our fried calamari appetizer unfortunately, it wasn't worth the wait since the dish was  overcooked (rubbery) and extremely salty.   For my entree, I ordered the Veal Kickerillo. The menu description read: Parmesan-crusted scaloppine with mushrooms & a touch of lemon served with fettuccine Alfredo. What I received was 4 small and paper thin medallions all the exact same size with 1 slice of a mushroom on top. I honestly believe there was more breading than veal.   The highlight of the evening was when a homeless women approached our table for money. Right in the middle of the dining room.

e1OU4ImsDHCkYY-tzhlzAQ.text: I was hoping that this place would be good as there are not a lot of Italian places in the downtown area.  We had a large party, 20 people, so we split up into 2 tables.  They accommodated us and that we were thankful for.  I had the rigatoni with mushrooms and cream sauce and it didn't have much taste to it.  The appetizers were good, the bruschetta and stuffed mushrooms.  Others had the spaghetti and meatballs, but shared that there was not much taste to the sauce.   I wish I could report better.

1ZZ9fFL_hWAr8DeqfVPZkw.text: Love the Grotto salad with extra tomatos.Friend had the penne and liked it. Lunch The Grotto salad is $8.

ezogRPs5wjbAPhyut7IRUQ.text: We enjoyed our delicious meal on our visit to the restaurant. Our server Angela was awesome. She is such a pleasure and made sure our meal was exactly had what we expected. Robert the manager was also a pleasure to talk to.

EA9s3w5XRFNgql8VU5m0Sg.text: In order to get 5 stars I really have to be wooed so to speak. However this restaurant was great. The server was on point and the pizza was some of the best pizza I have ever eaten. The crust was nice thin and airy. Probably will be a must have every time I want pizza in Vegas. We also had wings. They were good. They have their own flavor combinations for their wings. So thats was a plus. I like to experience different and new things. This was definitely a  pleasurable one. Give it a go. You wont be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really good pizza!!!

sxUPc12eN8TllVyYXhbawg.text: Excellent food with exemplary service.  Jennine provides expert guidance, professional service, and has more training and knowledge that this particular menu and venue can contain. Great pizza, pasta, wine, and dessert! Don't miss the calamari.  Magnifique! We will always return to this location, and expect greatness. An added plus-- dinner and a show! Tables overlook the Golden Nugget pool, a vibrant show of a large variety of curiosity and humanity.  Enjoy!

ADGFKmpQK8mkJ_k0pAINWQ.text: We came here while exploring freemont street. First off we just grabbed a table in the bar area, which I wouldn't recommend because it backed up to slot machines and people sat down there smoking like chimneys after we got there. (Restaurant is smoke free) all of our meals were great for a reasonably priced meal with good portion sizes and fresh bread. Our service was decent up until the end when she took 10 minute to come get our credit cards to run.

Y7Abc9bnm93p3HNQi6LsTg.text: We dined at Grotto last Sunday for lunch and, like our last visit, it did not disappoint.    We had the Lobster Bisque and Spaghetti & Meatballs. Both were good.    The grilled Chicken and Marinara sandwich is also delicious too. Try it if you come here. You won't regret it.   They also have good salads.   Another excellent visit.

u0f_yrrRdm-oLOuMGrT9uw.text: We hadn't been down to the Golden Nugget for awhile and so we decided to head over and have dinner at the Grotto.    We were quite surprised how busy the whole place was for a Sunday night,  Good for the hotels bottom line, but it was just too busy and a bit too noisy for our liking.  We were seated fairly quickly, (we'd made a reservation) and the hostess was pleasant and provided good service.  It took a bit of a wait for our waitress Carol to get around to us, but when she did, she provided good, friendly and courteous professional service.  The only negative we experienced is that my wife found her dish the Mahi, to be a bit off putting since we hadn't paid attention to the description on the menu.  We called over Neil the manager on duty and he explained the fish was wrapped in angel hair pasta.  (Who ever thought up that idea in our view has a screw loose!  It made the fish yucky to look at and taste). Neil kindly offered to make up a new order without the pasta and it came back perfect.  Much nicer to have a nice piece of fish cooked simply with sauce rather than some sort of pasta concoction wrapping it.  With the pasta it covered the quality of the fish, without it the fish was quite nice and very well done.  Neil, also offered us a comped dessert which we took him up on after we spent some time in the casino.  The tiramisu was yummy and Neil came by and greeted us again, which was quite nice.  Overall, I'd rate our whole experience a B+ on a grading scale.  Quite pleasant, with some minor room for improvements.

HBnGC8_Rz9LwfGf2OEcqTA.text: Great restaurant and service at this nice Italian Bistro in the Golden Nugget Downtown. We sat looking out at the pool at dusk.  Great good,  service and views. Highly Recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

EcYlgYz0uR0M6BetxNCXgQ.text: I could not include pictures of the food, because it was so good we ate it that fast! The chicken marsala was done to perfection, and the sausage rigatoni was incredible as well. The Cabernet I got was a perfect complement, tasted just delicious. Arturo was a great waiter with a nice smile. I absolutely would recommend this restaurant to  a couple,crowd or even a family.

nka421g5NFBsEtTKuE76TQ.text: Wanted to check out Fremont St in Vegas so drove over to Golden Nugget & stumbled upon Grotto. Ordered their Bruschetta which was SERIOUSLY THE BEST EVER!!! It was so fresh & delicious and had a balsamic glaze drizzled o er the tip which was divine! Our server, Jason was a True professional...exceptional service!!! We ordered their Meatza pizza and a small Italian salad. Both were delicious! I highly recommend the place if your up for some great Italian food! They have their own pizza ovens, a nice bar area & deserts to die for!!!

C7AIUcTM9KoxRhtR1kuKIg.text: Wonderful service and food from another restaurant in the Landry Group stable. Wood-Fired pizza with roasted chicken, basil, caramelized onions, and goat cheese...AMAZING!!

6VH_sUg2X7uouMeiFENKEA.text: Had the chicken parm and it was pretty good. Nothing spectacular but the portion size was good and it hit the spot. Not a bad place for a decent meal downtown.

zLlkFzAvzM4uRqX-d87C5Q.text: Phenomenal. I am quite the snob when it comes to Italian food, but this place is a gem. After walking around Fremont street for an hour looking for a place to eat, we stumbled upon this place and the exquisite aroma of the food is what drew us in. For a party of 5 on a Saturday night with no reservation we we're sat right away.  What impresses me in any restaurant is a server who is passionate about what they serve and ours was just that. She was knowledgable about the wine and food pairings and recommended great dishes.  Antipasti- 5 stars Cannelloni Di Pollo- 4 stars Chicken Picatta- 4 stars Tiramisu- 5 stars But what blew me away was the Margherita Pizza. Wow. Thin, crispy crispy baked in a stone oven. Just wow. And the flavor is to die for. I'd go back I Vegas just for this pizza. Very romantic seating, worth getting dressed up for.

Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasto... SO GOOD.
