zlmXQoxjwmyycqOCKN0Kbg.text: Food was good, service wasn't all that great. We asked for iced tea and never got it (but it wasn't in the bill so I guess that's ok). I recommend this place to eat. Reasonably priced and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan 20 bucks

jZcCakSS0m6iWbaELG5-Ig.text: Dammit, the restaurant is good!  I've had excellent pizzas and pastas there every time I've stayed at the Nug.  But even better is to hang at the bar, and enjoy the Grotto while you get all blotto.    Full menu is available at the bar, the staff is funny as hell, and occasional wine refills are included.

QbnlAjvOuM9jKlsxw5E-rg.text: What can I say...gotta love the Golden Nugget. Lunch at Grotto right by the pool is a great way to do a business meeting.  Delicious food, friendly staff, and great atmosphere.

LSigOi1BcCquN_yzRPmaWQ.text: In short, the Grotto was about as close as you can get to fine dining near Fremont street.  My wife and I split the Mahi and Lobster Bisque.  Both were fantastic.    I asked if there would be a plate sharing charge, the waiter says, no, we just require a smile.  They split the bisque into two smaller bowls and they did the same for the dinner.    Everything tasted great and the service was as expected.  They brought out the dessert cart, which included chocolate cake, a cheese cake, a 7 layer strawberry wedding cake and espresso with biscotti.  We had to pass because we were full.  Next time we will get you, dessert cart.  Next time.

X9LhtRkRhaz76CKty-1n3Q.text: The Grotto has solid service, solid food, and an interesting view of a shark aquarium. For all that, it's just one of many restaurants in a casino in downtown Vegas. The one thing that stood out to me was the cappuccino. It was very good...and I can be quite a coffee snob.  :-)

MrfKa8TlZAbPf6FgtwfUPQ.text: Both service and food were good.  Sat in the bar for Sunday football and the waiter made some great suggestions on what to order and never let our drinks get empty.

6yU2ijslseOSSznRpDSKEQ.text: It's a family dinner on the Old Vegas Strip. Not a bad choice for a late nite dinner after walking all night.

x2PcIBgYML60Yli1nMOfLQ.text: The sea bass was amazing!  Served with asparagus & corm salsa.  Yummy!  The $5 martini's were delish as well!

eJaf3w1TUOKM5tpzTZhn5g.text: We went because of the many reviews and it was near the hotel where our friends were staying. Pleasantly surprised by the pretty interior and our table had a wonderful view of the pool & shark tank.   None of us had starters but a basket of bread was brought to the table along with some olive oil. NOTHING special about the bread-it could have came from Smith's or Albertson's...   I had the Cannelloni (17.99) which was stuffed with chicken and spinach, with bechamel and marinara sauce. The plate was served with 2 cannellonis which were delicious. My husband had the Filet alla Griglia (34.99), a center-cut filet with Italian roasted potatoes and asparagus topped witha rich Borolo demi-glace. He enjoyed every bite & said the asparagus was cooked perfectly!. One friend had the Fettuccine alla Campagnola(17.99) which had chicken, mushrooms, peas, mozzarella in a sugo rosa sauce. She said it was very good. Our other friend had the Rigatoni della Sansoni (18.99) which had a meat sauce and is normally topped with homemade meatballs but our friend asked if italian sausage could be substituted instead , which they did with no hesitation or extra charge.   The staff was very pleasant & attentive without being intrusive.   That said, I can only give this restaurant 3/5 stars.  There is no way we would go out of our way to eat here again given all of the italian eateries in town and given the price, nothing we tasted was "out of this world" and portions were very small and only a few of the pricier entrees came with sides (albeit very small portioned sides).

kxLOc5pONdZvKNV9doHI_w.text: Went to grotto's at the golden nugget, it was so good we came back again and ate. If u come to downtown vegas you won't be disappointed here. Food, service and atmosphere is all very very good.

eeCQy_XbtiPGmvFLsh91BA.text: Denise was a great server!  We had 40 minutes to get in our order for 6 people before we left for our flight and she made it happen with efficiency.    I'd highly recommend the Lobster Bisque.  It is one of the best I've tasted in Vegas.

0xG9rBaP-e-LnmAJ7UA5og.text: My new husband and I wed and honeymooned at the Golden Nugget so we visited Grotto many times during our 9 day stay.    Our first experience was the night before our wedding.   We held meet & greet social to allow our out of town friends to visit with us before all the busyness of the wedding.  Mark was the ideal server who made food and wine suggestions that all 12 of us enjoyed!  The pasta dishes here are excellent but the pizza is definitely the star! All of them are good so choose your favorite with confidence!  The meatball appetizer is also fantastic with its scrumptiously seasoned interior complementing its crunchy exterior - my husband highly recommends this to accompany any dish.   The Grotto Bar was one of our "go-to" spots when we done sightseeing and wanted a good drink in a nice environment.  They have a full bar and an excellent wine selection.  The big screens were nice as well and during one visit we were able to chill and watch a Giants game!  :D   As stated earlier, we had several other meals here during our stay (lunch and dinner) and each time the food was outstanding and the service was friendly. You can't miss with Grotto!

X_r_ShPIq4sh-hljQibz4A.text: Holy cow, our meal was a 10!!!  We all had different entrees and everyone loved their dish.  I had a lightly breaded chicken with lemon and caper sauce, it was AMAZING!  My son's pizza was very inexpensive ($5?) and he loved it.  My other son's penne with red sauce was also inexpensive but a very small portion.  I ended up spooning my side (noodles) over to his dish; we were both full and happy.  The strawberry cake was also huge and to die for, delish, really great.  Service would be my only complaint.  Our server was REALLY quite, or he hated us, one or the other.  He would hardly acknowledge or speak to us, we were not sure if he was really shy or what but our food made up for everything.  I would say that I was not impressed that once we left the table he ran over to check the bill/tip, a bit cheap in my eyes, especially for such a nice place.  Make a reservation if you can, and go ready to eat.  Enjoy!!

rIAnm1ReQfZRAmd2_XiThw.text: Great Italian restaurant . Awesome service, the wait staff were very attentive. Food was authentic and flavorful.  The  Grotto's ambiance is perfect for a date.

GZfTsTWDgSO5fNZuvxiOgw.text: Went to this place last night with some friends and I really enjoyed it.  Loved the style of the place and the ambiance.  The staff was very friendly.  The food was really good, we ordered the Calamari Toto, Morty Pizza,Lasagne Al Forno, and the Rigatoni con Salsiccia.  Everything tasted great and the sauces were amazing and tasted as if they were made from scratch.  I would recommend this place to family and friends and think it would also be a great place to bring someone for a date.  I will be coming back.

OlUW7cB-ejdu76ZEPJmhtQ.text: It's in the Golden Nugget but it had awesome food.  Friendly waitress though she forgot our drinks twice. Had the fried ravioli which was very good and the Chicken Herb Pizza that was a okay.  Wish I had got a pasta fish or the recommended lobster bisque.  Still a good choice if you're down on the Strip.

Qjj3bFTpZ4o1qfIQ__dTtw.text: we ordered room service, 3 pizzas, under $60.  VERY thin crust, and not crisp at all, very doughy.  my sister LOVED hers, but maybe it's because she hadn't really ate that day.  i ordered a triple cheese, and it had barely ANY freakin' cheese.  whatever.  I think they try to make gourmet pizzas, but Portland and Salem have sooooo many good pizza joints, that this wasn't even close.

a-bJPr5ykrDJdHTaZsQxEQ.text: The food here is so amazing. Everything we tried was incredible. We were there on a Saturday night and the service was not bad at all. My only complaint was that it's loud, but as it's in the open there isn't much to do about that.

6gJp-qjkaM23zb3t9xiXfQ.text: If you are looking for a Goidelic and reasonable lunch then head here. It's located in the golden nugget. We had salad and meatballs the first time and a pizza the second. Great view of the pool area.  Good solid food

knx2fERJfC2PwbE-MbkMIA.text: We stopped here while visiting Fremont Street.  As an aside, the Golden Nugget has been nicely kept up through the years and holds its own with resorts on the Strip.  Anyway, we expected Grotto to be an expensive version of Olive Garden, but we were pleasantly surprised.    First of all, our waitress was wonderful.  She helped us choose entrees, and suggested that we split a salad.  Hubby had a sea bass encrusted with a pasta-type coating.  He thought it was terrific.  I had a veal marsala, which was very good.  Our side dishes were also very well done.    The desserts were the best!  When you're done eating, they wheel out a dessert cart.  Naturally, everything makes your mouth water.  We shared a cake layered with cream and strawberries.  Light and decadent!    The atmosphere was okay -- we got to look out into the pool and fish tank area.  My only complaint would be the noise.  Like most restaurants in Vegas, the restaurant is open to a corridor with people constantly walking through.   If you're downtown and want to eat at a nice Italian restaurant, I would highly recommend Grotto.

iiPR7dMyzMNB_5_0gAQBBg.text: I'm giving it 4 stars because the service was really excellent. The food is OK, but my kudos goes to our superb server that took care of us. We got there maybe 30 minutes before they closed (do they close?) and got seated with a view on the pool / aquarium outside.  Appetizer: Calamari - Not so good, it smelled fishy. Our server offered to take it back and have them make a fresh batch of the stuff after he saw we had hardly touched it.  The pizza I ordered was really good...and really BIG! Do NOT order one of these for yourself, they are big enough for two. The margherita pizza was delicious and really hit the spot. Also had a glass of their house red to go with it.  This is probably one of the nicer places to eat in the Freemont area.

qoS8qVDyWgPqW7FNamvR-g.text: Been here twice, once with group of 4 and another with a group of  6.  Service was great and food was yummy.  I enjoyed the pizza made from their pizza oven and the spinach pear salad.  Chicken parm is huge with side of angel hair - delicious!  Also snaked a bite of the steak panini and stole a fry from my neighbor, very good.  I would say the only drawback to this place is looking out on the pool in the middle of a work day thinking that it should be you with the bucket of beer next to you soaking up the sun.  Check it out for sure.

CHM6k9ihqUZ5O_fXl4v_LQ.text: Stopped in here for happy hour at the bar (2-6pm, Monday thru Friday). Happy hour specials include $4 beer bottles, $7 pizza, $5 martini and wine. The margherita pizza is actually quite decent. Service is a bit on the slower side but not terrible.

PKpaZxCFG6wU0w-8kNMhSg.text: Didn't have reservations, but not a problem.  Was seated after about a 5 minute wait on a Thursday night at 6pm.  Sat by the pool side with the shark tank in view.  Ordered the chicken parmesan and the veal parmesan.  Both came with a small side order of spaghetti.  Plenty of meat.  The strawberry angel food cake dessert was a 10+!  The slice was big enough for 2 to share and was only $8.  Would definitely recommend and would return on the next trip to Vegas!

jxZEHAxjr9Wy25xbh2XHYQ.text: Super great wait staff and delicious food. Also great drink specials during happy hour. One of the best meals I had while in Vegas hands down.

V61e9aVH65LzSn6Ey9L74Q.text: I am not even comfortable giving this restaurant one star! The most horrible service I've ever had! Food came out late and our breakfast potatoes were cold. Server never came back to check on us until it was time to bring the bill. When she took our order, she completely forgot about one of the people in our party. It wasn't that busy either! She spilled coffee on the table and in the water glass. Did she bring back fresh water? Of course not! Over priced, horrible food, AND bad service. Will definitely not be going back.

J3hFq9g6UK3u-HwWlHEkEw.text: Located right in the Golden Nugget hotel this little Italian cafe/restaurant surprised us with their quality and service. The place gets pretty  packed around dinner time. They offer room service too.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VlFVFaWgvk89hH2pUxJgBg.text: Excellent wine selection, delicious food, and superior service helped to make this the best dining experience we had while we were in Las Vegas.

dCVtXh9Dv4udyhlXCohERA.text: Not impressed, my dinner was bland, the mahi was over cooked, shrimp were good, I would pass on this place, cute if the shark tank was the only redeemable quality to dinner

0M8BqDIIpimkLzHHYZGn5A.text: Joined a friend halfway through dinner so just ended up getting dessert.  I have to say I was very surprised when the waitress brought me the dessert menu only cuz it wasn't a dessert menu at all.  It was a towering cart of desserts! Although they all did look yummy it was overkill and I had to hold back laughing as she was trying to maneuver this thing around tables!  This dessert cart is not needed and a menu would have been fine :-)

ItHlt1K1E0DI5ACEmn_T6A.text: Food was great but the hostess needed an attitude check and the website needs updating. It shows the hours to be 1100-1100 but per the hostess "well we close at 1030 today" (with the attitude)

nqLdJc1SgdqrdPq-FDoV7w.text: Best flat bread pizza I have ever had.   Best wedding cake too!  Very reasonably priced, with a great view of the Shark tank.   Bottle of wine, appetizer, pizza, and dessert came out to under $65.   Nine days in LV and this was the best place I ate.  Highly recommended!  Not to mention the service was exceptional!

t7XTZRNFFAjkdmke0HINCw.text: This place was pretty tasty. I liked the setup next to the pool where you can watch all of the sharks and fish in the tanks. It isnt really close but close enough to enjoy the setting.   Food.. well it was pretty good. I had chicken and it was tasty.. Not the best in the free world but it was good enough to go back. I liked the servers who were pretty cool and on it with drink service. I got tons of water refills and vodka tonics one after the other.. So overall I would return

jrHc9SBN3Gb5JxoneIqbPg.text: Decent food, sub par service. Our waiter was definitely a downer and made us feel we made the wrong choice.

nT32ermDeLr4igqFYpK5mg.text: My family and I had a fabulous dinner at Grotto!  It was my birthday and we received excellent service!  Our waiter, Steven, couldn't have been any nicer and was very attentive!  I ordered the Herb Roasted Chicken Pizza and a mixed green salad!  Both were very yummy!!!  The rest of my party were very happy with their selections as well!  The night was topped off by a wonderful, huge slice of cheesecake!  We will definitely be back on our next visit to Las Vegas!!!

Bjpjqhlx23e5UFDdcrE6vA.text: I love the food here, but there is so much to be desired about the service. My husband and I come here all the time because the food is phenomenal, but if we are not spending literally several hundred dollars on dinner we have noticed they could care less about us. Every single time we go there to grab a quick pizza or some bruschetta and a cannelloni and a drink we are ignored until my husband finally says something. (If we are having a full course meal with drinks and our bill reaches several hundred then its a little different.) It's very unfortunate because that's becoming the last place we go especially when we have company.  The ambiance is lovely and again the food is wonderful but whether im spending 100 dollars or 300 dollars it would be nice to get the same well rounded service.

odby9AdJuI2EJXX3kDMVuQ.text: We went here christmas eve before seeing Gordy Brown.  Honestly our expectations were quite low and Grotto blew them away.  I was in a group of 4 and we decided to do family style and get a pizza that was great and chopped salad for an app and then two entrees--chicken parm which I get at almost every italian place and it was excellent and we got the garlic shrimp that was just fair.  Our service was great and the creme brulee dessert was amazing!

hKi5607o22ID10dV9x_wJg.text: Top notch service, good food, and beautiful atmosphere make this place a WIN at the Golden Nugget!   Went here for a 'romantic' dinner during happy hour on a Tuesday. The bar tender was the best server we had on the whole trip. He recommended we sit in the bar to take advantage of half price pizzas and $2 off drinks! Thanks, man! It was a completely affordable delicious meal. Their pizzas are wood fired with top shelf ingredients. We also ordered the meatballs, which were garlicky and good, plus the ravioli alla vodka, which tasted fresh and well balanced. Overall, the service put it over the top and we were very happy we happened into the Grotto.   When our party of 11 decided to go downtown for Christmas Day, my boyfriend and I suggested Grotto to the family for Christmas dinner. We were glad we did! Everyone was impressed! The service was amazing, again and the food was well prepared. Everything was on point. The appetizers were priced at $8-$15. Bruschetta was excellent. Fried ravioli was a touch overdone. My favorite dish I tried was the chicken francais. I ordered the chicken marsala accompanied by fresh fettuccine Alfredo, which was good, but not the best I've had. The ciabatta bread was soft and hot and the dipping oil was really well flavored. Desserts looked amazing, but I was stuffed. The favorite of the table was a ricotta cream and strawberry bombe, which was beautiful.   This was by far the best family meal we had in Vegas and I would recommend Grotto to anyone looking for perfect service and good Italian food!

9vFTqz70Ry-MoDhv3c-B3A.text: Chef turned bartender michael and basil cutting sous chef roberto made this experience worthwhile. Nix the table for a seat at  the bar where you can watch your pizza being made. not enough chicken on the signature pizza, bit yummy nonetheless.marinara was exceptional. Garlic olive oil for dipping made the boring bread pretty remarkable. Seafood pasta pescatore was fresh and delicious. I loved dining here! The angelfoods cake was truly (with the risk if sounding punny) HEAVENLY.  I love the service and the atmosphere of this place.  The Golden Nugget is holding steady as the best place downtown.

V9l-SoccCS5XMC59gFzazQ.text: This place has some if the best Italian food I've ever had. Our waitress was terrific, the drinks were delicious, the food was phenomenal, and the view isn't so bad either!

M8uBQua_Qq_NjpsuODpQRA.text: Wife and I decided to see what Fremont St was like in the day, so we parked at the Golden Nugget and recently read online that Grotto was a pretty decent place to eat with reasonable prices.  They lived up to my expectations and exceeded.  First off, Hugo was our waiter.  He was very attentive the entire time and very friendly.  I didn't have breakfast that day so I was wanting more of a larger lunch, so I ordered the Grotto spaghetti and meatballs.  Salad and bread first came out.  Salad was good, but the bread was amazing.  Very crusty on the outside and pillow soft and warm on the inside.  Then the lunch came.  The noodles were perfectly al dente, and the two meatballs on it were huge and very tasty and tender.  Perfectly done.  Probably one of the best pasta and meatballs I've had, all for a price that's not overly inflated like a lot of the other restaurants in the downtown area and strip.  I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal at a reasonable price around Fremont St.

aoNfNh9y3cGRDdIbllAQfw.text: Great service and excellent pizza! Try the rotisserie chicken pizza or Gorgonzola pear with balsamic drizzle! Went twice and the price was good! Would definitely return!

24CGCsFJtdOB1Yoi8OD7DQ.text: OLD VEGAS ITALIANO   Came here with a group of my co-workers to celebrate the MARCH BIRTHDAYS.   The resteraunt is located right next to the hotel pool & they have an awsome view of the shark tank too. The decor make me think of how an italian resteraunt looked like back in the days. There were also cool looking blown glass chandeliers. The lighting was dim & the place was packed.  We had a party of 5 & the host seated us quickly followed by our server to greet us. I wish I remembered his name because he is what made this review a 5 star. He was very professional & informed us about the specials for the night.   We started off with some cocktails that came out quickly & he gave us a few minutes to look over the menu. We were given hot fluffy bread at the beginning and with some garlic infused olive oil.  TOMATO CAPRESE $12.99 - we ordered 2 and they split it up for us and also added one more mozzarella-tomato-basil & so each dish got 2 pieces which was nice but we couldn't even eat more than one because they were so big.   LOBSTER BISQUE $9.99 - it was nice & delicious but definately cannot have one serving to myself  SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP $9.99 - can't really go wrong with this appetizer   PENNE CON GAMBERI AL LIMONE $20.99 - this was the dish I ordered & I have to say that it was just okay. The pasta it self could have used more flavoring because it was a bit bland... the shrimps had a lot of flavor though.  PROSCIUTTO-WRAPPED CHILEAN SEABASS $29.99 - it was delicious... presentation was a little plain but it was gonna be eaten regardless. The seabass was cooked to a perfect medium temperature.  CIOPPINO $35.99 - this was a flavor packed dish. Lots of different seafood from clams to crab claws with the flavorful broth it comes in.  ITALIAN CHOPPED $17.99 - the dressing was tossed in & there was a bite of every ingredient of tomato.onion.feta.kalamata olives. Grilled chicken. The chicken was also juicy & not dried out.  CHICKEN PICATTA $19.99 - didn't get to try this one ahhahaha  COCONUT CREAM PIE $7.99 - OMG it was just filled with cream but there was just enough toasted coconuts on the outside to give a little texture & flavor along with the pie crust.  TIRAMISU $7.99 - you could taste a little bit of the alcohol which was great & it literally melted away the moment it touched your toungue which is exactly what I look for in a tiramisu! The decor presentation was cute too.  CREME BRULEE $7.99 - simple but the least of my favorites out of all the desserts but only because it just tasted like a really good normal creme brulee. The sugar crust on top was perfect & the creme inside was creamy soft perfection.  STRAWBERRY CASSATTA $7.99 - my first experience & the light angel cake on the inside was amazing with the cream & fresh strawberries with strawberry sauce... DROOL  CAPACCINO $4.50 BOTTLE OF ARGYLE PINOT NOIR $65  The fact that he lit up a candle for every single one of the desserts was a very awsome touch to the whole dinner. One sad thing was that they didn't offer anything little for dessert which would have just been a nice touch.   ALL-IN-ALL service was great... ambience & decor was wonderful & fun... food was delcious... didn't really realize timing for everything because we came to dine & enjoy ourselves so you don't realize the timing on anything. But i know we were there for over 2 hours!!! =]

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cassatta  7.99
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu 7.99
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne  con Gamberi al Limone 20.99

eTLpH2Hhs7iYpeKkEg9CQw.text: I took my hubby here for his birthday we had a great time. The restaurant wasn't very busy because it was two days before Christmas and not many tourists in town. So I told the server it was my husband's birthday hoping that that would get him a free dessert because one of the other restaurants said that if it's your birthday to let them know and that they would accommodate you for such things in Las Vegas. Well not the case here but it was worth it to spend the $8 for dessert we had that Dome cake thingy that has whipped cream and strawberries it was very delicious the restaurant put Happy Birthday in writing on his plate. The pasta was very good and so was the chicken that I had and my husband Seafood dish I forgot what it was called but he loved it. The chef came out to ask if we were pleased with the meal and yes we were. The prices are not bad and the quality is very good. Just don't expect a free be for your birthday or any occasion the waitress said They don't serve freebies for such occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dessert was very good as you can see we ate it all
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zd6lVS2EF15A8PikAv_pEg.text: Food is always great here. Every time we visit Vegas we eat at Grotto. Angela is the best server, sit in her section.  Sat in Jason's section today and he didn't a fantastic job Got to say hi to James the manager and as always superior customer service. Great overall experience.  Thank you Grotto

if8ER9mqg-eanMXcNx4_og.text: I was excited to try this place out, lots and lots of great reviews; the place is within the Golden Nugget and right across from the shark tank.  We had a reservation for a party of 14, and they were able to accommodate us, our server Denise was chatty and friendly, she asked where we were all from, it was an even split between California and Arizona. She even remembered most of our names, and she told us she was 63, man she didn't look it at all! Life has been kind to her.  After glancing over the menu 1st thing that caught my eye, damn this place is pricy, for a bowl of spaghetti and sauce was 20 bucks, that stuff better be amazing!  Also on the table they brought out fresh sourdough bread and oil with spicy herbs, that was pretty tasty too, the bread was delish!  So after the sticker shock, I went with the Pollo Romano and small Caesar salda (additional 4.99 charge). The Caesar salad had crisp romaine lettuce, garlic croutons, a great tasting Caesar dressing and was blanketed in Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. It was a great tasting salad,  The Pollo Romano, on the menu had great potential, it Romano-crusted chicken scaloppini with artichokes & Roma tomatoes in a white wine sauce served with penne sugo rosa for $19.99, I guess I should have really pay attention to the scaloppini part of the chicken, man my chicken was small, almost to the point of not being there, it was 2   pieces about the size of a half dollar and as thin as a sheet of paper, super small, piled on top a heaping mound of spinach with 1 artichoke heart cut in half propped to make the chicken appear bigger and to the side of this was a huge mound of pasta with minimal sauce, so very disappointed in my dinner, did it taste good, yea the 2 bites of chicken was great in flavor, the white wine sauce was thin and sparse, the mound of spinach felt like it was never ending, and the pasta was cooked all the way but was very dry. I do not feel this meal was worth the price. Everyone was under wowed by their meal, but had a great time enjoying everyone's company.  Sometimes you can't believe the hype of a place, and I feel this place falls in that category.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pollo Romano

kbr4IsAog6yhr17HaRVt8Q.text: Love this place!  Every time my family and my parents come to visit and stay here at the Golden Nugget we always have to eat here at the Grotto. There food is always delicious and very filling. And the pizzas are amazing too!!!  The staff is always very friendly and accommodating !!! Over this past weekend we were very well taken care of by Jeff Kucesa and the rest of the staff. I love how they treat everyone as equals unlike some other places.  Thanks again for always being great!

pMeQewzCKivoWyWELL_8aA.text: Stopped here for a quick bite before heading out to the Strip. We got there just in time before their happy hour ended, scored! Happy Hour runs from 2pm-6pm, Mon-Fri. Their online menu grottohouston.com/pdf/La... Too bad we prefer to drink other types of booze. Our bartender was a sweetheart with a heavy hand. She was trying hard to get us drunk within the hour, bless her heart. - Kendall-Jackson Avant Chard ($10 a glass) - Heineken ($5.50) - Level Vodka ($10) ROASTED HERB CHICKEN PIZZA ($13.99, $7 during happy hour): yelp.com/biz_photos/grot... The herb chicken was moist and juicy, but I didn't get much herbs or seasonings on it. Everything on this pizza worked with the goat cheese (basil, garlic, caramelized onions and roasted tomatoes). I was pleasantly surprised to find that the chef also added sun-dried tomatoes, in addition to the roasted tomatoes that was listed on the menu. YUM! CALAMARI TOTO ($11.99): yelp.com/biz_photos/grot... It's hard for me to turn down fried calamari or fried chicken, so heck yea - I ordered this! It's a bit overpriced, but I would still order it again. Our fried calamari arrived piping hot with both the tentacles and calamari rings. The zesty marinara dipping sauce made the dish even better. Crunchy deliciousness that was neither greasy or over-breaded. PLEASE put this on your happy hour menu!!

oBJ3UNHd54E1OE5Bq-7DdQ.text: My friend and I had a night out decided to try this place. OMG we had the most amazing dinner and drinks. Compliments to the chef!! We had the Milanese antipasta. And the  Cannelloni to die for. We also had the martini. We were so pleased with the waiter"Jordan" and the entire staff from start to end. We will be back next time we're in Vegas!!!

0PprZX_DakYN77A-kmtqPQ.text: Jeff was amazing as a bar tender and food was delicious!  Gold night continues to be one of the best hosts in Vegas for all needs!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place to watch sports!

tJ03VM0Uf8vKKNVLhv8hhg.text: My husband took me here in August 7th 2016 for our anniversary dinner while visiting Vegas. It's located in the Golden Nugget casino.    They start you with bread and dipping oil. The bread was house made and had an amazing garlic aroma and flavor, perfectly warm and soft inside and that nice crisp crunch on the outside. The garlic oil complimented this wonderfully.    My husband ordered a chicken Alfredo dish that was out of this world. The flavor and consistency of the sauce was spot on and the pasta and chicken were cooked perfectly. The dish was beautifully presented.    I ordered a sausage marinara dish, which again flavor, presentation and food were spot on. By far the best Italian food we've had.      For desert I ordered the tiramisu and my husband ordered the cheesecake. Both were very good and had we not ordered the cheesecake we would have raved about the tiramisu, but we DID order the cheesecake and well we needed up being the tiramisu home and took our time delighting in this AHmazing cheesecake. The consistency was perfect and the best creamy texture and taste. We're big cheesecake fans and my husband is a cheesecake "snob" and we were both blown away with this one!    The service was equally as great from hostess, waiter and the gal who kept filling up our waters. Smiling pleasant and went out of their way to make out night special! Well done grotto!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Out of this world cheesecake!

KBFXmoCghWts2GZvtChrQQ.text: Spaghetti and meatballs was excellent , real meat in the meatballs , great bread too. Ate while playing poker at the golden nugget! I recommend trying

nzGmGqUAa5FP_0AhN4lA9w.text: When I am working on concert productions nearby on another property, while most of the crew will bring lunch, head to McDonalds or use catering if the band provides it, I like stepping away from the production, sitting at the bar, watching the chefs make pizza in a wood fire oven and ordering a nice lunch or dinner. Sometimes I will take a crew member or two with me. Last Saturday I had the Italian Chopped Salad with some hot bread. His the spot and priced right. I am told they have a great happy hour. I will have to check that out when I am not working.

3eeRVa_gVNEuJbFF4PWIHA.text: Came here on the way back to our room for a quick bite after a long day of gambling. I must say, better than I expected. Our bartender (Jeff) was just all around outstanding. The drinks he made from the specialty menu were perfect! The mango martini is a must! He was always very personable and attentive. The food was great too. The spinach dip was one of the best I've tried and the Meatzza was very flavorful. Although I won't be staying at the Nugget again, I will be stopping by the Grotto for the drinks at the very least!

QBFO31WLFhD5GBULJTmkOA.text: After reading a few reviews here, I scooted downstairs to the Grotto Ristorante for the meatballs, Signature frozen peach Bellini, & Tiramisu. I am stuffed & my mouth is so happy. They sat me in the fresh air section that looks out on the pool I saw once in CSI with the shark tank. It is actually INDOORS, thankfully, because it was 108 degrees on the other side of the glass. Everything was delicious & Lilly was a wonderful waitress. I went a bit early for dinner...4:30 ish, but in my time zone it was already 6:30. There were a few other customers, but not crowded at all, so no waiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Tiramisu I ever tasted.
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peach Bellini
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shark tank swimming pool, before the sharks are released.

4z8RMF_P9WO3d7XC-YSRmg.text: Two days ago I was spending my last night in Vegas. A friend and I decided to go to Fremont street to look for souvenirs and see the lights so we decided to look up a place on online/yelp. I found grotto ristorante had pretty good reviews, didn't look extremely pricey, and we wanted to see the golden nugget anyways so I thought we'd give it a try.  I don't have a bad word to say about this place but my expectations weren't that high either. I got linguine pescatore and it was AMAZING! I loved that there was so much seafood piled on that I couldn't even see the pasta at first. The service was excellent and I loved that we got seated by the pool where we could watch people go down the slide and watch the Sharks/fish swim. My friend and I also stayed for dessert. She got tiramisu and I got orange creme brulee. I got to taste her tiramisu and both desserts were amazing. This ended up being my favorite meal in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange creme brûlée with a creamy custard, hard shell, and a whipped topping that was obviously homemade. Delicious!
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The linguine pescatore was awesome!

bykKLRFAoyQwFtdb19JGdQ.text: Our party of 9 ate dinner on Saturday 12/1/18. To start, NONE of the staff during our entire stay wore anything close to a smile. Even when we tried to engage our waitstaff in conversation, they acted like they couldn't be bothered. Of the 9 of us, 5 ordered different pizza's. When the food was delivered, there was 1 pizza missing. It appears the waiter either didn't add it to the ticket or it was not completed in the kitchen. I had the spinach & gorgonzola pizza and it was horrible. It had nice flavor, but the crust was not cooked enough and it was soggy in the middle. My sister had the sausage & pepper pizza, and it too was disappointing - only 1 slice of bell pepper, and the sausage tasted horrible. Even at the end of the meal when the waiter was clearing plates, he asked how I liked my pizza. I told him what I said here, but no apology offered - it was like he really didn't care. There are many other restaurants in Vegas - I'd skip this one!

OHHqag0MShFLsxudlUYJ_w.text: Just wandered in and so glad we did. Service was outstanding - kudos to Angela as she was the main reason for this great review. Her recommendations were spot on (get the mahi!) and her sense of humor and attention to detail are 5 star. We'll definitely be back next time we're in town!

g-8cByA0_hKCeAtLLzZpJQ.text: Jason recommended the penne shrimp dish its was awesome. Definitely request Jason as your waiter. We will be back

MalQJsuYxhMvz3S6OvisYA.text: Had a pizza to-go. Served up right-a-way. Pizza is. New York style thin-crust. Very tasty. Would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e04KYRZx8eCDeTKTgQ43yA.text: It was my first time at Grotto inside the elegant Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino.  I was pleased with its welcoming and informal look, and ready for a fine Italian meal.  The Italian bread in the bread basket was okay.  So were the two meatballs that I had for an appetizer.  One was medium and the other medium-well in doneness.  The mild Marinara Sauce that accompanied the meatballs was quite good.  And, a Half Caesar Salad featuring chopped Romaine Lettuce was nice and cheesy.    My mushroom-covered main dish of Veal St. Pietro in a very tasty cream sauce was nice and hot, and very good.  Sauteed Spinach and Roasted Potatoes accompanying this dish were also tasty but warm rather than hot.  Service was very good and on target throughout my stay.  This dinner ended on a high note with an excellent tasting, large slice of Mezza Notte Chocolate Fudge Cake and Vanilla Gelato for me, and excellent Tiramisu with Vanilla Cream for Diane.  Both desserts were very rich and decadent!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu with Vanilla Cream
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mezza Notte Chocolate Fudge Cake and Vanilla Gelato
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert Cart

Q7LZymiaGNNkfDvYktOTsg.text: Good food and excellent wine list. We sat in the bar and our server Cynthia was great. She greeted us with a smile and corner to be quick and attentive. It was a hot night in Vegas and she knew to come with ice cold water from the jump. She let us know about specials and her recommendations were right on point. Especially with a vegetarian. Food came out quick and good portions.

NFfc5Y_iJmCZFJ2PJYwPrw.text: Very happy we "stumbled" on this spot. We left the Mob Museum hungry and a quick yelp search for dinner brought this place up. The food was great as was the service! Definitely get the stuffed mushrooms! Pizza are large enough to share  Stuffed mushrooms, fettuccini alfredo, a margarita pizza and one beer =$51

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed mushrooms... AMAZING

Y_MIdFK23dMyHd-0rCY8gA.text: I come to LV EVERY 6 months on business and try to eat at Grotto at least once.  Friendly service, good food, and a pleasant atmosphere surround you.  Last evening was no exception. Are at the bar as I had work to do and wanted few interruptions. Elizabeth took care of me and made sure I had everything when I needed it, without being intrusive.  Really appreciated that.  I'll be back again this trip.

DqrYLEmB361CHJJQTZgwAQ.text: Our party of 6 got there just as the dining room was closing, but were offered seating in the bar.  Same menu, etc.  Sounded good - so we sat.  It took probably 20 minutes before they even acknowledged we were there and took our drink order.  After we placed our drink order, they took a while to bring it out.  Once we had drinks, our server didn't return for a loooong time after that to take our order.    Now all this being said, he was very nice and our service from placing our  order to the time we were finished/paying was good.  Not great, but good.  The food was very good and there was not one complaint there.  We ordered bruschetta, salads, meatballs, ravioli and rigatoni.  All were delicious.    I am certain had we been able to sit in the dining room, the service would have been better.  We were at a low table so even the bartender couldn't really see us unless she was right at the edge of that side of the bar.  We were overlooking the Casino hall/walkway, so probably not where people would want to put their focus.  Overall, after the initial slow service, the food and experience was good.

AP50Lyc-jA22lSVg667UoA.text: Waiting forever for our pizza geeze 40 min and then the bartender asks us u waiting for a pizza yeah dude u took our order geeze

LtoIwCQlZU_EMjqhLRj9QQ.text: Our service was so good, that I feel bad about this review. However, the food was just not up to par. Our Calamari was chewy and flavorless, with the breading slipping off quite easily. My Veal Marsala was underseasoned and tough, with the Alfredo side sticking together pretty badly. I had the chocolate cake for dessert and it had a really close texture and floury taste.   Overall, I wouldn't recommend Grotto for much more than a glass of wine.

UzLWh8_Zqfa7DdaxAlc4GA.text: Last night I dropped into this Grotto and had amazing food and wine all from the recommendation of our bartender Jeffery. This guy was great. He let me try three different wine samples just so I had the choice I wanted for the meal that I had. The short rib gnocchi was , and the calamari was so good I almost order another one. I will definitely be back the next time I'm

jSA9cbG9W07lsujWfv5oUQ.text: This is gotta be one of the worst foods I've had from entree to desserts.  Entrees are so bad that you feel you can find anywhere in a school cafeteria. Nothing special.  Desserts are overpoweringly sweet.  Will not come back and will not recommend this place to anyone

vd06dMXXYPaZZL8hLbLScQ.text: I loved my stay at the Golden Nugget but this place was easily the most disappointing part of my trip. We ate there without looking it up beforehand so I'm honestly shocked to see it has so many rave reviews.  Food was unimpressive. Neither myself or my boyfriend cared for what we ordered. Restaurant was practically empty but we were seated in a side section across the hall, looking out at the pool area. I loved having a direct view of a bunch of women in super revealing swimsuits, and women tanning with their tops undone, while at what was supposed to be a romantic date night dinner before a show on the strip. Of course, it took a while to receive our food so we got to enjoy the view for a while! Despite the wait, the waitress didn't check on us between taking our order and us getting the food or I would have asked to be moved. I expect to see nearly naked people while outside - it's Vegas! But it is not what I'm looking for when we are dressed up and eating at a nice sit down restaurant. It was just not a pleasant experience and did not start off our evening as I'd hoped.  Some people might not mind the view - I wouldn't care earlier in the day for a more casual lunch atmosphere. But the food truly was nothing special and neither was the service. There are so many amazing food options in Vegas, I wouldn't waste your time or money here.

zKY7kC8_6ABayCTZCY_s9A.text: My daughter and I had a wonderful dinner tonight at Grotto Ristorante on Fremont Street in Las Vegas! We both had the lasagna. It was amazing! Our waitress, Carol, was knowledgeable and attentive! The prices were reasonable.  We will definitely be coming back!!

dBN33lEFSMEr2th0ZdDLQA.text: We were very hungry, walking around for a place to eat. Happened upon this gem and couldn't have been more pleased. The food was wonderful. The service was OK. Loved the old fashioned east coast restaurant style here (giant wheeled around desert tray - the size of a hotel luggage cart), and the food was cooked to perfection with care with beautiful presentation. Great location with easy access to Fremont St, yet a nice break from the chaos of Fremont.

LN6PgXYFuCNxYXr8Vooogg.text: I'm not sure why this place is highly rated. If you are from anyplace that has an Italian American community or little Italy don't bother.   I sat at the bar and first asked which pasta is fresh. The server just explained how they drop in in water. No big deal. So I order chicken Marsala and ask to substitute penne or rigatoni with marinara for the side. I'm next served bowl of rigatoni and thought nice they even bring the pasta first!  Nope wrong meal...they told me I could try it but then promptly took it away when my actually meal arrived. Pasta was mush, Marsala tasted like it was from a jar, marinara was way too sweet. I mean they are trying but definitely not worth the money.

Zy7ycYQHjkYZtSJJOxIowQ.text: This was a great find near Fremont Street.  All of the nicer "sit down" restaurants were booked solid and require a reservation.  There seems to be a big gap between the really cheap fast casual type places and the actual fancy sit down places.   Fortunately, there's Grotto to fill the gap perfectly.    Six of us were looking for a place to eat with no reservation and we couldn't get in most places until late.  Someone recommended we try the Grotto and we were able to sit at a high-top near the bar after only a 15 minute wait.  It was perfect.  The pizza is really good.  I was surprised at how good the salads were and the service was really excellent.  I agree with the comments about the Venetian dessert, it's worth saving room for.  Overall, this is a great place for a nice casual sit down meal in the otherwise crazy world of Fremont  / Nugget.  I was really glad we ate here

xqGUDagU24Qfkx4GErjlkA.text: Great ambience  Located inside Golden Nugget.  Service is great.  Make room for Venetian dessert.

n1In-Y8UoW0GjAngpEIr-w.text: Yum.  Got in late and needed food.   At 10:30pm not a lot of high end restaurants open and to make it worse we went down to Fremont street.  I figured the Nugget was our best chance.  We walked in and found this place. It was pretty darn good!   My wife had some short ribs and gnocchi. I had veal. Both were great!   I can't give 5 stars cus the service was bla. Food came before my drink, server checked on how my food was after I was done.  She was nice and all just not attentive at all.  Nothing that would keep me away.   Just saying.

9TP1VFvseGlj1ubp0DodqQ.text: Stopped into the bar for Happy Hour. It was a great deal! Tried the $4 peach Bellini. It was sweet and delightful frozen beverage. Too sweet for me to have more than one and should have had it for dessert but still tasty. Drink specials were decent but the $10 pizza was a steal! All pizzas in the menu were included. It was probably 8 decent sized slices with a nice crisp crust. The toppings were plentiful and we were glad we didn't order 2 because the size was large. We did order a spinach artichoke dip that was served with toasted bread slices. This tasted fine but was a very thin consistency. Not expected at all. Hence my 4 star rating. Our service was great. The server even came right before HH was over to see if we wanted more drinks before prices went up! Would definitely give this place a try if you are down on Fremont street.

X49rcX3rOsRJZ9o3qUkhHQ.text: Good Italian food in downtown Las Vegas. Food is tasty and delicious. I ordered the carbonara and though it was tasty, it came with a fried egg which I've never had in carbonara before. Complimentary bread is given and the bread is delicious and hard to stop eating lol. If you're in downtown Las Vegas and looking for Italian food, this restaurant is definitely worth a look.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara

fCaDXH91ocKkQh1ahLGsmw.text: Best HH in town! Attentive staff and fabulous food!! Would recommend if you are downtown!   Have to try the calamari and chicken Marsala! Finish it off with a slice of strawberry cassata!!

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HH Cab

AB7H3LU2WYdzEz9KDIgJug.text: We had a great dinner thanks to our server, Arturo. He had us laughing the whole time and even helped us get a marinara stain out!  The food was delicious, including my gnocchi and stuffed mushrooms.  Definitely recommend.

joAwBNQaI_vneQ8_jcitIg.text: I'm updating my review bcuz the hubby and I come here almost every trip. This time great service again but with our server Gilbert! He was great, attentive, friendly and knowledgeable of the menu! I ordered a salmon plate, cooked to perfection and delicious! Hubby ordered the pizza and it was just as delicious as the last trip. I ordered a drink and can't remember what it was but it was great!

UuPi3VRI_5c1cvr8xUwOdw.text: Great food and waitstaff! Must try the lobster bisque and meatballs. The chopped salad is great as well! The chicken fettacini with rosa sauce amazing!!! All and all a great place to eat if you want Italian downtown!

NmNCLi8mYOYikGpJB2ZF3Q.text: I would give this place 4 stars but for the price, I expected the food to be above average.  I had the Penne Chicken Pasta and there was nothing special about it.  If this restaurant wasn't in a Casio, they would charge half the price.  I'm not saying it was bad, just not anything special.  Service was very good though.

xTW0LpelIwgfpgysDuztgw.text: I ordered the Chicken Milanese salad. Half the items mentioned as the ingredients were either not there or just barely there. Service was good. Bread served tasted great until the second round when it came to the table partially frozen/ cold. My daughter ordered the ravioli and there was only 5 of them. The place is overpriced and over rated. Not enough on your order to fill a normal person.

yj8DjPJQW39dsa5weFtmZw.text: I love Italian and this is great Italian.  Everything from the water to the desserts was fantastic.  The water comes with a plate of lemon wedges and mint leaves.  How great is that?  I know its just water, but it really made it taste great.  Surprisingly, it didn't even taste like desert tap water to begin with.  The bread is tasty and comes with a garlicky, spicy olive oil.  Yum!  I had a creamy pasta with regular and spinach noodles, prosciutto, peas, and lots of parmesan.  My sig other had meatballs with marinara and a caesar salad.  Those meatballs were somethin' else.  Crispy on the outside and delicious on the inside.  A great meal.  The best part of all was the desserts.  They brought out a tower on wheels that puts the term dessert cart to sham.  An unbelievable good looking chocolate cake, Italian wedding cake, four flavors of gelato, tiramisu,  spectacular strawberry cheesecake, and a few others.  I went with the pistachio gelato and I'm glad I did.  It was so delicious and a perfect pick for this gelato lover.  They even make it right there in the restaurant.  There is a row of tables on the outside with a view of the fish tank/exhibit.  Make sure to get a reservation if you want one of those tables.   I would have if I had known.  I also saw them hand making the pizzas.  Nice touch.  The service was very good.  Ciao!

EYeGnIl-xC5v_IKG1-Ieng.text: Just so you're not shocked ... this restaurant has the typical casino restaurant lay out, in that it is amongst the casino/lobby area. So while you dine you are just a half wall from people walking around the casino and you look directly into the spectacular pool/aquarium area.   I wanted to say that because after reading these reviews and going to their website, I thought it would be more of a traditional restaurant with it's own space ... but either way, the food was great and I highly recommend it!   Delicious Food - try the cannelloni!  Casual/ Fun atmosphere  Great people/ aquarium watching  Reasonable prices

AkWfRBaZ6sY2vOdQfDyguQ.text: Sorry folks but this isn't fine dining.   I'm spoiled sure. I eat well in Chicago, San Francisco, Miami, NY... and this barely compares with a decent Italian chain restaurant. Honestly, Carrabas is better.   The price of this joint was ridic. I spent $44 bucks on some bland and mushy mussels, a plate of soggy calamari and a meh salad. I realize seafood might not have been the hot ticket, so I tried my friends dishes. More blah. Where did the flavor go? Ive been to some amazing Italian places, at prices from $ to $$$$. Price doesn't usually indicate quality, but here at this price I expected a lot more. Hell if it was half what I paid I would've been sorely disappointed.  Case in point, we ate at Brio in a mall on the south end of the strip before we flew out. Again it was a meal of seafood appetizers and salad. WITH a bottle of wine it was only $60 bones, and it was phenomenal! and a chain! Seriously, WTF.   Thankfully Vegas has some amazing food... just. not. here.

K7XzfrmetH-TUQfshPqzew.text: The best place to eat on Freemont Street!  Their pizzas are my favorite in the West (I.e. not Chicago or New York).  In previous visits I've had several of the appetizers,  salads and pastas.  All were good.  At happy hour you can get the full size pizza for half price.

ZLqtQs4jSijln45E1Kw8QQ.text: Good food, lobster bisque is top notch, good wine and a nice quiet atmosphere.

eq-o-e64PEMgZLBv_hKLiw.text: Thanks to past influences by the likes of Wynn and other corporate big shots, the Golden Nugget is truly the shining yellow star of the underrated downtown Las Vegas scene, and the Grotto Italian restaurant is an example of why the Nugget stands out, be it a little overpriced.  Location is nicely tucked next to the casino without the distraction, and next to the beautiful new pool and fish/shark tank area, and we lucked out by getting a table with a tank view.  Another plus were that they were very accommodating to my kids. You don't often get a kids menu and crayons at a place like this, and my five-year-old could stop watching the sharks.   I had been told the veal dishes here were the highlight, and my veal dish didn't disappoint. Nice sauce, just the right tenderness and tasty. But it didn't quite taste like a $28 dish to me.  Decent wine selection, and the apricot iced tea needed no Splenda.  Desert (chocolate cake) we all share was good, though nothing special. Had about as good at several of the local cheap buffets.  Overall, might have been closer to three 1/2 stars if the option was available. Food was very good, but not worthy of a five-diamond mention and you lose a star for being overpriced.  Best eats downtown remains the Main Street Station buffet, and you can get that for less than half the cost of Grotto's veal.

A89sdUqlI3IUX3FyfmHaLA.text: Love. That is what I feel for this place after having dinner here. The service was friendly and spot on. I ordered the Herb Chicken Pizza and nearly died it was so good. I highly recommend this place!

qAmroNZeSUwSVY8BLvkLGg.text: Dined with friends at the grotto recently, we received excellent service but I wasn't impressed with the Pollo Estate. The menu stated the Pollo Estate was a "perfectly grilled chicken breast". It wasn't, it was overcooked, dry and sinewy, to be honest I've had better grilled chicken breast at fast food restaurants. I do recommend the Lobster Bisque soup which was rich, flavorful and delicious. Other main courses ordered and critiqued were the Lasagne "average", Chicken Piccata "Good", Sea Bass Mugnaia "average". We felt for the price the food should have been better.

8NHISsd0gKhyPNJoqhEqnA.text: Horrible! Gave it two chances and the first night it took over an hour to get our food and they ran out of entrees. Both nights the food was just average. I could have gotten better quality at The Olive Garden and for less money. I'll stick to the buffet next time.

NdzTmIvx1xqXKImANNwO7w.text: Grotto was perfect for a nice, romantic dinner with my wife. We were staying at the Golden Nugget Resort and so the location was ideal. The food was amazing and the prices were reasonable. We will definitely be back.

YM5xMQBrtTvNKtiHZuG8iQ.text: Had a truly great dining experience here. Our server was very helpful with our groups indecisiveness and recommended the signature pizza to share and the garlic olive oil for the bread was outstanding. I wish they sold that stuff in a bottle. The only complaint was the wait which was understandable given it was a crazy friday night with loud obnoxious drunk people rampart throughout the restaurant causing chaos and disorder. If you want authentic Italian food that is not a far cry from downtown, this is the place.

wOvNjh-fR9lDlcrZE9B0_Q.text: We took a trip to downtown Vegas to explore and had dinner at Grotto's.  We ordered the Bruschetta (7.99) which was grilled Tuscan bread served with marinated Roma tomatoes and the Peperoni pizza (12.99) which is imported peperoni, tomatoes and homemade mozzarella.  Both were very flavorful and yummy.  And cheap to boot considering the pricey food we'd been eating all week.

542dyUQfhapjhvpluNBRsg.text: Was fairly empty... Hostess sat us next to the kitchen anyway... Waiter was preoccupied with conversations with what seemed to be the manager... Forgot to put our order in... Food was really late, with no apology...  The food was ok... Pizza is the best thing we ordered... Our bill was $120 for 4 people with a bottle of wine... Not bad but the service and vibe was really bad.

bkLPflWrkaVtdIEKQZeiLw.text: We arrived at exactly 10.30, when it is end of orders. One person told us they were open, the other told us they were closed. But they sat us and took an order, so I expect the service to be normal. Anyway, waitress was polite enough, but didn't know when to leave the table, just carried on chatting. There was an occasion when she called over another waiter and they both stood there while we are trying eat. Quite uncomfortable. You have to know when to leave the table. Pasta sauce was WAY TOO SWEET. When I mentioned it to the waitress she just said it has to be that way because the recipe is set by the owner in Texas. All his restaurants have to do it the same way. No apology or understanding. I was going to order a bottle of red wine, but when I saw the prices I nearly choked. There was a wine I like that I can get (1500 miles away) in my home town for $11 at the local liquor store. In this restaurant it was gonna cost me $55. No way man. It aint a fine wine, and it's only from California NOT ITALY). Wife's margerita pizza was okay though, but a little soggy. Stuffed mushrooms were good but again, a little sweet on the sauce. Overall, not a pleasant relaxing experience. Too many different staff serving the table. I am Italian, and the food is not very authentic.  Do some homework, find where local Italians eat and get a cab there, the money you spend on the taxi will be made up for by the meal. We wont be coming to Grotto again, even thpough we LOVE the Golden Nugget

6MomBs07NfIEHMwQJd6qBQ.text: I should've done this sooner so I could remember our servers name because he was so great.  Anyway..My girlfriend and I took a trip to Vegas to warm up from the cold rainy days of home.  We ended up going  to Fremont Street because I'd never been and I had to see it.  We waltzed into the Golden Nugget to check it out and ended up eating at the Grotto.  The best decision we made the entire trip.  We both really loved everything.  We had one of their pizzas, half something she loved and half what I loved, Margherita. The waiter was attentive and fun and the pizza was fabulous!

sKjU_zmb_HDKrLCgC8D_jQ.text: The food was okay and the music was a nice change from the country music playing in the casino.  I had the special (veal parmigiana in this case), decent but soggy.  Don't know for Vegas but I've had better Italian in Seattle.  The house red was tasty though (pino noir blend).  I do agree with R.J's comment about the food being over seasoned.   Seriously, a little rosemary goes a long way

bOaYenws5FYR9gxlgGQ-_A.text: best pizza in vegas hands down (do not fold em)

kHuVA4N4Bwpr_txM51MVtw.text: Great place to chow down. The Margherita Pizza I ordered was delicious with fresh ingredients. My dessert which was the Tiramisu ranks high above rest, It's very tasty. Service was respectful and pleasant. Enjoy!  Must Try

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza &amp; Tiramisu
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

_J0ub4Q_nq26Pm66xllkpA.text: As far as downtown restaurants go, I think Grotto is pretty good.  Located inside the Golden Nugget, the bf and my good friend and her bf and I went there for Valentine's Day dinner.   Now, mind you, my 4-star rating does not mean this is a 4-star restaurant, similar to the ones on the Strip.   For the price, they give you a good amount of portions - definitely not trying to gyp you.  We shared the antipasto, stuffed mushrooms and the calamaris as appetizers.  All three were really good for what it's worth.   I had the seafood pasta, which was very delicious.  I tried a couple slices of the pepperoni pizza, and I thought that was worth mentioning as well.    I originally ordered the Aqua di Mare cocktail.  It was in the color of Windex, and it tasted like Windex to me (no offense).  I asked our server if I could change it, and he was very nice and was happy to change it for me.  They took the cocktail off the bill, and I was happy to make up in tips for that.    I cannot give Grotto 5 stars because it was more on the lax-side as far as the clientele.  It could have easily been a 5-star restaurant experience, but most patrons dressed too casually for my taste.  However, if you don't care about these things, then go to Grotto!  Have a relax night out in downtown Vegas where everyone is just there to enjoy themselves!

GawyqoBTIajo7dcCcuvknw.text: Great service and great food. Pizza is awesome. Before six eat in bar area so  get same food but happy hour price. Very pleased.

xFWWXwPcipGUcHy-ypmJ-A.text: The food is here is fantastic. I ate there four times in five days. You can't go wrong with anything- except the service. If I was judging this based on food alone, Grotto Would get ten stars.   It takes forever to get a table. But it's Vegas- I get it. However, we had one waitress in particular who walked over to the table twenty minutes after we were sat, and instead of saying hello, said "I hate people from Boston." Well, one member of our party is from Boston and found it especially rude. Later in the meal the waitress was ranting about the zombie apocalypse. Again, I understand this is Vegas, but it's still a 20$ a dish restaurant and people are trying to have a good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jKMlptLj7GFoWJBoD4nmsQ.text: Very delicious. Large plates. I ordered the chicken and spinach cannelloni. We also ordered Caesar salads. My food and everyone's was delicious.  Very fast service as well.  We were in a time crunch to get to our shared ride in 12 minutes and were able to finish her food, get our check, and then proceed to the Uber stand!  Even though it says it's only 2 $'s it's a little closer to the three $'s. With all that in mind remember it's enough to feed two people.

26FIvLbCcyPel5IXFP5yAw.text: Very nice. Walking by it looking for a lunch spot and they had a sign up "$10.00 Chicken Parmigiana Special" it was very good and the service was good too. I would go back.

EDRFvgMIsIDvl_pGkl7UhA.text: We only had the pizzas and Caesar salad.  The salad is nice enough, nothing extraordinary about it.  We really liked the pizza fresh ingredients, thin crust pizzas. The service was decent also nothing spectacular but got the job done.  Very good pizza but my choice would be to go to Pizza Rock.

y8beei0WsRLKWqMki6Dilg.text: My husband and I are staying at the Golden Nugget on our honeymoon. We love Vegas and love staying here but have never eaten at Grotto. It was a disappointment. We sat at the bar and were treated as though we were an inconvenience. We are both service industry and were annoyed to receive brush off service. But that's ok, we understand that everyone has off days. I know that sometimes we both do. Our shrimp cocktail came out and we asked for extra horseradish. The woman who brought our food out acted as though we were asking for the moon. She said in a panicked voice that she would ask (I didn't feel like it was too much to ask?) and then she never returned and we never got the extra horseradish. Our pizza came out burnt, and I could see that the people on either side of us got pizza that looked crispy and delicious but the bartender never came to check on us so we didn't have an opportunity to point it out. We were planning on coming back down for a sit down dinner but after this afternoon I don't think we'll be back.

Ih5gezBg6tBljwI8qAFDsA.text: I came here with a large dinner party and where we were seated in the room to the left of check in.  That night it seemed to consist of just large parties.  So as far as being located in Vegas downtown I think it's a great venue for celebratory occasions.  I only tried three items, the bread, artichoke & spinach dip, and the Cannelloni di Pollo.  It would have been nice to have vinegar on the table along with the oil for the bread.  I thought the artichoke and spinach dip was okay.  I found it to be a little watery for my taste.  I enjoyed my Cannelloni di Pollo.  It was only an an appetizer portion but after stuffing my face with bread it was the perfect portion.  Being that it was a large party I was pleasantly surprised that the waitress gave us all separate checks.  I know none of us were expecting that as we were prepared with cash.    Will I go here again?  Probably not.  There is just much better Italian food in Vegas at a much better price point.

PZ6uLYWH94VMzxjSdz_r6Q.text: Food was cold, food is mediocre. Unless you're drunk or have no taste buds this might be your spot. Pizza was good at least that's the only thing that gave this a 3

GhHQm8NcS_q-4IGCNB8iqw.text: While in town for a mother/daughter weekend, my 21 year old and her friend were really excited to have dinner at Grotto, in the Golden Nugget hotel.  They had found it online and were very much looking forward to eating at a restaurant with an aquarium.  Upon arrival, they were so disappointed to find that the restaurant had just a distant view of a very small aquarium in the pool area.  It was nothing like they had expected.  For our meal, we ordered 2 Grotto salads to start (very basic chopped lettuce & tomatoes with a vinaigrette), a margherita pizza (just ok), a bowl of soup (very bland), a chopped salad with chicken & the half rotisserie chicken with roasted potatoes & sauteed spinach (the chicken was very dry and I only ended up eating a few bites of it).  We declined dessert, though those looked really good.  All in all, the meal was very mediocre and we woud not eat there again.

my2FkVQcRoVYpUCXidkwrg.text: We decided to give the Grotto a try before a play in the Arts District.  As Dana said in his review, this is pretty standard fare in an over-priced casino restaurant.  First our iced tea orders were taken and we were brought some slices of standard Italian bread with a container of olive oil for dipping.   I ordered the special of the day, a risotto with lump crab.  My wife ordered the Pollo Romano, a chicken breast--"Romano crusted chicken scaloppine" and served with penne in a sugo rosa.  My wife's chicken was very good but there was more of a breading taste than romano to the chicken.  The penne was very bland.  A little salt helped that along.  My risotto was good and there was a fair amount of crab meat.  We shared a slice of mezza notte chocolate cake.  It's very rich and very good.  Lots of chocolate drizzled with chocolate.  Service was good.  Iced tea was refilled and the server took my Landry's card early and linked it to our order.    While you can sit along the windows by the pool, I didn't push for that.  The one table remaining along the window had a large man with a tattooed back almost pressed against the window.  Needless to say, that wasn't a view of the pool I wanted to have.  The place is quite noisy from both music, table talk, and people walking through this way to go to the Rush Tower or back the other way.  It wasn't a detriment to the dinner--just an observation.

qP7yCeaWD47-BQ-yN96HLA.text: Fantastic Food. Service is quick, thoughtful and very friendly. We shared a spinach salad and mahi entree. Both were portioned into two plates. Salad is very well done, nice touch with the thinly sliced apples. Mahi is topped with shrimp, asparagus and potatoes on the side: very flavorful and well done.  Special thanks to our waitress: she suggested us to share the food and brought me extra cup of water when I was about to run out of the first cup. ( I need to stay hydrated all the time in the "desert" lol )  I would come back again!

Sm0ishyIqiS-0W6fLcK2Rw.text: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by how tasty the food was here! We ordered 4 appetizers, from antipasto plate to calamari. The antipasto plate was not authentic Italian, very generic selection of meats and olives from a corporate food delivery service but I really like the calamari. The bread on the table was warm and fresh. The customer service is very good and our waiter was awesome (sorry I don't remember his name). It did take 45 minutes for our main courses to arrive. It's incredibly loud in this place and it's hard to understand what anyone else is saying at the table so you will find yourself screaming or constantly repeating yourself and we had six people in our party. As the restaurant is adjacent to the pool if you sit by the window you might get your appetite ruined by having to look at a sea of obese people in their bathing suits, such is Vegas. Each one of was was happy with the main dish we ordered. Pizza rocks and Iove their Ceaser Salad and their cheesecake!

xJuTyy0zqDF49U5rAZAy1w.text: Our table of 8 dined here on a recent Saturday evening.   On the recommendation of the door man when we arrived, we tried Grotto and were glad that we did.  Good Italian food as part of a large menu in a lively atmosphere.  Veal Marsala was tasty and the vegetables were good as well (asparagus in particular).   Sauces, which are a good indicator of a restaurant's quality, were smooth and flavorful.  Service was the highlight, with Denise being a treat as a server.   We had just had a poor service experience at lunch the same day, and Denise showed that with effort and a good attitude, you can turn a good dinner into a fun evening!

jcOTsD0s7cSPiqXk6GuXrQ.text: Friendly and competent staff, good food.  Spinach salad was ample and notably delicious, and so were the seafood dishes we tried.  Staff gave advice intended to help us choose a good meal, not just "sell-up."  Good atmosphere in spite of being inside a casino.

O_FLWyDtrzUPcTofL-Adkw.text: Looking for great Italian food?  This is the place to go!  Located inside the Golden Nugget, it's a little hidden from the casino and if you sit closer to the kitchen it's like you're not in the casino at all. The bread is perfect, crusty on the outside warm and soft on the inside. Everything we ordered was amazing. The pasta with Gorgonzola sauce was amazing and big enough to share. The lasagna was just the right size. The desserts looked wonderful but we were all too full to even think about dessert.

THaQP5YLXvCmFCVpSuK4Hw.text: After passing The Grotto many times and always noting how good the food looked, I finally got to try it. Had a margherita pizza as an appetizer, it was okay. Nothing more. Will skip that next time. But being from NYC it's also hard for me to be impressed by any other pizza! My boyfriend ordered penne diavolo, had a great flavor. I had shrimp primavera it was great. Dessert was the best! Chocolate mousse cheesecake, it was the first time I ever considered ordering a second dessert! Will definitely return. Service was great, Cody was on the ball. Noise level was pretty high.

WMA-vZDbG3zVqbyD9Dx_MQ.text: Leo and Kai were definitely my favorite bartenders here. Super sweet, helpful, and they both know how to make a damn good Pina Colada as well as the best Apple Martini. Will make a special trip just to come here whenever we vacation!

IbLjIU6IAxfmh8m_X3hS_w.text: We had dinner here at Grotto Ristorante 9.17.16.  We didn't have a reservation, but were seated within 5 minutes of walking up to a very busy dining area.  All in all, the meals were average.  Average size, average price, and average in taste.  I had the chicken piccata and my gf had a pizza.  The wait staff and hostess were pleasant.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again, but in a pinch it does the job.

e7_f8iQChr8yveoMKBKO6A.text: We took a family vacation to Las Vegas. One night, me and my dad decided to check out downtown Las Vegas together. Now this is not a review on Fremont Street, but wow, that place is crazy. I was hungry. I looked around and all I saw were more hotels. But by now, I've realized, everything to do in Vegas is in a hotel. So we walked around, walking in and out of hotels looking for food. No, I didn't use Yelp to guide me this time. However, I was not disappointed.   We ventured through a hotel and saw that there was this little Italian restaurant. I'm always down for Italian, so I convinced my dad that we should eat here. We walked in and were greeted and seated immediately. We sat and began looking over the menu. It was dark in there. Dad had to pull out his phone's flashlight to read the menu.  I ordered the rigatoni with meatballs. I liked my selection. It was pretty basic, but that's how I like to eat. The meatballs were crumbly, I guess you could say. My dad said that's from bread crumbs they use within the meatballs. Fancy.   As we were finishing up our meal, we saw the table next to us had the dessert cart next to it, and they were being told their options. We listened in and decided we must get dessert. I get my sweet tooth from dad. I ordered the chocolate cheesecake with Oreo crust. It was definitely the best part of my meal. Yum. They had tons of dessert options, so whatever your preference, I'm sure you'll find something to satisfy your sweet tooth as well.   Overall, I had a great experience dining out with dad here. The food was good. The service was on point. They had a wide variety of entrees and desserts to choose from. I would recommend this place to others in the area!

0P7CaCQ39iJ6k2OeHZj5gA.text: Spaghetti Bolognese , it's very spicy in the end, not authentic, too spicy and way too much tomato. The lobster bisque was fishy, not creamy. Vongole was over cooked . Not impressed will not be back, not authentic Italian food at all.

7VSay3ZqQkZDgNO1SYR75A.text: Super service, excellent atmosphere, comfortable, and fair prices during happy hour. The meatballs were very good. Not the best I've ever had or anything, but very good. The bread was strong (bread is important). If you're into people watching, this is your spot. Just sit on the bar side.   If you go outside to Fremont St, be prepared for what you might see. I almost got in a fight with a chippendale out there.

qN4zqAKnG2yNXoivapLFUw.text: This was just ok. Nothing spectacular but not bad. Waiter was not real friendly but did well. I had chicken Marsala and would not order it again. It was not bad but kind of tough to cut. Wife had lasagna. She liked first few bites but then was done. I thought her lasagna was better than my marsala. We walked out full but not real satisfied. Maybe we just ordered the wrong food.

7uMkOulz8zJPGk_VZ2KYqg.text: I had been at the Golden Nugget pool all day and was craving carbs. I noticed this Italian resturant from the pool and thought perfect. The reviews were decent and the menu looked good.   I was greeted and sat down promptly. My waitress was very friendly and gave me some good suggestions on which shows to see.   The 1st experience of this place was going good. She brought me out some warm bread and some oil that had garlic and herbs in it. It was delicious. I thought things were promising. I decided to order the Mahi with shrimp, asparagus and instead of the potatoes I asked to sub them for angel hair pasta, which they did with no issue. The fish was cooked well and wasent dry and the shrimp was not over cooked. The reason for the lower rating is the sauce that smothered it. It was a weird tomato sauce that I feel really ruined the dish for me. The sauce and my taste buds didnt agree. I would have preferred the dish without it.  If you order ask for the sauce on the side instead. Then you can be the judge.

1z4FYOJNv4N3bNyjkaLSRQ.text: Went to The Grotto last night at Golden Nugget. It's located by the shark pool inside which is pretty cool! Self park and valet was completely full so we were a little late for our reservation but the hostess' Veronica and Cara were so nice about it and sat us right when we got there.   We ordered an app, main courses, and desserts, everything was so delicious. Our waiter Santos was the absolute best! He was very welcoming and knowledgeable about the menu. He answered any questions we had about the menu and gave us recommendations of what to try. He was always on top of if we needed anything- our water/bread was never empty. If we visit again I will definitely request Santos as our server and anyone who is reading this should too!!   *Bruschetta - super fresh  *Penne Con Gamberi al Limone - this pasta was so good, had lots of flavor and the shrimps were huge!  *Chicken Marsala - my boyfriend ate every last bite of this, it comes with a side of fettuccine alfredo *Strawberry Cassata - this dessert is so light and fluffy, just melts in your mouth!  *Grotto's New York Style Cheesecake - can you ever go wrong with cheesecake??

qr-wFpWoVdb7LNQF6iktlQ.text: Today decided this was a needed food adventure.   The Grotto is a Michelin recommended restaurant, so that being said it was a must.   The restaurant is situated across from the pool, so if your seating is in that area, your able to watch the shark tank as you feast.   There is lots of table seating, an extensive wine rack plus modern art on the walls. Very nice atmosphere.  Today we took advantage of their $15.00 (2) course menu, plus dessert, and hot tea ( which comes in a box for you to select )  We ordered the Lasagne Forno, Tomato soup ,Rotisserie Chicken, Caesar salad,  Lime Gelato, and Strawberry Cassatta ( their signature dessert)   The food was wonderful in taste, I especially loved the Cassatta you can taste the almond in every bite.   Our server was very personable and accommodating. I thoroughly enjoyed this meal and would recommend.   Location is The Golden Nugget- parking is garage, street, or lots.
