aUxjyNHo81WME6is9EDl6w.text: Thankfully we had reservations because I'd never wait 2 hours for a table here.  The food is ok, not great however they will substitute eggplant for any meat, so it's a nice option for vegetarians. My veggie pasta was $19, and I thought that was a bit pricey and bland.  However my coworker loves the veal ($25). So it must depend on what you order.  Since it's an open floor plan and right off of busy hallways and next to the casino it's really noisy.   My favorite thing about the Grotto is you can order anything to go at the bar, enjoy a drink while it's cooking and take it up to the room.

AKOMezmaLhbW9PrxasKeQg.text: Grotto is an excellent Italian restaurant kinda tucked away deep inside the Golden Nugget. I've passed it so many times on my way in, out, to the pool, to the check-in counter, through the casino - wherever. But I had never stopped in before during my six years of downtown tripping.   And I seriously regret that now.   Came in on a Thursday evening by myself, having just wrapped up a conference. Seeing no one in line, I first asked the hostess for a menu so I could spot something I liked. She happily obliged. Everything looked good to me, so I went in and sat down at the bar area, which is large and wraps all around a huge brick oven. I was pretty much the only one there, since it was so early (like around 6 pm).   A kind gentleman came out and provided a menu and a water. I looked it over and decided I was hungry enough to do an appetizer and a whole pizza. I asked if he had a favorite appetizer. He immediately pointed to the Three Cheese Ravioli, so I ordered it. I also ordered the Herb Chicken Pizza.   But first, let's not forget that ravioli. It was amazing. I mean really good. And really filling, too. I could have (and should have) made a meal off that dish alone. It was deep fried, covered in some outstanding spices, and the cheese inside was very tasty. I'd order two next time, eat both, then go buy some new pants.  And I just recently started asking servers for recommendations prior to ordering. And so far, I've been impressed everywhere I've done this. So I think I'll continue that trend in the future.   Now back to the meal. The Herb Chicken Pizza was not bad, just a little runny. I think it may have needed a couple more minutes in that authentic brick oven I sat across at the bar. Oh speaking of which, if you're going to sit at the bar, that's the best place to sit. I got to witness a myriad of interesting-looking (and attractive) pizzas coming out of that thing.   Based on the parade of pizzas, I think I'd go with the pepperoni next time. I noticed a lot of those coming out and they looked pretty good.   Customer service here is outstanding. I'm about as low-maintenance as they come, but I noticed my server constantly looking out for me. Kept the water glass full, cleaned the dirty dishes up quickly, and so on.   And he took it one step further when I went to pay. I had a $50 food & beverage credit from the Golden Nugget and wanted to use it when I paid. But for some reason, it didn't open up when I checked into the hotel a couple days earlier. So my server got on the phone, called two different people, and in about five minutes got it all cleared up. I think that was above and beyond.   And so was his tip!  So I really do regret not coming here earlier but plan to make it a regular stop on all future visits.  If you like Italian, I know you'll enjoy the food and atmosphere, too.

yaSQKx4bDZDkEcULHrDDDA.text: The server Denise was great.  Had the meatballs as appetizer and were great. Salad fantastic. I had the lasagna and very happy Do laugh at the fake desert cart Wish I could go back

mTPwHxX4-tJppeqg3gHOQA.text: Had high hopes in dining here last night and was overall, disappointed.  Making the rez on Open Table and getting in was not problem.    I ordered a pizza and was served a good looking, luke warm at best, limp one.  I showed the server it's lack of warmth and it's lack of crispiness - he apologied and took it away, only to bring the same pizza back it's now too-hot-to-touch plate.  They did not redo it, but warmed it, making it more limp.  Tried to eat a few pieces with knife and fork.  Not too bueno.

Dm4-Q_d5vdEWY40yhahkXA.text: The place was about 3 1/2 starts.   I think its more than A-OK, but there are some issues.   The salad that comes with the pasta is very sad.   No taste.   I think all three of us left most of it.   It needs a better dressing, more flavor.   It was just lettuce and ground pepper.   There is more excitement watching soccer on television (sorry soccer fans).   The pasta was very good.  Nothing to rave about.   The tiramisu was excellent.   Had I had a tiramisu and a coffee I would probably have given it 4-5 stars.

mt4C8rtyoVNM1WRktCaF-g.text: Simply amazing!  The food is outstanding.  Love this place and the service was excellent!

Mq5jrCZ3qetCC7E9__hhPw.text: The culinary standard for the price is a comparable experience. Service was a bit subpar with drinks missing refills and entrees mixed up. Our table had one of our party personally fetch the water pitcher for refills. Considering a slow Tuesday night, the lack of attention was disappointing.   The appetizers choices of antipasti and calamari were both excellent. A careful fork full of baby purple onion and blue cheese from the antipasti platter was the killer combination, if you're a fan. The calamari came crisp and tasty.   Entrees included a great Chicken Parmigiana; however, our server was confused with the Chicken Parmesan $10 monthly special we ordered. This was later corrected. Paglia e Fieno was expected to be lathered in a rich Parmesan cream sauce but ended up rather bland. Similarly, a less spicy version of Fettuccine Campagnola was served.   Tiramisu was an excellent desert choice. While a nice gesture to add a birthday candle on a desert we ordered, it was given to the wrong person.   A nice stop in Fremont but likely not to return.

tlUfLdSXGao-VZE6c-5iVg.text: What seemed like a nice little restaurant wasn't quite what i thought it was. ...  We ordered the calimari as an app, it arrived at a decent time but seemed a bit cold.  Still tasty though.   We ended up ordering 2 pepperoni pizzas and a small salad.   It took over 45 minutes for it to arrive! !  After noticing that groups of 4-6 were already finishing their meals i finally asked when our food would arrive? !?!   It arrived soon after that and the manager stopped by,  He didn't have any idea why it took so long but was nice and friendly and did take our appetizer off.    Was nice that the pizza was larger than expected but it didn't set  I'm my husband's stomach ):    My salad was  just ok, simple vinaigrette but as a bit wilted?   Babe that's why it didn't set well in my tummy either ):  Doubt we will eat here ever again after this experience!

-xRVWzsY1GwhMuxeg0g_Rw.text: We were so impressed with this place!   The service was amazing. She recommended a great bottle of wine. We split an appetizer, salad, and dinner. All of which they served already split. We had an amazing view of the pool shark tank. Even though we were seated next to a large part the service never suffered.   We walked in looking for something for dinner and were torn between this place and RAW (sushi). We know we made the right decision. The bruschetta was wonderful! And it's large. Really more than enough for 3+. We split the most comparable thing to a dinner salad, which was more like a chopped salad. It also was more than enough. It would have been too big for one if ordered with a meal. Finally we shared one of the house pasta specials (the name escapes me) with roasted peppers and sausage. Again, it was great.   The pricing was better than anything you would get up in "new" Vegas. The service was amazing. My only complaint... It didn't come up on my search on Yelp. I just happened to stumble in. YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE.

2dgOYvDKMYkqgywXl5sXKg.text: I dont know how this people give 5 stars for the food they must have terrible taste. Imo the Mahi  dish was terrible, in fact I didnt eat half of the dish because it it was that bad. The patatoes were way overcooked had no seasoning, looked burned and tasted old. The fish had a very bad taste to it. I had mahi before so I know how it tastes. The 3 piece of veggies that came with it didnt wow me either. If you charge $30 for a fish meal then deliver a $30 worth of a meal and not fast food style frozen food. The whole meal tasted like they took frozen fish warmed it up in the microwave and served it. Not fresh at all. Overall very disappointing experience for the money spend.

ZM6pMRFAkEL3NUg0zFO-kg.text: The food was excellent, reasonably priced, and the staff was fantastic. Would highly recommend.

F94e6WbHWsNiJBGkk-CvXQ.text: We come here every single time we are on Vegas six or 7 times a year. The food is always consistently exceptional. Two of our favorite dishes are Chicken Marsalis and the Veal Parm. All of the deserts are incredible so save room. The best thing about Grotto is the customer service. They hold a very high standard and I have never seen it slip

Nwx-cg821QouHcxGufhhLA.text: One star reserved as the prices are ridiculous. This is not a high end bar! It's a casino bar for craps sake.... That said. Friendly chatty bartenders are attentive and informative! I ordered Fire and Ice ( cinnamon whiskey , pina colada mix and pineapple) yum! Very professional staff! Will be back for their Happy hour and some of that awesome pizza!!

LiDxl9tyG97seuY5Zn0akA.text: We went to this restaurant a few years ago for dessert and was served by Arturo. He was awesome and the food was excellent. We brought our family back the next night for dinner. This past weekend, we went back for dessert and we were served by Angela.  This young lady was a delight! We were a crazy bunch and she handled us perfectly. We'll be back for the wonderful food and service.

xXilXKSU8kASJ1PpqfBzAw.text: We sampled pastas and pizza when we came to the Grotto.  The pizza crust was nice and thin, with a good char on the bottom and crispy texture.  The pasta portion was hearty.  Wine prices were very reasonable, as were cocktails.  I will say if you want Italian, this is a very serviceable option.  It likely won't blow you away, but the food was well above average and it's worth the price.

qGoF5vOIAGILRbvPea1syA.text: Great atmosphere and amazing pizza!  Eat here every time we stay at the Golden Nugget.    100 A++++

SGWa7Yi-PqdrTeOLAIoaIw.text: Small portions & expensive. Waiter didn't seem to know much about the menu or drinks. My specialty drink was suppose to have candy in it... It didn't. Lasagna was tiny.. Pizza was okay. I didn't mind it.. Nothing special tho.

T5DtLowDQ_AQdSqhQWB3Zg.text: Fiancee and I have gone here twice now! Fettuccine Alfredo is my absolutely favorite dish and this place NAILS IT!!! So so cream and made fresh. All their food is straight up from Italy. Mmm.

TL1e1qu8cxQYNE6ccahkmg.text: I took a risk taking my prom date here seeing as the reviews weren't too nice. Immediately we were seated and tended to. The view was nice with a good look at the shark tank (unfortunately during pool hours views of overweight swimmers are also seen but after pool hours the view gets amazing)  We were brought more than enough bread which is the furthest thing from bad. The apps were brought hot and quick, along with our food. The penne was delicious and hot. I would give 4 stars but having this place but 3 and a half stars is much under the credit it deserves. I highly recommend going after 7:00.

admlpTY6f54e_JpLFdYe7A.text: This place was decent. We had a big dinner party here.The waitress seemed a bit overwhelmed but still was attentive. Restaurant was quiet and had some kewl decor. The Pizza was ok, I would come back to this place if i was in the casino ...

-T2WmXYGjczrzrav8FYIew.text: It overlooks the pool, which is really nice. Don't drive out of your way to get here, but if you are in this casino it will do!  My friend and I ordered a Margarita pizza which had super thin crust, almost like a cracker. We asked for more sauce as it needed it, but the sauce was good.  And we shared a salad. We also had a glass of wine each. It was really quick. I saw other tables had bread, but we didn't. Another table order what appeared to be a meatball appetizer, don't get that, it didn't' look good! Couple other folks looked like they were picking up pizzas to go, which might be a great idea too.  They also played nice jazz music, which was odd since it was an Italian restaurant, but who am I to judge.

photos.caption: Photo of Grotto Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shared Salad, not too crazy, just plain

lMer_25-jDteW53Z_eAepw.text: Wife and I had dinner here and then lunch on the day we were to fly back home.  Dinner was wonderful.  We made a reservation and they were running a little behind, about 15 minutes.  They offered to take my cell # and call me when our table was ready.  It was ready right at about the 15 minute mark.  We received bread and water almost immediately after we were seated.  Kimmie, out waitress came over and introduced herself and took our drink orders.  I cannot say enough about Kimmie.  The restaurant was very busy and Kimmie was a dynamo in action, but she took the time to answer all our questions about the menu and keep our drinks full throughout our meal.  We started with the bruschetta and it was delicious.  My had the spinach, pear and bacon salad and the chicken piccata .  I had the tomato basil soup and the veal kickerello.  The soup was outstanding.  Creamy with a ton of tomato flavor.  The veal was tender with a touch of lemon served with fettucine alfredo.  The salad was good, my wife didn't care for the balsamic dressing, but Kimmie was happy to replace it with the house Italian.  The chicken piccata was very good as well.  It came with angel hair pasta and sauteed asparagus.  The asparagus was a little tough, but tasty.  I don't remember what is was called, but we had the angel food cake with strawberries.  It looks impressive and tasted out of this world.  I nice finish to a great meal.    The tomato soup was so good we had to come back and try it again along with one of their pizzas for lunch.  We split a pizza and a meatball panini and both had a cup of the tomato basil soup.  The soup again was great.  The pizza was thin crust and crisp on the edges, but just slightly not as crisp as I would like in the middle.  The meatballs were tasty, but I would skip the panini next time as it was just OK.  Service again was outstanding.  I wish we had a location of the Grotto near us as we would be regulars.

JT8DmT1ZDnzEkJkF6hA2Kw.text: Denise was fantastic. She joked, she sang, she accurately delivered everyone's appetizers, beverages, entrees.   We had a very large group for dinner on New Years Eve without a reservation. The restaurant seated all 10 of us in 15 minutes.   The food was really good and I had to stop myself from eating my pasta and sausage before I got too full. The house bread was soft and the dipping oil perfect. We split 2 orders of artichoke dip and it was cheesy goodness that didn't last.  Many diners got the manicotti like pasta roll which looked like a smaller portion than other dishes, but no complaints.  They very efficiently split the checks and cashed us out in time. And they were very very busy.  Only negative is that my husbands dinner was last to arrive by more than 10 minutes. I guess the kitchen failed the checkpoint-twice.   We would return, especially to sit in Denise's section and with this large group!

-Lbe93oB-_v7H4eXJf0CTQ.text: Best italian food in Vegas in my opinion and I live here. I know it's a chain I have eaten at the one in Houston before as well and it was equally good.   Sit on the terrace if possible it over looks the pool and shark tank its relaxing and romantic.   Their fettucini sauce is delicious, so is their lasagna and their cheese cake is so rich and tasty! Great wine too.   We always bring our friends here when their in town & it never disappoints.

9O5PsV-sSAS8Vbux_-57Lg.text: This restaurant's happy hour, running from Mon-Fri 2-6PM, features $5 martinis and bellinis plus $7 pizzas. My wife enjoyed a pair of bananas fosterinis while I found happy hour bliss by ordering a lemonade (spiked OF course) and a pomatini. We will be retuning soon for a pizza and the house peach bellini.

HKYen1ukqFCOdm2cE1pEIg.text: This restaurant has good food but a little high price for the amount of food.  The food was tasty and bread was freash and warm but could not get balsamic vinegar for dipping. Kinda strange for Italian? ??? Now the waitress was friendly but she was very slow and the restraunt was empty. They seem to only focus on happy hour. Kind of a shame due to we were paying way more and getting the meal portions. If your in a hurry eat somewhere else but the food here is worth the wait.

BGpWUQIxrBWhmkPSikfNAA.text: Amazing Happy Hour!  Margherita Pizza is delicious - service is impeccable and the manager never sits still - always making sure the guests are well taken care of.  Lemon Drop martinis....YUM!

jU8f_fcACZ5sQSnDdZoxJQ.text: i was contacted by the business after filling out their own, internal feedback survey.  i had a very nice conversation with a manager who was apologetic, and agreed that my order of arancini (apparently he was working at the time of my meal) was not up to par, and the error had been addressed with the kitchen staff.  however- i was offered nothing more than a "handshake" should i return to vegas.  once again- this restaurant does not live up to general expectation.  i'm not impressed with the customer service at this establishment.

UBhDCe4FFtOkoeW6G9FZHA.text: This was definitely the surprise meal of the trip. We went here out of convenience and turned out to be wonderful food. I had the italian sausage rigatoni - it was excellent, gf had the roasted herb chicken pizza and loved it. The italian wedding soup was the only flop - probably the worst I have had (especially for 7 bucks). Dessert was great.  The only thing keeping this from a 5 star review is that we were given someone else's leftovers. We got back to our room later expecting to have some late night pizza and realized we had someone else's leftover dessert.

QvepLnNEPeFFSKG06IOV3Q.text: Had a great meal with a large group of friends. Good was fantastic and our server Jose was awesome. We hung out and had drinks waiting for everyone to show up. Meatballs were yummy and the lasagna with meat sauce was fantastic.

1l5Mr_9p5MmV3nhwTmwadw.text: Pretty standard, over priced, casino restaurant. I had Linguine Pescatore which was really good, but it definitely did not justify the $27 price tag. In fact, I have prepared something very similar before with a mixed seafood bag from Trader Joe's for $9.99 (which fed 2 people). The service was fine -- nothing memorable, but also nothing to complain about.  This is probably a restaurant to visit if staying at the casino, but even as a local I would not go out of my way to eat here again.

KHUJLibVj34-izD-ZMXrvQ.text: Probably top 5 Italian places I've had in Vegas. It's a must try.  they have the best sauce I've ever had

FShtkYeaWs6z7rUiu5EVMw.text: Loved the food, probably one of the best Italian pasta dishes I have had. Wait staff was a little slow but very friendly. Wish they were in Austin.

yHNDelbZ52YkH3GxBfM-Xg.text: Initially I chose The Grotto because they have cable TV and the NFL game I wanted to watch was on the TV.  I had no idea it would be So Awesome!! To start I ordered  the Lobster Bisque it was FANTASTIC perfect lobster flavor with just enough cream and sherry & Chunks of Lobster meat!! One of the best I've ever had! I asked for a special order Margherita Pizza - I wanted the tomatoes added after baking with the fresh basil. It was Delicious!!  Thin crispy crust too!! My Water glass was never empty and my Moscow Mules were served in the copper cup!!  The service was FABULOUS, FRIENDLY & EFFICIENT!!  I will definitely return!

9gKFCjZMUP3qdswBOrF6mg.text: Had an excellent meal with veal parmesan and rotisserie chicken. The service was very prompt. And our server Taya was superb she has worked there for over 11 years and really knew how to take care of her again. I must recommend the bruschetta as it was outstanding. The restaurant itself is a bit noisy and not real romantic but certainly worth the price. Wine selection is adequate and not overpriced as well. Would recommend this restaurant

Jcd-JaJAE3XoFnyigLMfMA.text: Decent Italian American food but nothing really authentic or memorable.  Pasta was kind of bland but I'm very biased since I travel to Italy on a fairly regular basis.  The bar staff didn't seem too enthusiastic but then again I think one of them was from New Jersey and people from there usually strike me as odd and/or irritating.   Oddly the power went out during dinner and the smell of smoke from the pizza ovens started to stink up the bar.  Would skip this restaurant and check out the steak restaurant at Gold Nugget instead.  I heard really good things about that place.

XltbU99tNdRZv9U6qI6VrA.text: Go for the meatballs, I hate meatballs and this are so wonderful I had them three days in a row!  Actually everything I tasted here food wise was really top notch, avoid the sangria though.

KW_xHrKSn_tOLCcifsmLSg.text: This place is inside the Golden Nugget (Which is my fav downtown hotel)  The pizza here is sooooooooooooooo tasty! The first time we ate here we planned to share a pizza but it was so good we had to order another. They serve many more dished, which are also good, but the pizza is unbeatable! Unlike the pizza joints you may find on ever other street corner this pizza is a real treat! The crust is thin and light so you don't feel like you have a tummy full of dough when you leave. Its not too greasy and its just a very nice traditional wood fired pizza! If you are in downtown and need somewhere to eat lunch or dinner give Grotto a try, you'll be glad you did.

BHdX7DcWfuBhqI8PHzNRsA.text: This place was awesome!!  We stumbled across it as my hubby had to watch the end of a football game and tables near the bar have TV views.  It is amazingly delicious -- so much so that I wanted to "yummm" after every bite!!  I had the pollo francese and it was a definite 5-star meal, every bite was yummy!  Hubby had the chicken piccata which he said was very good as well.  We both had salads and the bread with oil n spices were also wonderful! Mix the oil around before you dip and you'll taste the fresh garlic -- mmmm!!    Worth every penny (entrees were $19-30) and drinks were ($6-10, beer, wine avg).  We will definitely be back, want to try to the pizza!!!   Great, great, GREAT find!!  My new top Italian pick!
